original: 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod snyam na /
translated: What is the reason for this?

original: nus pa nges pa @144b ni rjes su mthun pa'i 'du byed kyi bag chags te /
analyzed: nus pa nges pa @144b ni rjes su mthun pa'i 'du byed kyi bag chags te /
translated: The reason is that the latent impressions of the formative forces are determined.

original: gtan tshigs yin no zhes 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs yin no zhes 'brel par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúreason‚Äù should be supplied.

original: gnyis pa brjod pa ni chags pa'i khyad par te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa brjod pa ni chags pa'i khyad par te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second statement is the distinction of attachment.

original: gtan tshigs so zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs so zhes 'brel to //
translated: The word ‚Äúreason‚Äù should be supplied.

original: dang po rnam par 'grel pa ni bag chags brtan pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang po rnam par 'grel pa ni bag chags brtan pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first explanation is the firm latent impressions.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi zhes bya ba ni ji ltar grags pa'i'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi zhes bya ba ni ji ltar grags pa'i'o //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is as it is commonly known.

original: rnam par shes bya ba ni yid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes bya ba ni yid do //
translated: Consciousness is the mental faculty.

original: 'ba' zhig gam zhes bya ba ni ji skad brjod pa'i de ma thag pa la ma ltos par ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gam zhes bya ba ni ji skad brjod pa'i de ma thag pa la ma ltos par ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù means not depending on the immediately preceding condition as just described.

original: chags pa'i khyad par te zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni /üîΩyang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: chags pa'i khyad par te zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni / yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The explanation of the distinction of attachment is:üîΩAgain, the immediately preceding condition.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chags pas yul gcig la nges pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chags pas yul gcig la nges pa'o //
translated: Attachment to a similar object is determined.

original: de la phyogs dang po ni gsal ba'i phyir de ma thag pa gnyis la nyams su myong ba gsal bar bstan ba'i don du 'ga' zhig gam zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ni gsal ba'i phyir de ma thag pa gnyis la nyams su myong ba gsal bar bstan ba'i don du 'ga' zhig gam zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: The first alternative is stated in order to show that the experience of the two moments is clear, because they are clear.  In order to show this, he says ‚Äúsomeone‚Äù in the sense of ‚Äúin some cases.‚Äù

original: chags pa'i phyogs la brten na bshad pa ni rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i phyogs la brten na bshad pa ni rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second alternative is stated in order to show that the explanation is based on the position of attachment.  He says ‚Äúsome consciousness‚Äù in the sense of ‚Äúin some cases.‚Äù

original: nye ba nyid ni chags pa nyid do //
analyzed: nye ba nyid ni chags pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúProximity‚Äù means ‚Äúattachment.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan ni skye bar mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan ni skye bar mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNo other conceptual thought is seen to arise‚Äù means that no other conceptual thought is seen to arise from that conceptual thought.

original: de skye bas bar du bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye bas bar du bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its arising is interrupted.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags ni rnam par rtog pa skyed par nus pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags ni rnam par rtog pa skyed par nus pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The latent impressions of a consciousness that is a similar and immediately antecedent condition are capable of producing conceptual thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa skye ba gang dag la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa skye ba gang dag la /
translated: The conceptual thought that arises

original: de bar du bcad pa zhes bya ba nus pa med par bya pa yod pa de dag ni skye par ma mthong ngo zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de bar du bcad pa zhes bya ba nus pa med par bya pa yod pa de dag ni skye par ma mthong ngo zhes 'brel to //
translated: is not seen to arise from those that are interrupted.  The meaning is that they are not capable of producing it.

original: yang bag chags gang gis bar du bcad snyam na /
analyzed: yang bag chags gang gis bar du bcad snyam na /
translated: What is the latent impression that intervenes?

original: gzhan gyis zhes smos te rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba skabs yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes smos te rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba skabs yin no //
translated: The text says ‚Äúby another,‚Äù and the context is that of a conceptual thought.

original: don gang zhig gzhan la mi 'byung ba'i don gyis chags pa'i yul yin pa'i yul de shes bya nyid kyis gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: don gang zhig gzhan la mi 'byung ba'i don gyis chags pa'i yul yin pa'i yul de shes bya nyid kyis gang la yod pa'o //
translated: The object that is the object of attachment, which is not the object of another, is the object that exists by virtue of being an object of knowledge.

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa las rnam par shes pa skye bar khas blang ba na rnam par rtog pa gcig skye ba'i tshogs pa yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa las rnam par shes pa skye bar khas blang ba na rnam par rtog pa gcig skye ba'i tshogs pa yod pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, when one accepts that consciousness arises from consciousness, there is a collection of causes that produces a single conceptual thought.

original: lus kyis rdul phra rab rnams skyed ba yin na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyis rdul phra rab rnams skyed ba yin na ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that the body produces the subtle particles.

original: ltos bar bya ba goms pa la sogs pa la log pa med pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltos bar bya ba goms pa la sogs pa la log pa med pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: For it would be necessary to say that the body is the cause of the production of the subtle particles, and it is not tenable that the body is the cause of the production of the subtle particles, because the body is not the cause of the production of the subtle particles.

original: ma chags pa'i dus na rnam par rtog pa med pa bzhin du nye ba'i don rnams la dus gcig tu rnam par rtog pa du ma nyid ci ste @145a * //üîΩmi skye zha na /
analyzed: ma chags pa'i dus na rnam par rtog pa med pa bzhin du nye ba'i don rnams la dus gcig tu rnam par rtog pa du ma nyid ci ste @145a * //üîΩmi skye zha na /
translated: Just as there is no conceptual thought at the time of nonattachment, why don‚Äôt many conceptual thoughts arise simultaneously with regard to many objects?

original: 'di la yang nus pa nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lan yin no //
analyzed: 'di la yang nus pa nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lan yin no //
translated: The answer is: because the capacity is determined in this case.

original: 'bad ba dang ldan pa la yang cig car rnam par rtog pa gnyis mi skye ba'i phyir na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen rnam par rtog pa gcig skyes pa la nus pa nges pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: 'bad ba dang ldan pa la yang cig car rnam par rtog pa gnyis mi skye ba'i phyir na mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen rnam par rtog pa gcig skyes pa la nus pa nges pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: And even for one who is exerting himself, two thoughts do not arise simultaneously. Therefore, the immediately preceding condition is determined in the arising of a single thought. This is the meaning.

original: lus kyis rdul phra rab grangs med pa rnams so sor nus pa yin na ni rnam par rtog pa dpag tu med pa skyed bar tha la ba nyid do //
analyzed: lus kyis rdul phra rab grangs med pa rnams so sor nus pa yin na ni rnam par rtog pa dpag tu med pa skyed bar tha la ba nyid do //
translated: If the body were capable of producing each of the innumerable atoms, it would be capable of producing immeasurable thoughts.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: Therefore, is the summary.

original: gcig gam zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gam zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: One or many is with conceptualization.

original: du ma zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: du ma zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: Many is without conceptualization.

original: lus tsam las skye na ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus tsam las skye na ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it arises from the body alone, it is not so. This is the meaning.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: If, is of another.

original: rnam par shes pa de nyid las zhes bya ba ni gcig gam du ma skyes pa gang yin pa de nyid las so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de nyid las zhes bya ba ni gcig gam du ma skyes pa gang yin pa de nyid las so //
translated: From that very consciousness means from that which is born either singly or in a plurality.

original: khyed kyi phyogs bzhin du phyis blo gcig gam du ma skye mod /
analyzed: khyed kyi phyogs bzhin du phyis blo gcig gam du ma skye mod /
translated: Later, a single or multiple cognition is born, just as in your system.

original: dang po ni lus las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni lus las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: But the first one arises from the body.

original: re zhig gcig las skye ba na nges pa 'di 'thad kyi lus du ma las skye ba la go ji ltar zhe na dper na zhes smos so //
analyzed: re zhig gcig las skye ba na nges pa 'di 'thad kyi lus du ma las skye ba la go ji ltar zhe na dper na zhes smos so //
translated: If it arises from a single one, this is possible, but how is it possible if it arises from a plurality of bodies?üîΩJust as, for example, a single sprout arises from a single seed, but a plurality of sprouts arises from a plurality of seeds.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang rgyu 'ga' zhig la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang rgyu 'ga' zhig la ltos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the same way, here also, it depends on some cause.

original: chags pa'i khyad par de nyid las zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid du 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i khyad par de nyid las zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid du 'brel par bya'o //
translated: From that very special attachment means that this is the connection.

original: grub pa'i mthar ni dang po skyes pa'i rnam pa shes pa las rgyun 'jug pa la rnam par rtog pa 'dir 'gyur mod /
analyzed: grub pa'i mthar ni dang po skyes pa'i rnam pa shes pa las rgyun 'jug pa la rnam par rtog pa 'dir 'gyur mod /
translated: In the philosophical system, this conception is possible in the case of the stream of consciousness born from the first moment.

original: lus la ni bzhin du skyed bar byed pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir rgyun gzhan dang gzhan yang skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: lus la ni bzhin du skyed bar byed pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir rgyun gzhan dang gzhan yang skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: because the body has the potential to generate them.üîΩ‚Äú For that long‚Äù means that it is not the case that the potential for the production of a certain number of consciousnesses from the body is not being taught.üîΩ‚Äú For that long‚Äù means that it is not the case that the potential for the production of a certain number of consciousnesses from the body is not being taught.

original: de srid du zhes bya ba ni gcig gi tshe lus las shes pa'i tshogs tshad ji tsam skyes pa'i nus pa nges par bstan pa yang ma yin nam snyam pa'i dgos pa bsu nas yang gsal bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba de srid kho na
analyzed: de srid du zhes bya ba ni gcig gi tshe lus las shes pa'i tshogs tshad ji tsam skyes pa'i nus pa nges par bstan pa yang ma yin nam snyam pa'i dgos pa bsu nas yang gsal bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba de srid kho na
translated: If you think that it is not so,

original: skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be produced for that long.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: lus kyi nus pa nus pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: lus kyi nus pa nus pa zhes smos so //
translated: The body‚Äôs potential is the potential.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.

original: gal te khyed kyi lugs bzhin gzhan dang gzhan yang skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te khyed kyi lugs bzhin gzhan dang gzhan yang skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.

original: de srid du zhes bya ba ni gcig gi tshe lus las shes pa'i tshogs tshad ji tsam skyes shes pa'i nus pa nges par bstan pa yang ma yin nam snyam ba'i dogs pa bsu @145b nas ;
analyzed: de srid du zhes bya ba ni gcig gi tshe lus las shes pa'i tshogs tshad ji tsam skyes shes pa'i nus pa nges par bstan pa yang ma yin nam snyam ba'i dogs pa bsu @145b nas ;
translated: If you think that it is not so, then it would be produced for that long.üîΩIf

original: yang gsal bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang gsal bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Again, clarification is as follows: If one says, it is not so, etc.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go bla'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go bla'o //
translated: The meaning of or and so forth is easy to understand.

original: don 'di zhes bya ba ni re zhig lus las shes pa'i tshogs skye la /
analyzed: don 'di zhes bya ba ni re zhig lus las shes pa'i tshogs skye la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: First, a group of consciousnesses arises from the body.

original: nges kyang de'i nus pa nyams pa'i phyir yang shes pa'i tshogs byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'o na gang tshad ma'i spyod yul yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: nges kyang de'i nus pa nyams pa'i phyir yang shes pa'i tshogs byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o // 'o na gang tshad ma'i spyod yul yin snyam pa la /
translated: However, because its power declines, it is not a producer of a group of consciousnesses again, as was said.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then, what is the domain of valid cognition? It is said, from consciousness itself.

original: goms pa'i rang bzhin las so //
analyzed: goms pa'i rang bzhin las so //
translated: It is from the nature of habituation.

original: rnam shes ni zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam shes ni zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Consciousness means the nature of attachment.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang ldan pa yin pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang ldan pa yin pas so //
translated: By whom? means by one who possesses conceptual thought.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: Or means the other.

original: lus las rnam shes zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: lus las rnam shes zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: Consciousness from the body is the answer.

original: rgyu mtshan med par dogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med par dogs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not a doubt without a reason, as was said.

original: gal te gzhan gyi lugs la de ltar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi lugs la de ltar 'gyur mod /
translated: If it is so in the other system,

original: sangs rgyas pa'i lugs la ni rnam par rtog pas bris pa las sgrub par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa med pa nyid kyis dogs pa'i skabs byed pa ma yin nam des na ji ltar rgyu mtshan med pa yin snyam na de ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i lugs la ni rnam par rtog pas bris pa las sgrub par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa med pa nyid kyis dogs pa'i skabs byed pa ma yin nam des na ji ltar rgyu mtshan med pa yin snyam na de ni mi 'thad do //
translated: In the Buddhist system, since there is no establishment or refutation from what is written by conceptualization, how can there be a basis for doubt? Therefore, how can it be groundless?

original: rnam pa gnyis ka ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ka ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not tenable, because both aspects are not established.

original: gnod par byed pa nyid nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa na /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa nyid nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ston pa na /
translated: In order to show that it is not tenable, he says,üîΩConsciousness arises from consciousness itself.

original: rnam shes nyid las rnam shes ni skye bar zhes bya ba'i phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: rnam shes nyid las rnam shes ni skye bar zhes bya ba'i phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The latter half of the verse is explained as follows:

original: chags pa phyogs su lhung bar byas //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa phyogs su lhung bar byas // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Attachment is made into a bias.

original: de skye ba ni phyogs su lhung ba skye ba'o //
analyzed: de skye ba ni phyogs su lhung ba skye ba'o //
translated: Arising is biased arising.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa'i nges byed nyid ni brgyud nas goms pa nyid las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa'i nges byed nyid ni brgyud nas goms pa nyid las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of consciousness arises from the mere habitual tendency.üîΩIf,

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yin no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi yin no //
translated: is from the perspective of others.

original: ji ltar mi rigs snyam na chags pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar mi rigs snyam na chags pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you think that it is not reasonable, he says, ‚Äúnot having the nature of attachment.‚Äù

original: tshu rol mdzes pa pa'i la yang de ltar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa pa'i la yang de ltar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that it would be the same for the LokƒÅyatas,

original: gang la 'jig rten gzhan med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la 'jig rten gzhan med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says, ‚Äúwhere there is no other world.‚Äù

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa du ma yod kyang rnam par shes pa gcig 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni goms pa kho na las yin no zhes bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa du ma yod kyang rnam par shes pa gcig 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni goms pa kho na las yin no zhes bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Although there are many sense consciousnesses, it has been proven that only one consciousness arises from the power of habituation.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gzhan skye ba ma bzlogs pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gzhan skye ba ma bzlogs pas so //
translated: Therefore means because the arising of another consciousness is not refuted.

original: dang po skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun ma gtogs pa nus pa'i lus las yang de ltar skyes pa na tshogs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs kyi mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: dang po skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun ma gtogs pa nus pa'i lus las yang de ltar skyes pa na tshogs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i gnas skabs kyi mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Except for the continuum of the first consciousness, it is like that when it arises again from the body that has the potential. This is the final stage of the collection.

original: de ni mthong ba med pa'i ces bya ba ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba med pa'i ces bya ba ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: That is not seen, etc. is the refutation.

original: @146a * // gcig gi tshe rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @146a * // gcig gi tshe rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a single conceptual consciousness is seen in one life.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr‚Äù refers to another.

original: phyi mar gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nur nur po las so //
analyzed: phyi mar gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nur nur po las so //
translated: ‚ÄúLater‚Äù means after the kalala stage.

original: dang po nur nur po'i gnas skabs nyid sems kyi skyed byed yin no //
analyzed: dang po nur nur po'i gnas skabs nyid sems kyi skyed byed yin no //
translated: The first stage of the kalala is the producer of the mind.

original: kho na'i sgra ni 'ba' zhig ces bya ba 'di ni 'og tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kho na'i sgra ni 'ba' zhig ces bya ba 'di ni 'og tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is to be supplied from the preceding sentence.

original: med pa 'ba' zhig kho na'o //
analyzed: med pa 'ba' zhig kho na'o //
translated: It is only nonexistence.

original: ji ltar snyam na phan gdags par bya ba dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar snyam na phan gdags par bya ba dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: How so? He says, ‚Äúthat which is to be benefited.

original: 'ga' zhig las skad cig dang po skyed pa yin mod /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las skad cig dang po skyed pa yin mod /
translated: ‚Äù It is true that something produces the first moment,

original: sems kyi rgyun ni lus la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun ni lus la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: but the continuum of the mind is not based on the body.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la lus lhan cig byed pa can gyi rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la lus lhan cig byed pa can gyi rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr‚Äù refers to the consciousness that has the body as a cooperative condition.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni las so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni las so //
translated: ‚ÄúConsciousness‚Äù is the action.

original: 'dir ni mi mthong bar rtog pa med ces bya ba ni lus ni nye bar len pa nyid du sngar mngon sum gyi nges pa med pa la nye bar len pa nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi lhan cig byed pa nyid du yang ma yin no
analyzed: 'dir ni mi mthong bar rtog pa med ces bya ba ni lus ni nye bar len pa nyid du sngar mngon sum gyi nges pa med pa la nye bar len pa nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi lhan cig byed pa nyid du yang ma yin no
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúthere is no conception of not seeing‚Äù means that the body is not the appropriator, and it is also not the cooperating condition that precedes the ascertainment of the appropriator, even though there is no prior ascertainment of the body as a direct perception.

original: // rigs mthun pa nyid kyis ni shes pas nye bar len pa ni shes pa nyid yin par gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: // rigs mthun pa nyid kyis ni shes pas nye bar len pa ni shes pa nyid yin par gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúbecause of the similarity of type‚Äù is that the appropriator is clearly consciousness.üîΩAn utpala flower grows from cow dung

original: ba lang gi lci ba las kyang autpala skyel /
analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba las kyang autpala skyel /
translated: and it also grows from an utpala flower.

original: autpala nyid las kyang skye ba yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ni mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa de ni ba lang gi lci ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: autpala nyid las kyang skye ba yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ni mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa de ni ba lang gi lci ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúeven though it is said‚Äù is that this is not tenable.

original: de lta yang 'o na /
analyzed: de lta yang 'o na /
translated: Even though that is so, then what?

original: skye ba dang po'i shes pa dang / bar gyi gnas skabs kyi rnam par shes pa dag shin tu khyad par che ba'i phyir ji ltar skye ba dang po'i rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi sgrub byed du 'gyur snyam du dogs pa bsu nas gsal ba la sogs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skye ba dang po'i shes pa dang / bar gyi gnas skabs kyi rnam par shes pa dag shin tu khyad par che ba'i phyir ji ltar skye ba dang po'i rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi sgrub byed du 'gyur snyam du dogs pa bsu nas gsal ba la sogs zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since the consciousness of the first birth and the consciousness of the intermediate state are very different, how can the consciousness of the first birth be the establishing cause of another consciousness?

original: la lar zhes bya ba ni bar gyi gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: la lar zhes bya ba ni bar gyi gnas skabs na'o //
translated: ‚Äú Somewhere‚Äù means in the intermediate state.

original: dang por zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang por ro //
analyzed: dang por zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang por ro //
translated: ‚Äú First‚Äù means in the first birth.

original: lus las zhes bya ba ni nye bar len par gyur ba las so //
analyzed: lus las zhes bya ba ni nye bar len par gyur ba las so //
translated: ‚Äú From the body‚Äù means from the appropriated body.

original: de'i rgyu ni lus kyi rgyu ste mer mer po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni lus kyi rgyu ste mer mer po la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Its cause‚Äù means the cause of the body, the embryo and so on.

original: de'i 'jug pa ni rang gi 'bras bu'i lus skyed pa las sngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'jug pa ni rang gi 'bras bu'i lus skyed pa las sngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Its engagement‚Äù means its orientation toward producing its own resultant body.

original: de thob pa'i phyir yan lag tu 'gyur ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de thob pa'i phyir yan lag tu 'gyur ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú It becomes a member for the attainment of that‚Äù means it becomes a condition for the production of the body.

original: ldog pa brjod nas rjes su 'gro ba bshad pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa brjod nas rjes su 'gro ba bshad pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having stated the reversal, he explains the forward order: ‚ÄúWhen‚Äù and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni skye mched lnga yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni skye mched lnga yin no //
translated: The five faculties such as the eye are the five sense-spheres.

original: tshe @146b 'di nyid ni skye ba 'di la yod pa'o //
analyzed: tshe @146b 'di nyid ni skye ba 'di la yod pa'o //
translated: This life is that which exists in this birth.

original: sems kyi rgyun gnas pa'i rgyu ni lhan cig khyed pa can yin no zhe blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun gnas pa'i rgyu ni lhan cig khyed pa can yin no zhe blta bar bya'o //
translated: The cause of the persistence of the continuum of mind is the simultaneous one.

original: blo dben pa la sems kyi rgyun gnas rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa sde ba sbyor tsam byas pa bshad pa'i don du 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: blo dben pa la sems kyi rgyun gnas rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa sde ba sbyor tsam byas pa bshad pa'i don du 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of the explanation is merely to connect the words ‚Äúthe cause of the persistence of the continuum of mind‚Äù and so on.

original: sems kyi rgyun gnas pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni rnam 'grel bris pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun gnas pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni rnam 'grel bris pa tsam du zad do //
translated: The cause of the persistence of the continuum of mind is merely written in the commentary.

original: de'i rgyu 'jug thob phyir zhes bya ba 'chad pa de ni de'i rgyu 'jug ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu 'jug thob phyir zhes bya ba 'chad pa de ni de'i rgyu 'jug ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúbecause of the attainment of engagement of its cause‚Äù is ‚Äúthe attainment of engagement of its cause‚Äù and so on.

original: sems kyi rgyun gnas rgyu zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni sngar gyi sems las kyi ming can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun gnas rgyu zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni sngar gyi sems las kyi ming can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúthe cause of the persistence of the continuum of mind‚Äù is ‚Äúthe previous mind called karma‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe de lus gzhan skye ba yan lag nyid du 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de lus gzhan skye ba yan lag nyid du 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think that another body is born as a limb,

original: de'i yan lag nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i yan lag nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is not a limb of that being.

original: des na zhes bya ba khong nas phyung la /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba khong nas phyung la /
translated: Therefore, it is said,

original: gal te de'i yan lag tu mi 'gyur na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te de'i yan lag tu mi 'gyur na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: if it is not a limb of that being,üîΩthen at that time,

original: de'i tshe 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni dper na gzugs med pa'i khams su bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni dper na gzugs med pa'i khams su bzhin no //
translated: just as in the formless realm.

original: gang la las lhan cig byed par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de gang yin snyam na //
analyzed: gang la las lhan cig byed par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de gang yin snyam na //
translated: What is the cause that becomes a co-originator of that?

original: lus gzhan skye ba las ni tshe 'di'i skye mched lnga yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: lus gzhan skye ba las ni tshe 'di'i skye mched lnga yin te zhes smos so //
translated: The five sense bases of this life are from the birth of another body.

original: 'di ni lus kyi rgyu mer mer po la sogs pa'i ming can zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni lus kyi rgyu mer mer po la sogs pa'i ming can zhes brjod zin to //
translated: This is said to be the cause of the body, which is called the kalala and so on.

original: de ma thag tu skyes pa'i mig sogs pa'i skye mched lnga la sems kyi byin gyis brlabs na 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa'i skye mched lnga po lus la sred pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi lhan cig byed pa las /
analyzed: de ma thag tu skyes pa'i mig sogs pa'i skye mched lnga la sems kyi byin gyis brlabs na 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa'i skye mched lnga po lus la sred pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi lhan cig byed pa las /
translated: If the five sense bases of the eyes and so on that are just born are empowered by the mind, the five sense bases that end in death arise from the karma that is a co-originator with craving for the body.

original: gnas skabs gzhan dang gzhan gyis rim gyis srid pa bar mdo'i lus la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan dang gzhan gyis rim gyis srid pa bar mdo'i lus la sogs pa yin no //
translated: and other states, in turn, are the body of the intermediate existence.

original: de ltar na 'o na gzugs med pa'i khams nas 'chi 'phos pa la ji ltar lus skye zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na gzugs med pa'i khams nas 'chi 'phos pa la ji ltar lus skye zhe na /
translated: If this is so, then how does the body arise for one who dies in the formless realm?

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nas zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúfrom the formless realm.‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat very‚Äù refers to the five sense spheres of this very lifetime.

original: ji ltar zhe na 'du byed pa po nyid kyis te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na 'du byed pa po nyid kyis te /
translated: How so? By the very act of forming,

original: bag chags 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bag chags 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: that is, by the very act of retaining habitual tendencies.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i srid pa la ltos nas sngar byung ba ni 'di nyid kyi yin par brjod do ;
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i srid pa la ltos nas sngar byung ba ni 'di nyid kyi yin par brjod do ;
translated: The prior existence is described as ‚Äúthis very‚Äù existence in relation to the subsequent existence.

original: / don 'di yin te /
analyzed: / don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: gal te gzugs med pa'i khams nas srid pa gzhan du 'pho ba la /
analyzed: gal te gzugs med pa'i khams nas srid pa gzhan du 'pho ba la /
translated: If one who dies in the formless realm is reborn in another realm,

original: de ma thag pa'i skye mched snga ma snga ma med pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i skye mched snga ma snga ma med pa de lta na yang /
translated: then the prior sense spheres do not exist immediately prior to the subsequent sense spheres.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su 'jug pa na yod pa 'gyur ba gang yin pa de nyid srid pa gzhan gyi lus kyi rgyu yin na ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su 'jug pa na yod pa 'gyur ba gang yin pa de nyid srid pa gzhan gyi lus kyi rgyu yin na ste /
translated: If it were the cause of the body in another existence, then it would be the cause of the body in the formless realm when one enters the formless realm.
That veryüîΩexistence would be the cause of the body in another existence, because it is

original: gzhag pa'i bag chags kyis skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhag pa'i bag chags kyis skyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: generated by the latent impressions that it deposits.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is from the perspective of another.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni las kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni las kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is from the perspective of karma.

original: yan lag gi dngos po ni skye mched lnga la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi dngos po ni skye mched lnga la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe five sense bases that are its parts‚Äù are the remaining ones.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shi ba'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAfter death‚Äù and so on.üîΩThis shows that the assertion that it endures alone is undermined by

original: 'dis ni 'ba' zhig gnas pa ga la yin zhes bya ba de ni dmigs pas gnod par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'ba' zhig gnas pa ga la yin zhes bya ba de ni dmigs pas gnod par bstan to //
translated: reference to the world.üîΩThe assertion that it is just the self that is said to endure alone is also

original: gang yang 'ba' zhig gnas par 'dod par nyid do zhes brjod pa de yang 'dis gnod do zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang 'ba' zhig gnas par 'dod par nyid do zhes brjod pa de yang 'dis gnod do zhes smras pa ni /
translated: undermined by this.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the formless realm‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i yan lag dngos po dang rgyu nyid 'gog la zhes bya ba ni las de'i yan lag gi dngos po ni lhan cig byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i yan lag dngos po dang rgyu nyid 'gog la zhes bya ba ni las de'i yan lag gi dngos po ni lhan cig byed pa nyid do //
translated: The entity of the action is the simultaneous activity.

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i ming can lus kyi rgyu ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i ming can lus kyi rgyu ni rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of the body, which is called the embryo, is the cause.

original: de gnyis 'gog pa la'o //
analyzed: de gnyis 'gog pa la'o //
translated: The refutation of these two is the refutation of the entity and cause of the action.

original: rab tu bshad ces bya ba ni gal te 'gro ba ma mthong phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rab tu bshad ces bya ba ni gal te 'gro ba ma mthong phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The words ‚Äúis explained‚Äù refer to the passage beginning ‚ÄúIf you say that it is not seen because it does not exist. . . . ‚Äù

original: skye mched lnga zhes bya ba'i drug pa ni skye ba gzhan gyi lus skyed pa'i bya ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched lnga zhes bya ba'i drug pa ni skye ba gzhan gyi lus skyed pa'i bya ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: The genitive in ‚Äúof the five bases‚Äù refers to the activity of producing the body in another life.

original: yan lag gi dngos po ni sems kyi rgyun gnas pa'i rgyu zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi dngos po ni sems kyi rgyun gnas pa'i rgyu zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The entity of the action should be understood as the cause of the persistence of the continuum of consciousness.

original: de lta na yang ma dmigs pa tsam gyis de med par nges pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de lta na yang ma dmigs pa tsam gyis de med par nges pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: Even so, one cannot ascertain that it does not exist merely on the ground of non-apprehension.

original: de med par brjod pa'i nges pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med par brjod pa'i nges pa'i rnam par brjod pa ni sems kyi rgyun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The ascertainment that expresses the non-existence of the action is the expression ‚Äúthe continuum of consciousness.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi dngos por ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi dngos por ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúin that way‚Äù refer to the entity of the action.

original: tshig rkang lnga pa bshad pa'i phyir 'on te yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshig rkang lnga pa bshad pa'i phyir 'on te yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to explain the fifth line, he says, ‚ÄúOr else, however.‚Äù

original: 'gal bas khyab pa'i dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid la ni dgag par bya ba mtshams sbyor ba dang 'gal bas khyab pa'o//
analyzed: 'gal bas khyab pa'i dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid la ni dgag par bya ba mtshams sbyor ba dang 'gal bas khyab pa'o//
translated: The observation of pervasion by contradiction is as follows: In the first case, there is pervasion by contradiction with the connection of what is to be refuted.

original: gal te lhag ma dang ldan pa yin yang 'di las mngon par 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: gal te lhag ma dang ldan pa yin yang 'di las mngon par 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that even though it is a remainder, the desired meaning will be established from this,

original: 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says, ‚Äúthis.‚Äù

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa las don ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa ni med do zhes bya ba'i slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa las don ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa ni med do zhes bya ba'i slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bshad pa yin no //
translated: The master Dignaga explains that there is no understanding of the meaning just as it is from an inference with a remainder.

original: ji ltar lhag ma dang ldan pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar lhag ma dang ldan pa yin snyam na /
translated: How is it that there is a remainder?

original: skye ba gzhan gyi dbang po dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan gyi dbang po dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚Äúthe other faculties of birth.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par grub pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dbang po gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba las sgrub par byed pa dbang po nyid ldog par nges pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par grub pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dbang po gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba las sgrub par byed pa dbang po nyid ldog par nges pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not established that it is reversed from that which is not similar‚Äù means that it is not certain that the sense faculty itself, which is the establishment of the reversal from the connection with another sense faculty that is not similar, is reversed.

original: 'on te tshe @147b 'di pa'i zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi skye mched lngas skye mched gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi lus bskyed par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'on te tshe @147b 'di pa'i zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi skye mched lngas skye mched gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi lus bskyed par zad kyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif it is of this life‚Äù means that the five sense bases of a previous life are exhausted in the production of a body that has the nature of another sense base.

original: skye ba gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not of another birth.

original: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i chos can 'chi ba'i gnas skabs la yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i chos can 'chi ba'i gnas skabs la yang ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin another way‚Äù means in the context of death of the subject that is being proven.

original: de dang mtshams sbyor ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: de dang mtshams sbyor ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is connected with that‚Äù means

original: tsha 'di pa'i lus la yod pa'i dbang po dang mtshams sbyor ba yin gyi /
analyzed: tsha 'di pa'i lus la yod pa'i dbang po dang mtshams sbyor ba yin gyi /
translated: that it is connected with the sense faculty that exists in the body of this life.

original: skye ba gzhan gyi lus dang ni mtshams sbyor ba yin pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan gyi lus dang ni mtshams sbyor ba yin pa'o //
translated: It is not connected with the body of another birth.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni lan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni lan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that way‚Äù means in response.

original: 'di pa'i lus la yod pa'i dbang po dang mtshams sbyor ba la yod do //
analyzed: 'di pa'i lus la yod pa'i dbang po dang mtshams sbyor ba la yod do //
translated: It is in the body that exists at the time of the linking of consciousness with the sense faculties that are present in the body of the being who is to be reborn.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de yang zhes smos te /
translated: Why is this?

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba mtshams sbyor ba'i lus so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba mtshams sbyor ba'i lus so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used because the body that links with the object of the act of consciousness is the body that links with the object of the act of consciousness.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na'o //
translated: The ‚Äútime‚Äù is the time of linking.

original: dper na ltos pa'i phyir tshu rol dang po la gcig tu nges pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang yin pas khyad par med do //
analyzed: dper na ltos pa'i phyir tshu rol dang po la gcig tu nges pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang yin pas khyad par med do //
translated: Just as the word ‚Äúnear‚Äù is not definite in meaning because it depends on something else, the same is true of the word ‚Äúhere.‚Äù

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshig la'o //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshig la'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used in the argument to indicate that it is qualified.

original: dmigs pa tsam med par mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa tsam med par mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the mere object of consciousness is not understood to be absent in the case of the absence of the sense faculty.

original: khu khrag gzhan gzhan las byung ba'i dbang po yang yin la dbang po gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba yang yin pa'i phyir khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyang ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: khu khrag gzhan gzhan las byung ba'i dbang po yang yin la dbang po gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba yang yin pa'i phyir khyad par dang bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyang ma nges pa yin no //
translated: The argument is not definite because the sense faculty that arises from the other, that is, the semen and blood, is also a sense faculty that links with another sense faculty.

original: yul gyi khyad par bzhin nam zhes bya ba ni dper na du ba'i yul gyi khyad par me rjes su dpog pa 'jigs pa'i skyob pa ma yin pa de bzhin dbang po'i khyad par khu khrag gzhan las byung ba yang 'jig rten gzhan gyi dbang po'i rjes suüîΩdpog pa 'jigs pa'i skyob pa'i byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi khyad par bzhin nam zhes bya ba ni dper na du ba'i yul gyi khyad par me rjes su dpog pa 'jigs pa'i skyob pa ma yin pa de bzhin dbang po'i khyad par khu khrag gzhan las byung ba yang 'jig rten gzhan gyi dbang po'i rjes su dpog pa 'jigs pa'i skyob pa'i byed pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the particular sense faculty that arises from semen and blood is not a refuge from fear when inferring the sense faculty of another world.

original: dper na byas pa'i khyad par nus pa dang sgra'i yin pa nyid rjes su dpag par sel bar byed pa la nus pa med pa de bzhin du 'di yang yin no //
analyzed: dper na byas pa'i khyad par nus pa dang sgra'i yin pa nyid rjes su dpag par sel bar byed pa la nus pa med pa de bzhin du 'di yang yin no //
translated: For example, just as the particularity of being produced and the particularity of being sound are not capable of refuting the inference of being capable, in the same way, this is also so.

original: 'o na gang las khyad par la brten pa'i nyes pa'i go skabs su mi 'gyur ba tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga /
analyzed: 'o na gang las khyad par la brten pa'i nyes pa'i go skabs su mi 'gyur ba tshe 'di nyid kyi skye mched lnga /
translated: If it is asked how the particular sense faculty that arises from semen and blood is not a refuge from fear when inferring the sense faculty of another world, it is replied:üîΩ‚ÄúJust like the particular object.‚Äù

original: lus gzhan skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i spyis kyang ji ltar khyab par 'grub par 'gyur snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: lus gzhan skye ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i spyis kyang ji ltar khyab par 'grub par 'gyur snyam du dogs na /
translated: If it is asked how the particular sense faculty that arises from semen and blood is not a refuge from fear when inferring the sense faculty of another world, it is replied:

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like the particular object.‚Äù

original: gal te dbang po rnams la gzhan dang gzhan skye ba nyid med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dbang po rnams la gzhan dang gzhan skye ba nyid med pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that the sense faculties are not produced from other?

original: de ji ltar na snga ma rnams rang gi rigs la nus pa 'grub ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na snga ma rnams rang gi rigs la nus pa 'grub ce na /
translated: How then can the former be established as having the power to produce their own type?

original: 'gyur ba mthong phyir zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgsal @148a * //
analyzed: 'gyur ba mthong phyir zhes bya ba'o // gsal @148a * //
translated: Because a change is seen.

original: ba ni sa phyogs la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ba ni sa phyogs la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The clarity is the particular characteristic of the place, etc.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i khyad par la ltos na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i khyad par la ltos na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if it depended on the particular clarity,

original: gal te tha snyad kyang khyad par gyi yul can nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad kyang khyad par gyi yul can nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: if it were thought that even the conventional would be the subject that has a particular object,

original: tha snyad ni spyi'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha snyad ni spyi'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: the conventional is said to be a universal.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni spyi'i yul can yin pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni spyi'i yul can yin pas so //
translated: Therefore, because it has a universal as its object,

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i khyad par la mi ltos na'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i khyad par la mi ltos na'o //
translated: even so, if it did not depend on the particular clarity,

original: de lta bur zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba ga la sogs pa dang ldan par dbus kyi gnas skabs su skyes par grub pa na'o //
analyzed: de lta bur zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba ga la sogs pa dang ldan par dbus kyi gnas skabs su skyes par grub pa na'o //
translated: in that way, when it is established that it is produced in the central state endowed with movement, etc.,

original: ji ltar mig la sogs pa las de der ltar skyes pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs pa las de der ltar skyes pa yin snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that the eye, etc. are born from that,

original: goms pa'i khyad par las zhes smos so //
analyzed: goms pa'i khyad par las zhes smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúfrom the special development of the habit-energy. ‚Äù

original: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch as it is‚Äù means endowed with movement, etc.

original: gzhan du ni skye ba dang por ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni skye ba dang por ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means in the first birth.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni g-yo ga la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni g-yo ga la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch as it is‚Äù means the sense-organ with movement, etc.

original: gal te skye ba dang por yang tshe 'di'i dbang po nyid rgyu ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te skye ba dang por yang tshe 'di'i dbang po nyid rgyu ma yin nam /
translated: If one thinks that the sense-organ of this life is not the cause even in the first birth,

original: des na 'jig rten snga ma mi 'grub bo snyam na /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten snga ma mi 'grub bo snyam na /
translated: then the previous world is not established,

original: skye ba dang por ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang por ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn the first birth. ‚Äù

original: de 'dra bar gyur pa ni 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dra bar gyur pa ni 'dri ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch as it is‚Äù is the question.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni 'di pa'i dbang po ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni 'di pa'i dbang po ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because the sense-organ of this life is not seen.

original: gzhan gyi khyad par ni zhes bya ba ni khu khrag gzhan las skyes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi khyad par ni zhes bya ba ni khu khrag gzhan las skyes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe special nature of another‚Äù means born from the semen and blood of another, etc.

original: 'dis ni phyed snga ma bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyed snga ma bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the first half of the verse.

original: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i don du 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i don du 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtsod pa'o //
translated: The latter half of the verse is explained in the following debate, beginning with ‚ÄúBut if you say‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gcig pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gcig pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of the one.‚Äù

original: 'dir kyang ni sgras 'phangs pas lan re zhig brjod pa ni gal te de lta yin du chug pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir kyang ni sgras 'phangs pas lan re zhig brjod pa ni gal te de lta yin du chug pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is implied, so the answer is stated once: ‚ÄúBut if you say‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: bar gyi gnas skabs su ni g-yo ba la sogs pa goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: bar gyi gnas skabs su ni g-yo ba la sogs pa goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong ba yin no //
translated: In the intermediate state, movement, etc. are seen to be preceded by habituation.

original: des na skye ba dang po'i g-yo ba la sogs pa yang goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can du rjes su dpog pa grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na skye ba dang po'i g-yo ba la sogs pa yang goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can du rjes su dpog pa grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is established that movement, etc. in the first birth are also inferred to be preceded by habituation.

original: dbang po re gcig yin nam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan ni don med do //
analyzed: dbang po re gcig yin nam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan ni don med do //
translated: The other, beginning with ‚ÄúIs the sense faculty one or not?‚Äù is meaningless.

original: 'on te goms pa las skyes pa'i yon tan ni lus gzhan la mthong ba med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te goms pa las skyes pa'i yon tan ni lus gzhan la mthong ba med pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that qualities born from habituation are not seen in another body?

original: des na gang gis 'jig rten pha rol 'grub par 'gyur ba skye ba dang po'i g-yo ba ga la sogs pa lus gzhan dang 'brel ba'i goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can du ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: des na gang gis 'jig rten pha rol 'grub par 'gyur ba skye ba dang po'i g-yo ba ga la sogs pa lus gzhan dang 'brel ba'i goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can du ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Therefore, how could the movement of the first birth, which would establish another world, be preceded by the habit of connection with another body?

original: goms pa las skyes pa'i zhes @148b gsungs so //
analyzed: goms pa las skyes pa'i zhes @148b gsungs so //
translated: [The answer is:] ‚ÄúIt arises from habit.‚Äù

original: de bzhin skye ba dang po'i lus la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin skye ba dang po'i lus la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And so it is with the body of the first birth.

original: rmi lam gyi lus mi bde ba ma yin no zhes kyang bsgrubs zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi lus mi bde ba ma yin no zhes kyang bsgrubs zin pa nyid do //
translated: It has been proven that the body in a dream is not uncomfortable.

original: kyang gi sgras bsdus pa'i lan brjod nas rnam 'grel la 'jug pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras bsdus pa'i lan brjod nas rnam 'grel la 'jug pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the verse indicates that the answer is to be found in the Avatara.

original: gnyid dang nad dang nyams par byas pa la sogs pas 'gyur ba gzhan dang gzhan mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyid dang nad dang nyams par byas pa la sogs pas 'gyur ba gzhan dang gzhan mthong ba yin no //
translated: It is seen that other and other changes occur because of sleep, illness, and the like.

original: gal te dbang po rnams la 'gyur ba gzhan skye yang skye ba gzhan dang gzhan yin par ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po rnams la 'gyur ba gzhan skye yang skye ba gzhan dang gzhan yin par ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: Even if the sense organs undergo other changes, how can it be proven that they are other and other births?

original: rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: [The answer is:] ‚ÄúIt is the nature of the sense organs to change.‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bo ma yin na ni de'i rnam par 'gyur ba nyid du mi 'grub ste don gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma yin na ni de'i rnam par 'gyur ba nyid du mi 'grub ste don gzhan bzhin no //
translated: If it is not its own nature, then it is not established as a transformation of that, like a different object.

original: de na dbang po'i gnas skabs de nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de na dbang po'i gnas skabs de nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, that very state of the sense faculty would be that.

original: des na de'i rang gi ngo bo yin pas na de dang 'dra bar tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na de'i rang gi ngo bo yin pas na de dang 'dra bar tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: Since it is its own nature, it is only different like that.

original: dper na sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams phan tshun tha dad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa dang chu dang me dang rlung rnams phan tshun tha dad pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like earth, water, fire, and wind are different from each other.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Here, in the eyes and so on.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: That is the answer.

original: rgyud gcig tu gdags pa'i yul de de ni'o //
analyzed: rgyud gcig tu gdags pa'i yul de de ni'o //
translated: The object designated as one continuum.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: skye ba gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Another birth.

original: 'o na ji ltar de gcig nyid du mi rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de gcig nyid du mi rtogs snyam na /
translated: Then how is it not understood as one?

original: dran pas bar chod pas na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dran pas bar chod pas na zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, Because it is interrupted by memory.

original: bar chod pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: bar chod pa ni med pa'o //
translated: Interrupted means not existing.

original: thag ring po ni gtan bskal pa ste /
analyzed: thag ring po ni gtan bskal pa ste /
translated: Far away means completely separated.

original: med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means non-existent.

original: skye ba gzhan de kho nar yod pa yin yang med pa bzhin du rtogs pa des na gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan de kho nar yod pa yin yang med pa bzhin du rtogs pa des na gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is understood that the other birth exists as if it did not exist, one does not cling to the self as identical.

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lus las dang po sems skye bar rtog pa la thal ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lus las dang po sems skye bar rtog pa la thal ba bzhin du'o //
translated: As before means as in the reductio argument against the idea that the mind arises from the body for the first time.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la brjod pa ni dbang po med pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la brjod pa ni dbang po med pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement about the second possibility is: If the sense faculties were to arise from no cause at all.

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni dbang po du ma 'byung na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni dbang po du ma 'byung na'o //
translated: If that were so means if the sense faculties were to arise without a cause.

original: thal bde nyid yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: thal bde nyid yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The reductio follows.üîΩWhat kind of reductio?

original: ci 'dra zhig snyam na dbang rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci 'dra zhig snyam na dbang rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The text says: If the sense faculties were to arise from no cause at all, then all things would arise from no cause at all.

original: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i don du phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni 'on te /üîΩsems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i don du phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni 'on te / sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The meaning of the latter half of the verse is presented in the following.

original: / lan ni gal te 'on zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / lan ni gal te 'on zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is presented in the following: If the mind were to arise from no cause at all.üîΩThe response is presented in the following: If the mind were to arise from no cause at all, then it would arise without any regularity.

original: gal te dbang po rnams lus dang sems las skye ba yin pa des na shi ba'i lus la dbang po mi srid pa yin na de'i tshe na'o //üîΩsngon gyi dbang po rgyu nyid di rtog pa'i zhen pas bdag cag la mkho ba med de /üîΩdbang po la sogs pa @149a * //
analyzed: gal te dbang po rnams lus dang sems las skye ba yin pa des na shi ba'i lus la dbang po mi srid pa yin na de'i tshe na'o // sngon gyi dbang po rgyu nyid di rtog pa'i zhen pas bdag cag la mkho ba med de / dbang po la sogs pa @149a * //
translated: If the faculties arise from the body and mind, then the faculties would be impossible in a dead body.

original: sems las skye ba khas blangs pa nyid las 'jig rten snga ma 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems las skye ba khas blangs pa nyid las 'jig rten snga ma 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We have no need to imagine that the former faculties are the cause, because the establishment of the prior world is accepted just on the basis of the arising of the mind from the faculties, etc.

original: des na zhes bya ba lus la sogs pa las sems skye bas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba lus la sogs pa las sems skye bas na'o //
translated: Therefore means because the mind arises from the body, etc.

original: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni des na rgyu ma yin pa'i lus ma tshang bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni des na rgyu ma yin pa'i lus ma tshang bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary is therefore, the incomplete body is not the cause.

original: de'i phyir / 'di 'dra sgrub byed lhag ldan 'dod //üîΩces bya ba 'chad pa ni 'chi ba'i sems yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di 'dra sgrub byed lhag ldan 'dod // ces bya ba 'chad pa ni 'chi ba'i sems yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the prior world is accepted on the basis of the remaining cause.üîΩThe explanation of this is because the mind of death is the cause.

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i sems kyang yin la /
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i sems kyang yin la /
translated: The remaining cause is the mind of death and the remaining result is the body of the next world.

original: mtshams sbyor ba yang yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba yang yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: because it is also a connecting link, it is not definite.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of mere non-seeing.

original: lus tha dad pa la gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don gang ci yin /üîΩci lus la brten pa'i yin nam /
analyzed: lus tha dad pa la gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don gang ci yin / ci lus la brten pa'i yin nam /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, ‚Äúbecause of the difference in the body‚Äôs location‚Äù?üîΩIs it that the body is the basis?

original: 'on te lus la dmigs pa yin //
analyzed: 'on te lus la dmigs pa yin //
translated: Or is it that the body is the object?

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: First, the first position is not reasonable.

original: gang gi phyir gnas pa'i zhes bya ba de la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyi dgag pa ni sngar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas pa'i zhes bya ba de la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyi dgag pa ni sngar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because of the statement, ‚Äúbecause of the difference in the body‚Äôs location,‚Äù the refutation of the term ‚Äúlocation‚Äù has already been stated.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: rten bkag pa yis so //
analyzed: rten bkag pa yis so //
translated: From the refutation of the basis.

original: des na lus tha dad pa la gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub ba'o //
analyzed: des na lus tha dad pa la gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the reason, ‚Äúbecause of the difference in the body‚Äôs location,‚Äù is unestablished.

original: phyogs gnyis pa sun 'byin pa ni rnam shes zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa sun 'byin pa ni rnam shes zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of the second position is stated in the words, ‚Äúconsciousness . . .‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa phyi ma skad cig lus gzhan dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa phyi ma skad cig lus gzhan dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The subsequent moment of consciousness would have a different body as its object.

original: des na lus tha dad pa la gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na lus tha dad pa la gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the reason ‚Äúbecause it exists in different bodies‚Äù is not established.

original: de ni sngar spyir pa kag pa yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sngar spyir pa kag pa yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This is the general refutation stated earlier.

original: 'o na sems ci la gnas snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na sems ci la gnas snyam na /
translated: Now, with respect to what does the mind rest?

original: rnam par shes pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúConsciousness . . .‚Äù

original: 'di ni rten gyi rdzas kyi yul la bsams nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rten gyi rdzas kyi yul la bsams nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is stated with reference to the substance that is the basis of the mind.

original: de lta ma yin na ni 'di yod pa'i yul ni dus bzhin du brtags pa dgag par mi nus so de nyid kyang rten gyi rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni 'di yod pa'i yul ni dus bzhin du brtags pa dgag par mi nus so de nyid kyang rten gyi rnam pa yin no //
translated: If that were not so, then it would not be possible to refute the idea that the object of consciousness exists in the same way that the four temporal periods are imagined to exist.

original: de ltar phyed snga ma bshad pa'i sgo nas ma grub pa de nyid brjod nas phyogs gnyis pa sun 'byin pa ni /üîΩdmigs par bya ba'i lus ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyed snga ma bshad pa'i sgo nas ma grub pa de nyid brjod nas phyogs gnyis pa sun 'byin pa ni / dmigs par bya ba'i lus ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having stated the reason that the first half of the verse is not established, the root text presents the second part of the refutation:üîΩ‚ÄúThe body that is the object of the mind . . .‚Äù

original: dmigs par bya ba la gnas pa'i tha snyad ni med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba la gnas pa'i tha snyad ni med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The body that is the object of the mind is not the basis of the mind.

original: rnam pa 'di'i sgo nas kyang rten nyid du mi 'grub pa zhes bstan pa'i don du rten gyi sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di'i sgo nas kyang rten nyid du mi 'grub pa zhes bstan pa'i don du rten gyi sgrar brjod do //
translated: In this way, it is shown that the object of the mental consciousness is not established as a basis.

original: gal te gang gi rten du mi 'gyur ba dmigs par bya ba nyid ji ltar yin snyam na nang gi rig pa'i @149b zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te gang gi rten du mi 'gyur ba dmigs par bya ba nyid ji ltar yin snyam na nang gi rig pa'i @149b zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúHow can it be the object of observation if it is not the basis?‚Äù the answer is ‚Äúthe inner knowledge.‚ÄùüîΩThe explanation of the latter half of the verse is the explanation of the uncertainty.

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni ma nges pa nyid du bshad pa ni dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus dmigs par gyur pa byed pa pos ni nang bde ba la rag pa na gzhan la 'chol ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed do
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni ma nges pa nyid du bshad pa ni dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus dmigs par gyur pa byed pa pos ni nang bde ba la rag pa na gzhan la 'chol ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed do
translated: The object of observation is one‚Äôs own body. The agent who is attached to inner pleasure generates consciousness that is dependent on another.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdes zhes bya ba gzhan gyi lus la dmigs pa pas lus tha dad pa la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de dag lam nges pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to // des zhes bya ba gzhan gyi lus la dmigs pa pas lus tha dad pa la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de dag lam nges pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning.üîΩThe reason ‚Äúbecause the object of observation is different‚Äù is uncertain.

original: khyad par lus tha dad pa nyid kyang ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni lus gzhan nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par lus tha dad pa nyid kyang ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni lus gzhan nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe difference of body is also not established‚Äù is ‚Äúthe difference of body is also not established.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: lus gcig nyid du btags pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te don dam par tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lus gcig nyid du btags pa'i phyir ro // 'on te don dam par tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the body is designated as a single unit.

original: khyad par ma grub pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: khyad par ma grub pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the distinction is not established because there is a difference in the ultimate,

original: don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the reply is: ‚ÄúIn the ultimate,‚Äù etc.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: phyis pa la sogs pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: phyis pa la sogs pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: It is said: ‚Äúin the ultimate, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar slar gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar slar gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the reason is considered inconclusive.

original: gal te lus 'di la shes pa 'di yod do zhes bya ba mi slu ba dang ldan pa'i rtogs pa ni re zhig yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te lus 'di la shes pa 'di yod do zhes bya ba mi slu ba dang ldan pa'i rtogs pa ni re zhig yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt there a non-deceptive cognition that says, ‚ÄúThis consciousness is in this body‚Äù?

original: des na ji ltar cing 'gog / de nyid kyi phyir lus ni nye bar len pa nyid du mi 'gal lo snyam na de phyir zhe gsungs so //
analyzed: des na ji ltar cing 'gog / de nyid kyi phyir lus ni nye bar len pa nyid du mi 'gal lo snyam na de phyir zhe gsungs so //
translated: How then can it be refuted? Therefore, you think that it is not contradictory for the body to be the appropriator.üîΩIn order to refute that, he says: ‚ÄúTherefore, etc.‚Äù

original: rten nyid rgya cher bkag pa'i phyir na lus las kyi rgyun la phan 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rten nyid rgya cher bkag pa'i phyir na lus las kyi rgyun la phan 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: The body is the support of the continuum of action, because the support itself is refuted in detail.

original: des na lus 'di la blo yod do snyam du rtogs pa yin gyi yid kyi rgyun skye ba ni sems nyid las yin no //
analyzed: des na lus 'di la blo yod do snyam du rtogs pa yin gyi yid kyi rgyun skye ba ni sems nyid las yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind is understood to be in the body, but the stream of mind is born from the mind itself.

original: dper na 'bru'i rgyun la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir sbyang la sogs pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: dper na 'bru'i rgyun la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir sbyang la sogs pa'i don yin la /
translated: For example, the meaning of ‚Äúburnt grain‚Äù is the grain that is helpful to the stream of grain.

original: skye ba ni 'bru gzhan las yin pa bzhin no //üîΩde lta na yang sbyang tshig na 'bru tshig pa bzhin du ;
analyzed: skye ba ni 'bru gzhan las yin pa bzhin no // de lta na yang sbyang tshig na 'bru tshig pa bzhin du ;
translated: But the birth of the stream is from another grain.üîΩEven so, when the body is destroyed, the mind is destroyed, just like the burnt grain.

original: lus zhig pa na sems kyang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: lus zhig pa na sems kyang 'jig par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: No, because the mind is not like the body.

original: sbyang tshig pa tsam gyis ni 'bru tshig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyang tshig pa tsam gyis ni 'bru tshig pa ma yin te /
translated: The grain is not burnt just by the burning of the husk.

original: ci zhig ltar 'bru sbyang nas spos na mi 'tshig kyang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci zhig ltar 'bru sbyang nas spos na mi 'tshig kyang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, it is possible that the grain will not be burnt even though the husk is burnt by the fire.

original: bsreg par bya ba rang nyid me dang 'brel na 'tshig pa yin la /
analyzed: bsreg par bya ba rang nyid me dang 'brel na 'tshig pa yin la /
translated: That which is to be burnt is burnt when it comes into contact with the fire.

original: lus bzhin du sems la ni bshad pa dang bsreg pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus bzhin du sems la ni bshad pa dang bsreg pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the mind is not like the body, for it is not burnt by the fire of the husk.

original: no'i sgra ni skabs kyi don rdzogs pa la'o //
analyzed: no'i sgra ni skabs kyi don rdzogs pa la'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúburnt‚Äù is used in the sense of the completion of the meaning of the context.

original: skabs kyi don grub na mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa zhes mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas ston pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs kyi don grub na mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa zhes mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas ston pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement If the context is established, then the desired meaning is established is a summary. The word therefore indicates this.

original: gzhan pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba ni brtse ba dang chags @150a * //üîΩpa dang bral ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba ni brtse ba dang chags @150a * // pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase other qualities refers to compassion, detachment, and so on.

original: de ltar 'jig rten pha rol grub na goms pa nyams pa med pa'i phyir na thams cad mkhyen pa la snyoms pa'i rnam ba gzhan brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten pha rol grub na goms pa nyams pa med pa'i phyir na thams cad mkhyen pa la snyoms pa'i rnam ba gzhan brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, if the existence of other worlds is established, then omniscience is established, because there is no loss of habituation. The statement If . . . , indicates another aspect of this.

original: khyad par cung zad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'gro ba gang la khyad par cung zad tsam yod pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'gro ba gang la khyad par cung zad tsam yod pa'o //
translated: The phrase having some distinction means having some difference.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa 'ga' zhig tsam du rnam par gnas pa'i rab tu 'gyur ba ni gang gi khyad par dang ldan pa mthong ba yin no //üîΩslar yang ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa 'ga' zhig tsam du rnam par gnas pa'i rab tu 'gyur ba ni gang gi khyad par dang ldan pa mthong ba yin no // slar yang ni /
translated: The statement because . . . is seen means that the transformation that is established as some kind is seen to have some distinction.

original: 'bad rtsod la ni ltos 'gyur ram //
analyzed: 'bad rtsod la ni ltos 'gyur ram //
translated: Again, the root text states: Or else, it would depend on effort.

original: zhes bya ba ni mchong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchong ba bzhin no //
translated: This is like jumping.üîΩThe root text states: Or else, it would depend on effort.

original: rten mi brten pa ni chu'i dro ba bzhin no 'di'i rten chu ni mi brtan pas na'o //üîΩrten brtan pa'i rang bzhin kho na 'phel rab kyi mthar thug pa yin no zhes brjod par 'dod pa yin par bsams nas brjod pa ni rang bzhin de 'dra 'ang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩyang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa gang yin pa de 'dra ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //üîΩmchong ba ni lus kyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: rten mi brten pa ni chu'i dro ba bzhin no 'di'i rten chu ni mi brtan pas na'o // rten brtan pa'i rang bzhin kho na 'phel rab kyi mthar thug pa yin no zhes brjod par 'dod pa yin par bsams nas brjod pa ni rang bzhin de 'dra 'ang zhes bya ba'o // yang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa gang yin pa de 'dra ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro // mchong ba ni lus kyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
