translated: The support of this heat is unstable, because water is unstable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.

original: skad cig kyang gnas pa mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig kyang gnas pa mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gang zhig yang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa'i rang bzhin du rten mi brtan pa 'phel ba ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde la zhes smos te /üîΩkhyad par ji tsam zhig byas pa'i khyad par de tsam la /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gang zhig yang 'bad rtsol la ltos pa'i rang bzhin du rten mi brtan pa 'phel ba ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba de ci'i phyir zhe na / de la zhes smos te / khyad par ji tsam zhig byas pa'i khyad par de tsam la /
translated: The support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.

original: phan btags nus can te /
analyzed: phan btags nus can te /
translated: The support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.üîΩThe support of the heat of the body is stable, because the body is stable.

original: nus pa zad pa'i sgrub par byed pa rnams la /
analyzed: nus pa zad pa'i sgrub par byed pa rnams la /
translated: For the causal factors that have exhausted their potency,

original: khyad par phyi ma dag la nus pa med pa'i phyir yang 'bad pa la ltos pa'i khyad par 'phel ba ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par phyi ma dag la nus pa med pa'i phyir yang 'bad pa la ltos pa'i khyad par 'phel ba ma yin no //
translated: the subsequent differences are not due to the development of effort, because they lack potency.

original: rten thams cad kyi tshe gnas pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: rten thams cad kyi tshe gnas pa med pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because all the bases do not endure.

original: rten mi brtan pa can gyi khyad par 'phel ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rten mi brtan pa can gyi khyad par 'phel ba ma yin no //
translated: The differences of the unstable bases are not due to development.

original: gal te gang dang gang khyad par yin pa de thams cad ni 'phel ba gnas pa can yin te //
analyzed: gal te gang dang gang khyad par yin pa de thams cad ni 'phel ba gnas pa can yin te //
translated: If you think that whatever is a difference is all due to development and endurance,

original: dper na mchong ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mchong ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like jumping, etc.,

original: sems kyi yon tan rnams kyang de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi yon tan rnams kyang de lta bu yin no //
translated: the mental qualities are like that.

original: des na de dag 'phel ba gnas pa med pa ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: des na de dag 'phel ba gnas pa med pa ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: So how can they be without development and endurance?

original: khyad par yin no cog ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyad par yin no cog ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that whatever is a difference.

original: gal te mchong ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin yod pa tsam gyis de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mchong ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin yod pa tsam gyis de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If you think that jumping, etc., are not like that due to the mere existence of their nature,

original: de bzhin du sems kyi yon tan rnams kyang 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyi yon tan rnams kyang 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: in the same way, the mental qualities are also like that.

original: mchong ba dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: mchong ba dang zhes smos so //
translated: and leaping, he said.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bogs 'byung ba gnas pa la @150b ston par ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bogs 'byung ba gnas pa la @150b ston par ro //
translated: Thus means in the state of increase.

original: 'o na ji ltar de ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, how is that?

original: 'on kyang zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes gsungs so /
translated: Nevertheless, he said.

original: yang rtsol ba la ltos pa nyid gsal bar bya ba'i don du mchong ba ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang rtsol ba la ltos pa nyid gsal bar bya ba'i don du mchong ba ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to clarify the dependence on exertion, he said: leaping.

original: ji ltar na yang rtsol ba la ltos pa can yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang rtsol ba la ltos pa can yin snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, how is it dependent on exertion?

original: gang la 'phel ba rnam par gnas pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang la 'phel ba rnam par gnas pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: Where there is no increase, there is no abiding.

original: me dang 'brel ba med kyang de yod pa ni ma yin no zhes smos so //
analyzed: me dang 'brel ba med kyang de yod pa ni ma yin no zhes smos so //
translated: Even without the connection with fire, it is not that it exists.

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni me dang 'brel ba log kyang gnas pa las so //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni me dang 'brel ba log kyang gnas pa las so //
translated: From what? From the connection with fire ceasing, but abiding.

original: 'phel na rnam par gnas pa nyid la gnyi gas khyab pa nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir 'phel ba mthar thug pa ma yin pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'phel na rnam par gnas pa nyid la gnyi gas khyab pa nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir 'phel ba mthar thug pa ma yin pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is increase, there is abiding. The inclusion of the pervasion by both is for that reason. The non-finality of increase is said.

original: gnyi ga med pa'i phyir yid kyi yon tan rnams ni khyab par byed pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga med pa'i phyir yid kyi yon tan rnams ni khyab par byed pa ston pa ni /
translated: The qualities of the mind are not pervasive because they are not both.

original: de med pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause they do not exist‚Äù shows that the qualities of the mind are not pervasive.

original: bzlog pa srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rten brtan pa nyid la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rten brtan pa nyid la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause their opposites are possible‚Äù means that it is possible for the mind to be stable, etc.

original: 'o na yang rtsol ba la ltos pa rang gis 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na yang rtsol ba la ltos pa rang gis 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if the mind is not pervasive, then it must depend on effort to engage its object.

original: yang rtsol ba la ltos pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: yang rtsol ba la ltos pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it would depend on effort‚Äù means that the mind would depend on effort.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩsngar bram ze yin pa la phyis thos pa can du gyur pa de ni log pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // sngar bram ze yin pa la phyis thos pa can du gyur pa de ni log pa med pa ste /
translated: The meaning is that it would not engage its object by its very nature.üîΩThe statement ‚Äúbecause it would not be possible for a former Brahmin to become a later Shudra‚Äù means that it is not possible for a former Brahmin to become a later Shudra.

original: brtsog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: brtsog pa med pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible for a former Brahmin to become a later Shudra.

original: bshad zin pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir na dkar yol sar pa ltar thod pa yang za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir na dkar yol sar pa ltar thod pa yang za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he possesses the qualities that have been explained, he goes to the peak of existence, and because he eats the food of concentration, his skull becomes as large as a new earthen pot.

original: snying rje la sogs pa yang rten brtan pa dang / rang gi ngo bor gyur pa yin no zhes zhe la bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa yang rten brtan pa dang / rang gi ngo bor gyur pa yin no zhes zhe la bzhag pa yin no //
translated: and compassion, etc. are also held in the heart as being stable supports and as being by nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchong ba dang chu bskol ba las chos mi mthun pa ston pa ni gang zhig yang rtsol ba la ltos pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchong ba dang chu bskol ba las chos mi mthun pa ston pa ni gang zhig yang rtsol ba la ltos pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the dissimilar example is stated: ‚Äúthat which depends on effort‚Äù

original: rang bzhin nyid min phyir zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid min phyir zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is not natural‚Äù means because it does not operate by its own nature.

original: khyad par 'phel yang mthar thug par 'phel ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: khyad par 'phel yang mthar thug par 'phel ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it increases, it does not increase to the point of culmination‚Äù is the remainder.

original: 'o na gang zhig shin du 'phel ba dang ldan pa 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhig shin du 'phel ba dang ldan pa 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhat is it that possesses a very great increase?‚Äù

original: gang tshe byas gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang tshe byas gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen it becomes created‚Äù is stated.

original: yang gang gi tshe byas zin pa'i khyad par yang rtsol ba la ltos na de'i tshe rtsol ba gzhan dag khyad par gzhan byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe byas zin pa'i khyad par yang rtsol ba la ltos na de'i tshe rtsol ba gzhan dag khyad par gzhan byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the created distinction also depends on effort, then at that time another effort will make another distinction.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i khyad par ni shin du 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i khyad par ni shin du 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the distinction that has come about in that way becomes very much greater.

original: ji ltar 'dir rang bzhin nyid ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir rang bzhin nyid ma yin snyam na /
translated: How could it be that it is not just the nature itself?

original: rgyu nye ba la ltos pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu nye ba la ltos pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIt depends on the proximity of the cause.‚Äù

original: de skad ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo @151a * //üîΩnyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo @151a * // nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is to say, it is one‚Äôs own nature.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid ma yin pas na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not the nature itself.

original: chos mi mthun par brjod pa ni brtse ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos mi mthun par brjod pa ni brtse ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The dissimilar example is ‚Äúlove, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te shes rab la sogs pa yang gol ba nyid du mthong snyam na /
analyzed: gal te shes rab la sogs pa yang gol ba nyid du mthong snyam na /
translated: If it is thought that wisdom, etc., are also seen to be deviating,

original: 'di ni bag chags brtan pa med pa las yin te ;
analyzed: 'di ni bag chags brtan pa med pa las yin te ;
translated: this is from the absence of a firm predisposition.

original: shin tu brtan par goms par byas pa brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu brtan par goms par byas pa brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: It is intended to be said that it is very firm practice.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir yang nas yang du de goms par byas pa'i khyad par ni ldog pa la brten pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir yang nas yang du de goms par byas pa'i khyad par ni ldog pa la brten pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, it is said, ‚ÄúThe distinction that comes from repeatedly cultivating that is not based on deviation.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang 'di dag shin du 'phel bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di dag shin du 'phel bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But how can these increase greatly?

original: de bzhin du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIn the same way.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni 'di la phan btags nus can zhes bya ba dang / byas te gal te slar yang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam 'grel rnam par bkral ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di la phan btags nus can zhes bya ba dang / byas te gal te slar yang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam 'grel rnam par bkral ba yin no //
translated: This passage explains the commentary‚Äôs statement, ‚ÄúOne who is able to help in this way,‚Äù and ‚ÄúIf, after having done this, one should again . . . ‚Äù

original: gcig ni zhes bya ba ni brtse ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni zhes bya ba ni brtse ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äù refers to compassion and so on.

original: gzhan ni chu'i dro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni chu'i dro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other‚Äù refers to the heat of water and so on.

original: mchong ba dang chu bskol ba la sogs pa de ni yang rtsol ba la mi ltos pas rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mchong ba dang chu bskol ba la sogs pa de ni yang rtsol ba la mi ltos pas rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: The jumping and boiling of water and so on do not occur spontaneously, because they do not occur without a cause.

original: brtse ba la sogs pa de las bzlog pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa de las bzlog pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The root text explains that compassion and so on are the opposite of this:

original: brtse ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCompassion and so on . . . ‚Äù

original: mchong ba la sogs pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchong ba la sogs pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because jumping and so on do not occur spontaneously.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni skyes bu rnams la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn them‚Äù refers to human beings.

original: de ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: de ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality of compassion and so on.

original: ngo bo nyid skyes na ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid skyes na ni rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'o //
translated: If it were produced from its own nature, it would operate by its own power.

original: gal te ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i khyad par tsam 'gyur mod ji lta shin du 'phel ba'i mthar thug par 'gyur snyam na /üîΩgang phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i khyad par tsam 'gyur mod ji lta shin du 'phel ba'i mthar thug par 'gyur snyam na / gang phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you think that it would only be a difference in the way it is seen, how could it reach the point of being greatly increased?üîΩThe root text states, ‚ÄúBecause of the power of the cause.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes khong nas phyung la /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes khong nas phyung la /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúTherefore,‚Äù which is an elaboration on the word ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: brtse ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with the phrase ‚Äúthe power of the cause‚Äù in the root text.

original: de lta yin dang shin du 'bogs pa'i mthar thug par yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta yin dang shin du 'bogs pa'i mthar thug par yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that is the case, it will reach the point of being greatly increased.

original: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba bzhin pa'i khyad par tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba bzhin pa'i khyad par tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: It will not be just a difference in the way it is seen.

original: ji ltar shes rab la sogs pa'i blo rnams la yang nas yang du lhag par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab la sogs pa'i blo rnams la yang nas yang du lhag par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think that the mind, such as wisdom, will not be greatly increased,

original: brtse ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the root text states, ‚ÄúBecause of the power of the cause.‚Äù

original: des na de dag ni shin du 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na de dag ni shin du 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that they will be greatly increased.

original: ji ltar ltos pa dang bcas pa ma yin snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar ltos pa dang bcas pa ma yin snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: If you think that they are not dependent, he says, ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: gal te brtse ba la sogs pa ni lan du @151b phan 'dogs pas 'jug par mthong ba ma yin nam des na de skad ji ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te brtse ba la sogs pa ni lan du @151b phan 'dogs pas 'jug par mthong ba ma yin nam des na de skad ji ste brjod ce na /
translated: If you think that love, etc. are seen to operate in return for a benefit, why do you say this?

original: brtse stsogs lan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtse stsogs lan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúLove, etc. are not in return.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtse ba la sogs pa ni lan du phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes rab la sogs pa rigs mthun pa'i blo las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtse ba la sogs pa ni lan du phan 'dogs pa la ltos pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang shes rab la sogs pa rigs mthun pa'i blo las byung ba yin no //
translated: The love, etc. of the bodhisattva are not dependent on a return benefit. On the contrary, they arise from the mind that is homogeneous with wisdom, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag ni dman pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni de'i zhing du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag ni dman pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni de'i zhing du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For this very reason, he says, they are not inferior. He says, ‚Äúin that field.‚Äù

original: brtse ba la sogs pa'i blo des zhing du byas pa'i rgyu gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa'i blo des zhing du byas pa'i rgyu gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The compound ‚Äúin which there is the cause of the field made by that mind of love, etc.‚Äù is to be resolved in this way.

original: des na zhes bya bar ni chung bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya bar ni chung bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because they are not small.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni brtse ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni brtse ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey‚Äù refers to love, etc.

original: rgyas par mi 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyis zhan par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyas par mi 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyis zhan par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could it be inferior due to the characteristic of not increasing?

original: yang nas yang du rgyas pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang nas yang du rgyas pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning that it increases again and again.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni mchong ba yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni mchong ba yang ngo //

original: de'i chos ni mngon par 'phel ba mthar thug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i chos ni mngon par 'phel ba mthar thug pa med pa'o //
translated: Its quality is the endless increase of manifest enlightenment.

original: de lta na yang ma yin te //
analyzed: de lta na yang ma yin te //
translated: Even so, it is not so.

original: des bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: des bzlog pa yin te /
translated: It is the opposite of that.

original: skabs kyi shes rab la sogs pa la 'phel ba mthar thug pa med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar sems na'o //
analyzed: skabs kyi shes rab la sogs pa la 'phel ba mthar thug pa med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya bar sems na'o //
translated: If one thinks that wisdom and so on in this context also have no end to their increase,

original: stobs dang rtsol ba dag las mchong pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: stobs dang rtsol ba dag las mchong pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: jumping is from strength and effort.

original: mchong ba stobs la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i don du ldog pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mchong ba stobs la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i don du ldog pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The opposite is stated for the purpose of establishing the result of jumping and so on.

original: shin du legs mchong goms par byas pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shin du legs mchong goms par byas pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //

original: des na de gnyis ni mchong pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na de gnyis ni mchong pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba dgongs pa'o //

original: 'o na ni gang gis mchong pa mtha' thug pa med par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: 'o na ni gang gis mchong pa mtha' thug pa med par 'gyur ba /

original: de gnyis rnam par gnas pa med pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na ;
analyzed: de gnyis rnam par gnas pa med pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na ;
translated: those two would have the nature of not remaining in a fixed period of time.

original: stobs dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: stobs dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúStrength‚Äù is stated.

original: rnam par gnas pa'i bdag nyid ni nus pa gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa'i bdag nyid ni nus pa gnas pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of remaining in a fixed period of time is the nature of remaining in a fixed period of time.

original: gnas pa'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa nyid du'o //

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mtha' thug pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mtha' thug pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot elsewhere‚Äù means not without end.

original: goms pa nyid las yin gyi stobs dang rtsol ba las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: goms pa nyid las yin gyi stobs dang rtsol ba las ni ma yin no //

original: des na 'di gnyis ni de'i rgyud nyid ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'di gnyis ni de'i rgyud nyid ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni goms pa'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni goms pa'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin na'o //

original: phyis ma grub par thal lo zhes bya ba ni sngar yang zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: phyis ma grub par thal lo zhes bya ba ni sngar yang zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: it would follow that it would not be established later. It should be understood that it would not be established earlier.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de'i rgyu @152a * //
analyzed: de'i rgyu @152a * //
translated: Because that is its cause.

original: stobs ni sngar yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs ni sngar yang yod pa'i phyir ro //

original: mchong pa'i yul can gyi stobs can gyi stobs de ni'o //
analyzed: mchong pa'i yul can gyi stobs can gyi stobs de ni'o //
translated: That strength of the strong man which has the object of jumping

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni mchong pa'i yul can gyi goms pas bsgrubs pa yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni mchong pa'i yul can gyi goms pas bsgrubs pa yin na'o //

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni mtha' thug pa med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni mtha' thug pa med pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: in that very way, in that manner,

original: skyes bu de ni'o //
analyzed: skyes bu de ni'o //
translated: that man

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: therefore, because of the manifestation of the non-concordant,

original: stobs des na'o //
analyzed: stobs des na'o //
translated: by that strength

original: ji ste zhes bya ba ni bcud kyis len zos pa las stobs skye ba yin gyi sngar yod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste zhes bya ba ni bcud kyis len zos pa las stobs skye ba yin gyi sngar yod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If, having eaten a tonic, strength arises and did not exist previously,

original: lan du de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: in response to that, he says, that also

original: gnas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mtha' thug pa med pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mtha' thug pa med pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: is not without limit.

original: shes rab la sogs pa'i tshul du goms pa nyid las mchong ba yin no zhes bya ba rnam pa gzhan gyis 'gog pa ni ming dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa'i tshul du goms pa nyid las mchong ba yin no zhes bya ba rnam pa gzhan gyis 'gog pa ni ming dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation by another method, that it is due to the practice of wisdom, etc., is stated in the line, ‚ÄúThe name, etc.‚Äù

original: bya khyung mi dang sgre'u mngal nas skyes pa dag las skye gnas khyad par du gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: bya khyung mi dang sgre'u mngal nas skyes pa dag las skye gnas khyad par du gyur pa yin la /
translated: The garu·∏ça is a special birth from a human and a mare.

original: spre'u ni mi las rigs khyad par du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: spre'u ni mi las rigs khyad par du gyur pa yin no //
translated: The monkey is a special species from a human.

original: rigs mthun pa nyid kyi mi rnams la kha cig nyid bcud kyis len zos pa'i stobs kyis khyad par du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa nyid kyi mi rnams la kha cig nyid bcud kyis len zos pa'i stobs kyis khyad par du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Among humans who are of the same species, some are special by the power of having taken a magic potion.

original: brtse ba la sogs pa ni mchong ba las bzlog par brjod pa ni brtse ba la sogs pa dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtse ba la sogs pa ni mchong ba las bzlog par brjod pa ni brtse ba la sogs pa dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of the opposite of jumping is stated in the line, ‚ÄúCompassion, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni brtse ba la sogs pa ni rigs la sogs pa gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni brtse ba la sogs pa ni rigs la sogs pa gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot depending on another‚Äù is that compassion, etc., do not depend on another species, etc.

original: goms pa tsam la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: goms pa tsam la ltos pa yin te /

original: de med na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de med na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbecause they do not exist without it‚Äù is that they do not exist without it.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is stated in the words ‚ÄúIf it is said.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚Äù The response is stated in the words ‚ÄúNo, it is not.

original: des na stobs ni goms pa'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: des na stobs ni goms pa'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: ‚Äù Therefore, power is not the result of cultivation,

original: de 'phel ba na de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de 'phel ba na de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: because when it increases, it does not exist.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni snying rje la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni snying rje la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du'o //
translated: The nature of compassion, etc.

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The nature of compassion, etc. does not exist.

original: rang sa bon las byung ba brtse ba'i sa bon las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang sa bon las byung ba brtse ba'i sa bon las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from its own seed, from the seed of compassion.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhe sdang la sogs pas gnod pa med pa de'i tshe sems kyi rgyun la de bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhe sdang la sogs pas gnod pa med pa de'i tshe sems kyi rgyun la de bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: When it is not harmed by its counteragents, such as hatred, etc., then it becomes the nature of the mind-continuum.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: It proceeds by its own nature.

original: 'o na ji ltar de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur snyam na /

original: gal te rten brtan @152b pa yang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rten brtan @152b pa yang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the basis is firm,

original: de nyid bshad pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained in the words ‚ÄúIn that case.

original: gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba ni brtse ba'i bdag nyid goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can no zhes khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba ni brtse ba'i bdag nyid goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can no zhes khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout doubt‚Äù means that one should accept that the essence of compassion is preceded by practice.

original: mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen.

original: mthong ba nyid bshad pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba nyid bshad pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The seeing itself is explained as ‚Äúthus.‚Äù

original: rtsa ba yin zhes bya ba ni rgyu yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba yin zhes bya ba ni rgyu yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRoot‚Äù means cause.

original: ni'i sgra ni kho na'i don to //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni kho na'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúexclusively.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa brtse ba la sogs pa goms pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa brtse ba la sogs pa goms pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is explained as ‚Äúpractice of compassion, etc.‚ÄùüîΩWhy is that?

original: ci'i phyir snyam na /üîΩskye ba ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam na / skye ba ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of the arising of the thought of enlightenment.

original: bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya bar gcad do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya bar gcad do //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle.

original: skye ba las ni yod pa nyid de de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba las ni yod pa nyid de de'i phyir ro //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.

original: gang yod pas 'ga' yang blang bar bya ba nyid ma yin par snang bar 'gyur ba snang bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa la sdang ba'i rnam pa can gyi chos chos so //
analyzed: gang yod pas 'ga' yang blang bar bya ba nyid ma yin par snang bar 'gyur ba snang bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa la sdang ba'i rnam pa can gyi chos chos so //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because it is the cause of the arising of the Great Vehicle.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yid log pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yid log pa bzhin no //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the root of the Great Vehicle because

original: chags bral ni mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam pa can du 'chad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: chags bral ni mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam pa can du 'chad par 'gyur la /
translated: Freedom from attachment is explained as having the aspect of equanimity.

original: chags kyi rab kyi mthar thug pa ni zad pa las khrag 'dzag pas 'chi ba'i mthar thug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chags kyi rab kyi mthar thug pa ni zad pa las khrag 'dzag pas 'chi ba'i mthar thug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The ultimate of attachment is the ultimate of death, since blood flows from the nose.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni yid log pa la sogs pa bdag nyid du gyur pa bzhin du snying rje dang ldan pa brtse ba zhen po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni yid log pa la sogs pa bdag nyid du gyur pa bzhin du snying rje dang ldan pa brtse ba zhen po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, like one who is mentally disturbed, etc., one who has compassion has a nature that is attached to affection.

original: gal te brtse ba dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa nyid la brtson mod /
analyzed: gal te brtse ba dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhom pa nyid la brtson mod /
translated: If one who has compassion strives only to destroy the suffering of others,

original: rang gi sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i thabs btsal bas ci bye zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi sdug bsngal gzhom pa'i thabs btsal bas ci bye zhe na /
translated: why does he seek a means to destroy his own suffering?

original: rang gi sdug bsngal ma gsal bar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi sdug bsngal ma gsal bar zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúwithout making his own suffering manifest.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni dngos po thams cad mngon du byas pa med par bya ba 'di'i nye bar mtshon byed yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po thams cad mngon du byas pa med par bya ba 'di'i nye bar mtshon byed yin no //
translated: This indicates that he does not make all things manifest.

original: de nyid kyi phyir des na zhes gsungs te mi nus pas ni'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir des na zhes gsungs te mi nus pas ni'o //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause he is incapable,‚Äù since he is not able to do so.

original: ci'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe de ston pa srid pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe de ston pa srid pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not possible for him to teach at all times?

original: rang gi don 'dod pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: rang gi don 'dod pa zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause he is intent on his own aim.‚Äù

original: thar pa rnams ni rang gi don 'dod pa med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: thar pa rnams ni rang gi don 'dod pa med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that the liberated ones do not have the desire for their own aim.

original: dmyal ba la sogs par skyes pa'i dus na yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs par skyes pa'i dus na yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not exist even when he is born in the hells and so on.

original: 'dis ni rang gi sdug bsngal zad pa la mngon par sbyor bar brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi sdug bsngal zad pa la mngon par sbyor bar brjod do //
translated: This shows that he is intent on the exhaustion of his own suffering.

original: gal te gang gis 'di yang brjod par bya ba dngos po thams cad mngon du bya ba la mngon par sbyor ba med na chad pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: gal te gang gis 'di yang brjod par bya ba dngos po thams cad mngon du bya ba la mngon par sbyor ba med na chad pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: If it is to be said that he is intent on the manifestation of all things, what is the nihilism?

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'od zer can gyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @153a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'od zer can gyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @153a * //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn the world-realm called Marici,‚Äù and so on.

original: te ; des na 'di brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: te ; des na 'di brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is to be said.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni rang gi sdug bsngal zad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni rang gi sdug bsngal zad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù refers to the exhaustion of his own suffering and so on.

original: mngon du byed pa na zhes bya ba 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa na zhes bya ba 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen he manifests‚Äù refers to the noble truths and so on.

original: rtog pa ni rang gi ngo bo dang rang gi chos kyi sgo nas nges par gzung nas nges par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni rang gi ngo bo dang rang gi chos kyi sgo nas nges par gzung nas nges par rtog pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is the ascertainment of an object by way of its own entity and its own attributes.

original: rnam par dpyod pa thar pa'i 'dod pa ni lung dang rigs pas sdug bsngal gyi rtog pa mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa thar pa'i 'dod pa ni lung dang rigs pas sdug bsngal gyi rtog pa mdzad do //
translated: The desire for liberation through analysis is the conceptualization of suffering by way of scripture and reasoning.

original: gtso bo'i don nyid kyis na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yongs su smos te /
analyzed: gtso bo'i don nyid kyis na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yongs su smos te /
translated: The cause of suffering is mentioned by way of the chief object.

original: lung la brten pa'i phyir na las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa yongs su rtog par mdzad pa yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lung la brten pa'i phyir na las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa yongs su rtog par mdzad pa yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conceptualization of action and result, etc. is also indicated by way of the dependence on scripture.

original: de brjod pa ni dbang po las 'das pa'i don shes pa'i rgyu lung bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de brjod pa ni dbang po las 'das pa'i don shes pa'i rgyu lung bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of that is: ‚ÄúThe cause of the knowledge of a meaning beyond the senses is like scripture.‚Äù

original: bshad pa gnyis pa la ni 'jug pa'i rim pa gsal lo //
analyzed: bshad pa gnyis pa la ni 'jug pa'i rim pa gsal lo //
translated: In the second explanation, the process of engagement is clear.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa la mngon du phyogs pa med par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa la mngon du phyogs pa med par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot otherwise‚Äù means not without being directed toward analysis.

original: de'i 'og tu ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin gyi lung du zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i chos la sogs pa 'phangs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin gyi lung du zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i chos la sogs pa 'phangs pa'i phyir na /
translated: Then, ‚Äúscripture that is by nature inference for the sake of another‚Äù is so called because it implies the property of the probandum, the property of the logical reason, and so on.

original: don gyis na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: don gyis na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: By implication, it is by nature inference for the sake of another.

original: thams cad kyi tshe tshul gsum pa'i gtan tshigs sbyor bar ni ma nges so //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe tshul gsum pa'i gtan tshigs sbyor bar ni ma nges so //
translated: It is not definite that the trimodal condition of the logical reason is always employed.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i ngag sbyor ba na yang ma tshang ba dang / ma lhag pa 'di 'dra ba nyid sbyar bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i ngag sbyor ba na yang ma tshang ba dang / ma lhag pa 'di 'dra ba nyid sbyar bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: When one employs a proof statement, one should employ it in this way, without deficiency and without excess.

original: ngag yan lag lnga po'i sbyor ba ni thams cad du bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ngag yan lag lnga po'i sbyor ba ni thams cad du bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that the employment of a five-membered statement is not always necessary.

original: don de zhes bya ba ni dpyod pas yul du byas pa'o //
analyzed: don de zhes bya ba ni dpyod pas yul du byas pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That object‚Äù is the object that is taken as the domain of analysis.

original: bka' lung skong ba tsam gyi lung la sa ni don de mthong ba ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: bka' lung skong ba tsam gyi lung la sa ni don de mthong ba ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The meaning is that in mere scriptural statements, the object is not seen.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: smra ba po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: smra ba po zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is the speaker who is the authority.

original: rigs par bsgrub par bya ba ni rigs pa nyid kyis gzhan la bstan par bya ba yin gyi bka' lung gis ci bya /
analyzed: rigs par bsgrub par bya ba ni rigs pa nyid kyis gzhan la bstan par bya ba yin gyi bka' lung gis ci bya /
translated: What is to be established by reasoning should be taught to others by means of reasoning itself, not by scriptural authority.

original: des na de ltar mi dpyod pa ji ltar rtog pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: des na de ltar mi dpyod pa ji ltar rtog pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: So how can one be considered rational if one does not investigate in this way?

original: rigs pa mi 'dod na yang ma rmongs pa ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs pa mi 'dod na yang ma rmongs pa ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: And how can one be considered undeluded if one does not accept reasoning?

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu'i lung du don mthong bas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu'i lung du don mthong bas na'o //
translated: Therefore, means because one sees the meaning of such scriptures in this way.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rang @153b bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'i rang @153b bzhin no //
translated: The cause of suffering is the nature of the truth of origination.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i'o //
translated: That means the cause of suffering.

original: de brtags pas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa brtags pas so //
analyzed: de brtags pas zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa brtags pas so //
translated: By investigating that means by investigating the impermanence, etc. of suffering, which is the result.

original: ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: bzlog par rung ba nyid du zhes smras so //
analyzed: bzlog par rung ba nyid du zhes smras so //
translated: For the sake of the possibility of cessation.

original: gang zhig de med par mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang zhig de med par mi 'gyur ba /
translated: That which is not possible without that means that which is not possible without the cessation of the cause of suffering.

original: bzlog par rung ba nyid du rtog pa la dgos pa ci yong snyam na /
analyzed: bzlog par rung ba nyid du rtog pa la dgos pa ci yong snyam na /
translated: What is the purpose of conceiving of the possibility of reversal?

original: bzlog par rung ba nyid du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bzlog par rung ba nyid du zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúthe possibility of reversal.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu rgyu med pa nyid ni rtag tu yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu med pa nyid ni rtag tu yod pa nyid do //
translated: The effect without a cause would be eternally existent.

original: rtag pa'i rgyu can mi ldog pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: rtag pa'i rgyu can mi ldog pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How could that which has a permanent cause be reversed?

original: rgyu dang bral ba med par ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang bral ba med par ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúnot without a cause.‚Äù

original: de bas na 'bras bu med pa dang / rtag pa'i rgyu can ni ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu med pa dang / rtag pa'i rgyu can ni ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect without a cause and that which has a permanent cause are not reversed.

original: 'o na ni rgyu dang bcas pa ji ltar ldog snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ni rgyu dang bcas pa ji ltar ldog snyam na /
translated: But how could that which has a cause be reversed?

original: rgyu yis byas pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: rgyu yis byas pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúthat which is produced by a cause.‚Äù

original: 'o na mi rtag pa'i rgyu can nyid la brtags pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mi rtag pa'i rgyu can nyid la brtags pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: But what is the point of investigating that which has an impermanent cause?

original: mi rtag rgyu can zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mi rtag rgyu can zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúimpermanent and having a cause.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal de'i rgyu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de'i rgyu ni kun 'byung gi bden pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The cause of that suffering is the truth of origination.

original: de'i mi rtag pa nyid du rtag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i mi rtag pa nyid du rtag pa mdzad do //
translated: He makes it permanent in its impermanence.

original: rgyu ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gnas na'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gnas na'o //
translated: The cause is the cause of suffering when it abides.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras ldog go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras ldog go //
translated: The opposite of the effect, which is characterized by suffering.

original: 'o na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcu'i phyir rtogs par byed snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bcu'i phyir rtogs par byed snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that the cause of suffering is to be understood in order to destroy it,üîΩthe thought is that it is to be destroyed by its antidote.

original: de rgyu gzhom phyir zhes bya'o snyam du dgongs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i blo mnga' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de rgyu gzhom phyir zhes bya'o snyam du dgongs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i blo mnga' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That is, the thought is that it is to be understood in that way.

original: byung ba ni zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis 'jug par 'gyur ba ni'o //
analyzed: byung ba ni zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis 'jug par 'gyur ba ni'o //
translated: That which has arisen is that which has come into being through a continuum.

original: gnyen po med kyang rgyu med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyen pos ci bya snyam na /
analyzed: gnyen po med kyang rgyu med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyen pos ci bya snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that even though an antidote exists, it is of no use because the cause would exist without a cause,

original: gnyen po med par ni zhes smos so //üîΩgnyen po med kyang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu med par 'gyur ro zhes ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gnyen po med par ni zhes smos so // gnyen po med kyang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu med par 'gyur ro zhes ni mi rigs so //
translated: the text says, ‚ÄúEven though it exists,‚ÄùüîΩand it is not reasonable to say that the cause of suffering would exist without a cause, even though an antidote exists.

original: de lta ma yin na me'i gnyen po med pas na rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba'i rtag tu sdug bsngal med pa kho na 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na me'i gnyen po med pas na rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ba'i rtag tu sdug bsngal med pa kho na 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: If it were otherwise, then because the antidote to fire would not exist, it would be causeless and there would never be an absence of suffering.

original: gal te rgyu med pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rgyu med pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: If you say that suffering arises without a cause, this is a hypothetical objection.

original: rgyu med pa nyid las sdug bsngal ldog mod 'di la gnyen po la brten pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid las sdug bsngal ldog mod 'di la gnyen po la brten pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If suffering arises without a cause, what is the use of relying on an antidote?

original: gang zhig 'di skad brjod pa zhig de ltar 'dod pa yod dam zhe na /üîΩlas zad pa nyid las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di skad brjod pa zhig de ltar 'dod pa yod dam zhe na / las zad pa nyid las zhes gsungs so //
translated: If someone were to say this, would you accept it?üîΩThe Buddha said that suffering ceases due to the exhaustion of karma.

original: las zad pa yang @154a * //
analyzed: las zad pa yang @154a * //
translated: The exhaustion of karma is due to the exhaustion of

original: dka' thub kyi snyon rmongs pa las so //
analyzed: dka' thub kyi snyon rmongs pa las so //
translated: the delusion of asceticism.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas bshad pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas bshad pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is not the explanation of the proponent of tenets.

original: gal te las gcig kho nar zad na ni de'i tshe spyad pas zad ba zhig tu yang 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te las gcig kho nar zad na ni de'i tshe spyad pas zad ba zhig tu yang 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If karma were to be exhausted in just one life, then it would be exhausted through experience.

original: 'on kyang ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ma zad na /
analyzed: 'on kyang ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu ma zad na /
translated: However, as long as the cause characterized by ignorance is not exhausted,

original: las gzhan dang gzhan skye ba 'phen to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las gzhan dang gzhan skye ba 'phen to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: other karmas are projected. This is the meaning.

original: las dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyun ni ma rig pa yin la /
analyzed: las dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyun ni ma rig pa yin la /
translated: The continuum of karma and suffering is ignorance.

original: ma rig pa yang gnyen po med par mi ldog go //
analyzed: ma rig pa yang gnyen po med par mi ldog go //
translated: And ignorance cannot be reversed without an antidote.

original: de ltar 'dis ni lam gyi bden pa 'phangs ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dis ni lam gyi bden pa 'phangs ba yin no //
translated: Thus, this verse implies the truth of the path.

original: sngar gyi rgyu yang phyir zhes bya bas ni bden pa gsum 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar gyi rgyu yang phyir zhes bya bas ni bden pa gsum 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand the previous cause‚Äù implies the three other truths.

original: de dag gi rab tu spros pa ni mdun bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rab tu spros pa ni mdun bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Their extensive explanation will be given later.

original: skyon med do zhes bya ba ni lam ltos pa'i mtshan nyid nyid skyon no //
analyzed: skyon med do zhes bya ba ni lam ltos pa'i mtshan nyid nyid skyon no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthere is no fault‚Äù means that the characteristic of the path‚Äôs dependence is not a fault.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni du ma'i rang bzhin yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni du ma'i rang bzhin yin pas na'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of that‚Äù means because of the many natures.

original: rgyu yin zhes bya bas ni skabs kyi sdug bsngal gyis bdag nyid la gdung bar byas pas na zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu yin zhes bya bas ni skabs kyi sdug bsngal gyis bdag nyid la gdung bar byas pas na zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the cause‚Äù means that it is the cause of the suffering that is the topic of this discussion.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par gzhan la byams pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par gzhan la byams pa la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that case‚Äù means in the case of love for others that is not based on a cause.

original: ji ste de lta bu mthong ngam snyam na /
analyzed: ji ste de lta bu mthong ngam snyam na /
translated: If you think that such love is seen,

original: bdag gi ba la zhes smos te /
analyzed: bdag gi ba la zhes smos te /
translated: the phrase ‚Äúin the case of love for what is mine‚Äù is stated.

original: bu la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: bu la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is mine‚Äù refers to a son and so on.

original: mngon par zhen pa ni shin tu byams pas kun 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ni shin tu byams pas kun 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAttachment‚Äù means to hold on to them with great love.

original: phyed phyi ma nyid rnam par 'chad pa ni bu la zhes smos so //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma nyid rnam par 'chad pa ni bu la zhes smos so //
translated: The latter half of the verse is the explanation of the word ‚Äúson.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir chags pa nyid sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chags pa nyid sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, attachment itself is the cause of suffering.

original: de'i phyir chags pa 'o na chags pa gang nas byung snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir chags pa 'o na chags pa gang nas byung snyam na /
translated: If that is so, then from what does attachment arise?

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba la chags pa yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba la chags pa yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúAttachment to ‚ÄòI‚Äô and ‚Äòmine.‚Äô‚Äù

original: 'jig la lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba gzhan dang gzhan thog ma can gyis bskyed pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig la lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba gzhan dang gzhan thog ma can gyis bskyed pa nyid do //
translated: The view of annihilation is the view of the perishable composite that is generated by other views.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni brgyud pas rgyu yin pa na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni brgyud pas rgyu yin pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means that it is the indirect cause.

original: 'jig pas na 'jig ste /
analyzed: 'jig pas na 'jig ste /
translated: Annihilation is destruction.

original: de yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas na 'jig tshogs so //
analyzed: de yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas na 'jig tshogs so //
translated: And that is a composite, therefore it is the perishable composite.

original: der lta ba ni 'jig tshogs su lta bas te /
analyzed: der lta ba ni 'jig tshogs su lta bas te /
translated: The view of that is the view of the perishable composite.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the grasping of the self.

original: gnod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yin te /
translated: It is harmful.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag med par mthong ba ni de dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag med par mthong ba ni de dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory means that it is the nature of the view of the perishable composite, and the view of selflessness is incompatible with it.

original: 'di la 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: What contradiction is there in this?

original: gal te phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin @154b na de'i tshe chos kyi 'gal ba yin pas na bdag tu rtog pa dang bdag med par rtog pa'i dngos po gnyis la de'i skabs med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin @154b na de'i tshe chos kyi 'gal ba yin pas na bdag tu rtog pa dang bdag med par rtog pa'i dngos po gnyis la de'i skabs med pa kho na'o //
translated: If they are mutually exclusive, then they are contradictory phenomena, and therefore it is impossible for the two things, the conception of self and the conception of selflessness, to occur at the same time.

original: 'di ni bdag tu rnam par rtog pa nyid dang / bdag med par rnam par rtog pa nyid gnyis las 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag tu rnam par rtog pa nyid dang / bdag med par rnam par rtog pa nyid gnyis las 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: This is the case if the two are mutually exclusive.

original: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni rnam par gzhag pa tsam du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni rnam par gzhag pa tsam du 'gyur la /
translated: But if the two conceptions are merely posited as mutually exclusive,

original: de tsam gyis ni gcig gis gzhan ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni gcig gis gzhan ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is not the case that one is the negation of the other.

original: 'di ni dngos po gnyis kyi ldan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal bya'i byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po gnyis kyi ldan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal bya'i byed pa yin no //
translated: This is the activity of the contradiction of non-coexistence of two things.

original: de khas len na ni grang ba dang tsha ba'i rig pa bzhin du skad cig kyang lta na cig gnas par thal lo //
analyzed: de khas len na ni grang ba dang tsha ba'i rig pa bzhin du skad cig kyang lta na cig gnas par thal lo //
translated: If you accept this, then, like the cognition of heat and cold, it follows, absurdly, that they would coexist.

original: gnyi gas nus pa med pa'i skad cig skye ba la gdon mi za bar ltos par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi gas nus pa med pa'i skad cig skye ba la gdon mi za bar ltos par bya'o //
translated: One must definitely rely on the arising of a moment that has the capacity to do both.

original: gal te skad cig kyang lhan cig gnas pa med pa'i phyir cher shin tu 'gal ba ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig kyang lhan cig gnas pa med pa'i phyir cher shin tu 'gal ba ma yin snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is not a great contradiction because they do not exist together even for an instant,

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad phan tshun 'gal bar thal ba'i phyir dang ; 'gal ba gsum pa rnam par gnas par thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad phan tshun 'gal bar thal ba'i phyir dang ; 'gal ba gsum pa rnam par gnas par thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then all conceptual thoughts would be mutually contradictory, and it would follow that a third alternative to contradiction would be established.

original: 'di la brjod pa bdag yod pa dang med pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te kho na'i 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa bdag yod pa dang med pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te kho na'i 'gal ba yin no //
translated: In response to this, we say: existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive contradictions.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni de sgo nyid nas 'dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni de sgo nyid nas 'dogs pa yin te /
translated: The two conceptual thoughts are imputed in that way.

original: de la nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are ascertained in that way.

original: 'o na de med pa la mi 'khrul pa'i sgo can gyi mi 'gal bar 'gyur ro snyam na yin te /
analyzed: 'o na de med pa la mi 'khrul pa'i sgo can gyi mi 'gal bar 'gyur ro snyam na yin te /
translated: If you think that it is not contradictory because it is not mistaken with respect to nonexistence,

original: nye bar btags pa tsam dang khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa tsam dang khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is because it is merely imputed and accepted.

original: med pa la mi 'khrul gzhan la yang nye bar brtags par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: med pa la mi 'khrul gzhan la yang nye bar brtags par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you think that it is not mistaken with respect to nonexistence, but it is imputed with respect to another,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then it is not.

original: dgos ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no purpose.

original: 'gal ba ni lhan cig gnas pa dgag ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni lhan cig gnas pa dgag ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Contradiction is for the sake of refuting coexistence.

original: don du gnyer ba yin la bum pa dang snam bu dang / gzugs dang ro la sogs pa la ni lhan cig gnas pa yod pa'i phyir nye bar btags pas ci bya /
analyzed: don du gnyer ba yin la bum pa dang snam bu dang / gzugs dang ro la sogs pa la ni lhan cig gnas pa yod pa'i phyir nye bar btags pas ci bya /
translated: But since pots, cloth, form, taste, etc. do exist together, what is the use of the designation?

original: 'dir ni bdag la sogs pa med par brtan par byas pa na yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i go skabs med la /
analyzed: 'dir ni bdag la sogs pa med par brtan par byas pa na yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i go skabs med la /
translated: Here, when one has firmly established that the self, etc. do not exist, there is no opportunity for the conception of existence.

original: yod pa la yang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i go skabs rnam grangs kyis kyang mi srid do //
analyzed: yod pa la yang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i go skabs rnam grangs kyis kyang mi srid do //
translated: And for that which exists, the conception of nonexistence is not possible even in a different way.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam grangs kyis mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam grangs kyis mi 'gal lo //
translated: But the conception of aggregates, etc. is not contradictory in a different way.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa 'gal bar thal ba med pa ste /üîΩde'i phyir ci ltar btags par shes pa'i yod pa'i med @155a * //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa 'gal bar thal ba med pa ste / de'i phyir ci ltar btags par shes pa'i yod pa'i med @155a * //
translated: Therefore, there is no entailment of the contradiction of conception.

original: pa'i yul gyi sgo nas tha snyad du byed pa de bzhin du 'gal ba yang yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //üîΩlhan cig mi gnas pa'i tha snyad kyang mi mthun pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'i yul gyi sgo nas tha snyad du byed pa de bzhin du 'gal ba yang yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do // lhan cig mi gnas pa'i tha snyad kyang mi mthun pa ma yin te /
translated: Hence, there is no fault in positing existence and nonexistence as objects of cognition in accordance with the designations, because they are contradictory.

original: dngos po'i blo 'jug pa nyid /
analyzed: dngos po'i blo 'jug pa nyid /
translated: The designation of noncoexistence is not inconsistent, because it is the very engagement of the cognition of things.

original: bag chags kyi mtshan nyid rgyu mi mthun pa skyed pa las dngos po med pa'i blos rgyun gcod pa yin no //üîΩde la gal te rnam par rtog pa'i blo gnyis gcig gi tshe nye bar gnas pa med par brjod par de ltan yang dngos po'i rnam par rtog bskyed pa'i bag chags dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog bskyed pa'i bag chags dang dngos po med pa'i rnam
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshan nyid rgyu mi mthun pa skyed pa las dngos po med pa'i blos rgyun gcod pa yin no // de la gal te rnam par rtog pa'i blo gnyis gcig gi tshe nye bar gnas pa med par brjod par de ltan yang dngos po'i rnam par rtog bskyed pa'i bag chags dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog bskyed pa'i bag chags dang dngos po med pa'i rnam
translated: The definition of a latent potentiality is that it is a cause that produces a dissimilar effect. The mind that is a non-entity is the termination of the continuum.

original: par rtog pa cig car 'phrad pa yin pa'i phyir nus pa med pa'i skad cig skyed bar mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: par rtog pa cig car 'phrad pa yin pa'i phyir nus pa med pa'i skad cig skyed bar mi 'gal lo //
translated: If you say that the two conceptual minds are simultaneous, then even though the latent potentiality that generates the conceptualization of an entity is not present, still, because the latent potentiality that generates the conceptualization of a non-entity and the conceptualization of a non-entity are simultaneous, there is no contradiction in the production of a moment that is without potentiality.

original: 'on te yang de'i tshe me las grang ba ltar /
analyzed: 'on te yang de'i tshe me las grang ba ltar /
translated: But if, at that time, it is like the cold that arises from fire,

original: de'i tshe gsal ba'i dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa las tha dad pa bag chags zhes bya ba'i rjes ni yod pa ma yin te de'i nus pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gsal ba'i dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa las tha dad pa bag chags zhes bya ba'i rjes ni yod pa ma yin te de'i nus pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then at that time, there is no latent potentiality called ‚Äúthe cause of the conceptualization of a non-entity‚Äù that is different from the conceptualization of a non-entity, because it is the nature of its potentiality.

original: des na gang dang gang lhan cig tu 'byung snyam na /
analyzed: des na gang dang gang lhan cig tu 'byung snyam na /
translated: Therefore, if you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is it that arises simultaneously with the conceptualization of a non-entity?‚Äù

original: de kho nar ni 'di de bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: de kho nar ni 'di de bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: It is just thatness.

original: 'on kyang chos can sems kyi rgyu gcig bzhin du rtogs pas bag chags logs su bstan pa na /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos can sems kyi rgyu gcig bzhin du rtogs pas bag chags logs su bstan pa na /
translated: But when the cause of the mind, the substratum awareness, is understood to be the same, the latent impressions are taught to be different.

original: dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba nyid du bsnyad pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba nyid du bsnyad pa yin no //
translated: They are said to occur simultaneously with the non-existent conceptualization.

original: de tsam gyis kyang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal bar brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis kyang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal bar brjod pa yin te /
translated: By that much, they are said to be mutually exclusive without co-existence.

original: dper na du ba las byung ba'i me'i blo la mer the tshom za ba dang 'gal bar brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na du ba las byung ba'i me'i blo la mer the tshom za ba dang 'gal bar brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying that the cognition of fire arising from smoke is mutually exclusive with the doubt about whether it is fire.

original: gang gis ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa yang de'i bag chags mi mthun par byed nus pa ma yin la ;
analyzed: gang gis ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa yang de'i bag chags mi mthun par byed nus pa ma yin la ;
translated: By that much, the latent impressions of the cognition of blue are not able to be made incompatible.

original: des na sdug bsngal bcad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal bcad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, suffering is not eliminated.

original: des na nyid kyis tha snyad grags pa la brten nas rnam par ma dpyad par rnam par rtog pa rnams phan tshun 'gal bar brjod bas na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: des na nyid kyis tha snyad grags pa la brten nas rnam par ma dpyad par rnam par rtog pa rnams phan tshun 'gal bar brjod bas na nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in saying that, without analysis, the conceptualizations are mutually exclusive, based on the well-known conventions of the world.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /üîΩde dang rnam par 'gal ba'i zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni / de dang rnam par 'gal ba'i zhes bya ba'o//
translated: This is what is being said:

original: de'i ni 'ang gi tshogs su lta ba'i'o //
analyzed: de'i ni 'ang gi tshogs su lta ba'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who is opposed to that‚Äù is the one who is opposed to the view of the transitory collections.üîΩ‚ÄúThe one who is opposed to that‚Äù is the one who is opposed to the view of the transitory collections.

original: de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rtog par mdzad ces bya ba de'i 'bras bu brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rtog par mdzad ces bya ba de'i 'bras bu brjod pa ni /
translated: The result of that is stated:

original: mi rtag pa yin pas ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin pas ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of impermanence, there is cessation.‚Äù

original: rtag pa'i bzlog par mi nus so zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: rtag pa'i bzlog par mi nus so zhes brjod zin to //
translated: It has already been said that permanence cannot be averted.

original: 'chi ba la sogs pas sdug @155b bsngal ba gang yin pa der ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'chi ba la sogs pas sdug @155b bsngal ba gang yin pa der ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: How could there not be suffering in that which is subject to death and so on?

original: de med pa'i phyir na bdag dang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i sgo can gyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa nyid med par 'gyur mod snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir na bdag dang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i sgo can gyi sdug bsngal gang yin pa nyid med par 'gyur mod snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Since that does not exist, the suffering that is based on the self and the view of the transitory collections would not exist.

original: goms pa las skyes pa'i dran pa gsal ba gang la yod pa ste /
analyzed: goms pa las skyes pa'i dran pa gsal ba gang la yod pa ste /
translated: The one who has clear recollection that arises from practice.

original: rjes su sgrub par byed pa'i sems kyi rgyun de'i yin no //
analyzed: rjes su sgrub par byed pa'i sems kyi rgyun de'i yin no //
translated: It is the continuum of mind that accomplishes that.

original: 'di ni bdag med par goms pa 'phel bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag med par goms pa 'phel bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs na yin no //
translated: This is the stage of the growth of the practice of selflessness.

original: gnod pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'di nyid sgrub par byed pa ni mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to // 'di nyid sgrub par byed pa ni mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What harm is there? It means that there is none at all.üîΩThis is the proof.

original: de nyid ni nga'o zhes mtshams sbyor ba yang yin la /
analyzed: de nyid ni nga'o zhes mtshams sbyor ba yang yin la /
translated: It is the connection, and it is also the identification, ‚ÄúThat is me.‚Äù

original: kun du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba mngon par dga' ba yang yin no yang mtshams sbyor bar yod na kun du 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba mngon par dga' ba yang yin no yang mtshams sbyor bar yod na kun du 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the grasping, the delight, and it is also the connection, the grasping that exists when there is a connection.

original: de med par ni gdung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de med par ni gdung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Without that, there is no distress.

original: 'di snyam du sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur mod /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur mod /
translated: One might think, ‚ÄúIt is not suffering,

original: de go ji ltar bzlog snyam na /
analyzed: de go ji ltar bzlog snyam na /
translated: but how can it be averted?‚Äù

original: gang la zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang la zhes smos so //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúIn regard to what?‚Äù

original: gang la zhes mngon bar dga' ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni mngon par dga' ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: gang la zhes mngon bar dga' ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni mngon par dga' ba'i yul lo //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to what‚Äù means ‚Äúin regard to the cause of delight,‚Äù that is, the object of delight.

original: gal te de lta yin mod /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin mod /
translated: One might think, ‚ÄúIf that is so,

original: de lta na yang rtsod pa ji ltar spangs par snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang rtsod pa ji ltar spangs par snyam na /
translated: then how is the dispute avoided?‚Äù

original: tha mal bar goms par byas pa ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: tha mal bar goms par byas pa ni zhes smos so //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúBy cultivating the ordinary.‚Äù

original: de goms na de nyid la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de goms na de nyid la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since one delights in that, there is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: gal te tshul 'di nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te tshul 'di nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt this method shared with the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas?

original: des na bcom ldan 'das la khyad par du 'phags pa ci yod snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das la khyad par du 'phags pa ci yod snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Then what is the exalted distinction of the BhagavƒÅn?

original: shin du zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: shin du zhes gsungs so ;
translated: The word ‚Äúvery‚Äù is stated to anticipate this doubt.

original: ; lus dang longs spyod dag gi gnod par byed pa yod kyang gdung par mi 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: ; lus dang longs spyod dag gi gnod par byed pa yod kyang gdung par mi 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Even when there is harm to the body and enjoyments, they are not tormented.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: shin du sems can du lta ba log pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: shin du sems can du lta ba log pa'i dus na'o //
translated: When the view of sentient beings is reversed.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i bdag tu lta ba log pa'i phyir btang snyoms pa gang yin pa de dag la yang /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i bdag tu lta ba log pa'i phyir btang snyoms pa gang yin pa de dag la yang /
translated: Those who are equanimous because the view of self with its imprints is reversed

original: lus dang gzhan la shin tu gnod par byed pa yod kyang rung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: lus dang gzhan la shin tu gnod par byed pa yod kyang rung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: are not tormented even when there is great harm to the body and others.

original: de pa zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni shin tu sems can du lta ba log pa'o //
analyzed: de pa zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni shin tu sems can du lta ba log pa'o //
translated: The word that refers to the reversal of the view of a real self.

original: bshad pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i sgo nas smras pa'o //üîΩskabs kyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du byas @156a * //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i sgo nas smras pa'o // skabs kyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du byas @156a * //
translated: It is said in order to show the cause of the explanation.
