original: te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word of refers to the Blessed One, who will be explained in the following section.

original: de brjod pa'i tshig de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de brjod pa'i tshig de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the words that express that?

original: rnam pa du mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rnam pa du mar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The verse says in many ways, etc.

original: rtogs pa ni rab tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni rab tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: Realization means to understand well.

original: de rgyas pa ni shin du 'phel bar gyur pa'o //üîΩrnam pa mang po zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du mar zhes bshad pa'o//
analyzed: de rgyas pa ni shin du 'phel bar gyur pa'o // rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du mar zhes bshad pa'o//
translated: Expansion means to increase greatly.üîΩ Many kinds means in many ways, as explained above.

original: gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba ni mang po zhes bya ba'o bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba ni mang po zhes bya ba'o bshad pa'o //
translated: One after another means many, as explained above.

original: de la rnam pa du mar zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa du mar zhes brjod pa na /
translated: Among them, when in many ways is expressed,

original: dus gcig tu yang zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: dus gcig tu yang zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur bas na /
translated: it is understood as at one time,

original: de rnam par gcad pa'i don du mang po zhes smras so //
analyzed: de rnam par gcad pa'i don du mang po zhes smras so //
translated: so in order to eliminate that, many is said.

original: lan mang po tsam ni dus chung ngus kyang bya bar nus pas de bcad pa'i phyir yun ring dus su zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lan mang po tsam ni dus chung ngus kyang bya bar nus pas de bcad pa'i phyir yun ring dus su zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since it is possible to do it many times in a short time, he says, for a long time, in order to eliminate that.

original: thams cad kyi rnam pa de la yang //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rnam pa de la yang //
translated: And in all of its aspects,

original: ba cig la ni yon tan dang / kha cig la ni nyes pa gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba cig la ni yon tan dang / kha cig la ni nyes pa gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: in some it is the virtues that are clear, and in some it is the faults.

original: de'i tshe ni bdag med pa mngon du byed pa nyid skyes pa da ltar dngos po gzhan thams cad rtogs pa las 'bad pa ni brtse ba las yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni bdag med pa mngon du byed pa nyid skyes pa da ltar dngos po gzhan thams cad rtogs pa las 'bad pa ni brtse ba las yin no //
translated: At that time, the manifestation of selflessness itself is born, and now all other things are realized through effort from compassion.

original: gal te de lta yin mod de lta na yang cir 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin mod de lta na yang cir 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If that is so, what is the use?

original: yon tan dang skyon zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yon tan dang skyon zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, virtues and faults.

original: des na blos nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par grub po //
analyzed: des na blos nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par grub po //
translated: Therefore, the mind is established as superior to the Sravakas, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khyad par gzhan yang bshad pa ni des na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khyad par gzhan yang bshad pa ni des na zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, another superiority is also explained:

original: des na bcom ldan 'das bag chags de lus dang ngag dang yid kyi mi mthun pa spangs ba yin no //
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das bag chags de lus dang ngag dang yid kyi mi mthun pa spangs ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat has abandoned the latent tendencies of the body, speech, and mind that are incompatible with that.

original: nyes pa'i rigs thams cad shes par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: nyes pa'i rigs thams cad shes par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: all types of faults are known.

original: de ji lta bu zhig snyam na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhig snyam na /
translated: What is that like?

original: phra mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gsum brjod do //
analyzed: phra mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gsum brjod do //
translated: Three distinctions are stated: subtle, etc.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni shes pa na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni shes pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThen‚Äù means when it is known.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of the effort.

original: 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba ni bag chags spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba ni bag chags spangs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis itself‚Äù means the abandonment of the instinct.

original: bse ru la sogs zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: bse ru la sogs zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe rhinoceros and so on‚Äù is explained in the commentary:

original: rang sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe solitary enlightened one.‚Äù

original: gzhan don 'jug can zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan don 'jug can zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEngaged in the welfare of others‚Äù is explained in the commentary: ‚Äúthe one who has gone to bliss.‚Äù

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni bshad pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni bshad pa gzhan yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOr‚Äù indicates another explanation.

original: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal spangs pa nyid tsam gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal spangs pa nyid tsam gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means if omniscience were merely the abandonment of suffering.

original: thabs kyi dbye ba ni rgyu 'bras kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi dbye ba ni rgyu 'bras kyi rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The division of the means is the division of cause and effect.

original: gal te de lta yin mod des cir 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin mod des cir 'gyur snyam na /
translated: What does this matter?

original: @156b de dus yun ring por zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @156b de dus yun ring por zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For a long time.

original: rgyu 'bras kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa mang po de goms par byas pas ni ji ltar de gsal zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu 'bras kyi rab tu dbye ba rnam pa mang po de goms par byas pas ni ji ltar de gsal zhe na /
translated: But how can one become familiar with the many varieties of cause and effect?

original: gang tshe zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang tshe zhes smos so //
translated: When one has.

original: de'i rjes 'brangs pas zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi skye ba dran pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas so //
analyzed: de'i rjes 'brangs pas zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi skye ba dran pa'i rjes su 'brangs pas so //
translated: By following the memory of former lives.

original: de dag thams cad ces bya ba ni 'khor ba pa'i skyon yon thabs dang bcas pa mtha' dag dag go //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ces bya ba ni 'khor ba pa'i skyon yon thabs dang bcas pa mtha' dag dag go //
translated: All of that is the entire collection of the faults and virtues of cyclic existence, together with the means.

original: 'di la dpe brjod pa ni ji ltar grong gzhan nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la dpe brjod pa ni ji ltar grong gzhan nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: An example is given here: Just as from another village.

original: de yi 'du byed rjes 'brel can //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yi 'du byed rjes 'brel can // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The formations that follow it.

original: grong der dngos po de dang de la mngon par dga' ba'i 'du byed de dang rjes su 'brel pa de dag ldan pa'o ;
analyzed: grong der dngos po de dang de la mngon par dga' ba'i 'du byed de dang rjes su 'brel pa de dag ldan pa'o ;
translated: The formations that are associated with the delight in those things in that village are the formations that follow it.

original: / de rig pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni grong gzhan du skyed pa'i 'du byed rig pas so //
analyzed: / de rig pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni grong gzhan du skyed pa'i 'du byed rig pas so //
translated: The stage of insight is the insight into the formations that are produced in another village.

original: de bzhin du skye ba gzhan nas 'ongs pa'i srog chags kyang skye ba gzhan rig pa skye ba dran pa can gyis shes par 'gyur ro zhes blta bar bya'o //üîΩgrong de dang brten pa des skyed pa'i khyad par gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba gzhan nas 'ongs pa'i srog chags kyang skye ba gzhan rig pa skye ba dran pa can gyis shes par 'gyur ro zhes blta bar bya'o // grong de dang brten pa des skyed pa'i khyad par gang yin pa ste /
translated: In the same way, one should understand that a living being who has come from another birth, who is endowed with the memory of former lives, knows the other birth.

original: smra lugs dang zas kyi khyad par dang / mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can de mthong ba na'o //
analyzed: smra lugs dang zas kyi khyad par dang / mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can de mthong ba na'o //
translated: The difference produced by the village and the teacher is the difference in the way of speaking, the difference in the food, the difference in the desires, etc.

original: de rig pas zhes bya ba ni grong gzhan dang ston pas bskyed pa'i khyad par rig pas so //üîΩdes na zhes bya ba ni grong gzhan nas so //
analyzed: de rig pas zhes bya ba ni grong gzhan dang ston pas bskyed pa'i khyad par rig pas so // des na zhes bya ba ni grong gzhan nas so //
translated: The knowledge of that is the knowledge of the difference produced by the other village and the other teacher.üîΩThen, by that, is the knowledge that one has come from another village.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni 'ongs pa nyid du shes pas na'o //üîΩdon la sbyar ba ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni 'ongs pa nyid du shes pas na'o // don la sbyar ba ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then, by that, is the knowledge that one has come from another village.

original: skye ba gzhan yang skye ba dran pas rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan yang skye ba dran pas rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The application to the case is: In the same way, one should understand that another birth is inferred from the memory of former lives.

original: ji ltar snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar snyam na /
translated: How?

original: skye ba gzhan des bskyed pa'i khyad par 'du byed pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan des bskyed pa'i khyad par 'du byed pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: It is the cause of the volition that is produced by that other birth.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'du byed de nyid las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'du byed de nyid las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: from that very volition that is the effect.

original: de la bshad pa dang po la //
analyzed: de la bshad pa dang po la //
translated: In the first explanation,

original: bcom ldan 'das bse ru la sogs pa rnams las khyad par nye bar bstan pa brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bse ru la sogs pa rnams las khyad par nye bar bstan pa brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: the distinction of the rhinoceros-like from the Blessed One should be stated.

original: gnyis pa la ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: In the second, the state of omniscience should be stated.

original: khyad par nye bar bstan pa yang de nyid gtsor byed pa yang yin no //
analyzed: khyad par nye bar bstan pa yang de nyid gtsor byed pa yang yin no //
translated: The distinction is also the primary factor in that.

original: de ltar skye ba dran pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba dran pa nyid yin na /
translated: Thus, if one remembers birth,

original: 'du byed rnam pa sna tshogs kyi thabs rnam pa sna tshogs nges pas na /
analyzed: 'du byed rnam pa sna tshogs kyi thabs rnam pa sna tshogs nges pas na /
translated: through the various methods of various kinds of volition,

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas skye ba gzhan la yang /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas skye ba gzhan la yang /
translated: following that, in another birth,

original: khyad par can gyis goms pa'i rgyu @157a * //
analyzed: khyad par can gyis goms pa'i rgyu @157a * //
translated: the cause of special practice

original: dang lhan cig pa'i skye ba gzhan yang shes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dang lhan cig pa'i skye ba gzhan yang shes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and the other simultaneous birth will be known. This is the explanation.

original: da ni las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa rtogs pa yang srid par ston pa ni /
analyzed: da ni las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa rtogs pa yang srid par ston pa ni /
translated: Now, to show that it is possible to understand the connection between action and effect,

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don skye ba gzhan na yod pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don skye ba gzhan na yod pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe existence of another life is inferred from the memory of former lives.‚Äù

original: tshigs su bcad pa la gnas pa'i sbyin la sogs zhes bya ba 'di dang 'bral to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa la gnas pa'i sbyin la sogs zhes bya ba 'di dang 'bral to //
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe giving, etc. that are based on the verses‚Äù is missing here.

original: rnam pa 'di yis ni skye ba dran par gyur ba na bdag nyid rang la sbyin pa dang longs spyod la sogs pa'i rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po nyams su myong ba las /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di yis ni skye ba dran par gyur ba na bdag nyid rang la sbyin pa dang longs spyod la sogs pa'i rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po nyams su myong ba las /
translated: In this way, when one remembers one‚Äôs former lives, one experiences the causal relation between one‚Äôs own giving, enjoyment, etc.

original: gzhan la longs spyod la sogs pas sbyin pa las ji ste rjes su mi dpog ste /
analyzed: gzhan la longs spyod la sogs pas sbyin pa las ji ste rjes su mi dpog ste /
translated: How could one not infer the same causal relation between the giving and enjoyment of others?

original: rjes su dpog pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa kho na'o //
translated: One must infer it.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa rjes su dpag pa skyes pas kyang 'brel pa nges pa nyid bstan par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa rjes su dpag pa skyes pas kyang 'brel pa nges pa nyid bstan par bya ba yin te /
translated: Even if one infers the effect, one must still demonstrate the certainty of the connection,

original: de nges pa med par ni de mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nges pa med par ni de mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because without that certainty, the effect would not occur.

original: de brjod pa ni de las kyang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de brjod pa ni de las kyang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He states that, saying, ‚ÄúFrom that, too.‚Äù

original: yul 'di dang zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa longs spyod par bya ba dang ngo //
analyzed: yul 'di dang zhes bya ba ni yul la sogs pa longs spyod par bya ba dang ngo //
translated: This place means the place, etc. that are to be enjoyed.

original: rnam pa ni mdog dbyi bas so //
analyzed: rnam pa ni mdog dbyi bas so //
translated: Aspect means the color, etc.

original: rang bzhin ni smra lugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni smra lugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Nature means the way of speaking, etc.

original: bye brag gi rang bzhin nges par rtogs pa na zhes bya ba ni yul de na yang rang bzhin 'di 'dra ba yod pa yin la grong de na yang cha 'ga' zhig na rang bzhin 'ga' zhig ltar yin no zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: bye brag gi rang bzhin nges par rtogs pa na zhes bya ba ni yul de na yang rang bzhin 'di 'dra ba yod pa yin la grong de na yang cha 'ga' zhig na rang bzhin 'ga' zhig ltar yin no zhes bya bar ro //
translated: When one ascertains the nature of the distinctions, one thinks: ‚ÄúIn this place, there is such and such a nature, and in that village, there is such and such a nature in some part.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du brtse ba chen po'i dang du gyur pa la ni thams cad du skyes pa'i phyir dang / skye ba dran pas brgyud pas na rim gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa nges par bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du brtse ba chen po'i dang du gyur pa la ni thams cad du skyes pa'i phyir dang / skye ba dran pas brgyud pas na rim gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa nges par bzlog par dka'o //
translated: Similarly, when one is born in a place of great affection, it is difficult to reverse the gradual increase and decrease of affection through the continuity of remembering one‚Äôs birth.

original: so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin thams cad rig pas na zhes bya ba ni bye brag gi khyad par gyis khyad par can du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin thams cad rig pas na zhes bya ba ni bye brag gi khyad par gyis khyad par can du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa ste /
translated: Because one knows all the natures of distinctions means that one knows the nature that is distinguished by specific distinctions.

original: rags pa dang phra ba dang / shin du phra ba dang / ches shin du phra ba de'i rang bzhin thams cad rig pa'o //
analyzed: rags pa dang phra ba dang / shin du phra ba dang / ches shin du phra ba de'i rang bzhin thams cad rig pa'o //
translated: The nature of all of them, gross, subtle, very subtle, and extremely subtle, is awareness.

original: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa las longs spyod chen po 'thob pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa las longs spyod chen po 'thob pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Karma and its effects, etc., means such things as obtaining great wealth from generosity, etc.

original: sngon yul 'di 'dra bar gnas pa la sogs pas ni mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba lta bur ro //
analyzed: sngon yul 'di 'dra bar gnas pa la sogs pas ni mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba lta bur ro //
translated: By saying I lived in such and such a place in the past, one knows that one will have such and such desires in the future.

original: byang grol gyi lam ni tshad mas nges par byas te mngon du byas pa yin @157b te ;
analyzed: byang grol gyi lam ni tshad mas nges par byas te mngon du byas pa yin @157b te ;
translated: The path to liberation is ascertained by valid cognition and actualized.

original: de bas na nye bar mkho ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyogs nye bar sdud pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na nye bar mkho ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyogs nye bar sdud pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the collection of all the necessary aspects of omniscience

original: mtho ris dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtho ris dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is stated by heaven and so on.

original: tsam gyi sgras ni thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med kyang zhes bya bar bstan te /
analyzed: tsam gyi sgras ni thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med kyang zhes bya bar bstan te /
translated: The word 'only' indicates that even without omniscience,

original: ston pa ni ston par mdzad pa nyid do //
analyzed: ston pa ni ston par mdzad pa nyid do //
translated: the teacher is the one who teaches.

original: thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation is made in terms of the omniscience of all.

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag kyang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'di ltar bsams pa yin te re zhig dngos po lhag tu spyod pa la brten pa can rnams ni /üîΩgzugs dang ro la sogs pa bzhin gdon mi za bar brda dngos sam brgyud pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag kyang zhes bya ba'o // 'di ltar bsams pa yin te re zhig dngos po lhag tu spyod pa la brten pa can rnams ni / gzugs dang ro la sogs pa bzhin gdon mi za bar brda dngos sam brgyud pas kyang rung ste /
translated: The entire world is also like this.üîΩThe following is the meaning of this passage.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa dag gis phan tshun 'brel pa yin no //üîΩde bzhin du 'ga' zhig bar gcod dang bcas pa yin yang /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa dag gis phan tshun 'brel pa yin no // de bzhin du 'ga' zhig bar gcod dang bcas pa yin yang /
translated: Those who are based on the theory of the existence of a remainder of the aggregates must admit that, like form, taste, etc., the self is related to the aggregates by the relation of inherence or by the relation of causality or by the relation of inherence and causality.

original: 'ga' zhig nye ba dang bcas pa yin no //üîΩde dag dang lhan cig 'brel pa na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig nye ba dang bcas pa yin no // de dag dang lhan cig 'brel pa na /
translated: In the same way, some things are related to other things by the relation of obstruction, and some things are related to other things by the relation of proximity.

original: gang dag dang bar chod pa can de dag dang yang 'brel par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag dang bar chod pa can de dag dang yang 'brel par 'gyur te /
translated: When they are related to those things, they are also related to those things that are obstructed by them,

original: 'brel pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are related to those that are related to the obstructed things.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag dang yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag dang yang yin no //
translated: The same is true of other relations.

original: de bas na thams cad kyang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos phan tshun nye bar 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad kyang phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos phan tshun nye bar 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, all things are mutually related by the fact of being cause and effect.

original: skye ba brgyud par goms pas kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la thugs gsal bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba brgyud par goms pas kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po la thugs gsal bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: And by the habit of the succession of births, the fact of being cause and effect becomes clear.

original: des na gcig rang bzhin nges pa na yang dngos po mtha' dag dang / rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpag pa bzlog tu med do //üîΩdes na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na gcig rang bzhin nges pa na yang dngos po mtha' dag dang / rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpag pa bzlog tu med do // des na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, when one nature is ascertained, the inference of all things and all aspects is irresistible.üîΩTherefore, omniscience is the knowledge of all things.

original: don te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: don te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúfor that reason‚Äù is ‚Äúfor the sake of others.‚Äù

original: lan gyi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: lan gyi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the reply is this:

original: rnam pa gcig la dmigs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ni mi gsal ba nyid dang don la ma reg pa nyid ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig la dmigs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ni mi gsal ba nyid dang don la ma reg pa nyid ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: In the inference that has one aspect as its object, there is the fault of indistinctness and the fault of not touching the object.

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa la dngos po nyid snang pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa la dngos po nyid snang pa yin te /
translated: But in the apprehension of all aspects, the thing itself appears,

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: just as in the case of the sense consciousnesses.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la yang rnam pa thams cad snang ba las gsal ba'i don gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la yang rnam pa thams cad snang ba las gsal ba'i don gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the object of clarity anything other than the appearance of all aspects in the sensory consciousnesses,

original: de tsam gyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that much is complete.

original: des na ji ltar dbang po'i mngon sum rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa nyid kyis dngos po'i yul can dang / ma 'khrul @158a * //
analyzed: des na ji ltar dbang po'i mngon sum rnam pa thams cad 'dzin pa nyid kyis dngos po'i yul can dang / ma 'khrul @158a * //
translated: Therefore, just as the sensory perception is the object of the thing by virtue of its holding all aspects, and is non-erroneous,

original: ba yin pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ba yin pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: so too is the inference of all aspects.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum dang de la tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum dang de la tha dad pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between the two, perception and inference,

original: 'on kyang mngon sum dang mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum dang mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but rather the meaning is that inference is similar to perception.

original: gal te mngon sum ni dbang po la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum ni dbang po la brten pa yin la /
translated: If perception is based on the senses,

original: 'di ni yid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ni yid ma yin nam /
translated: but this is the intellect,

original: des na ji ltar mtshungs pa yin snyam na /üîΩdbang po dang ni 'brel pas kyang //
analyzed: des na ji ltar mtshungs pa yin snyam na / dbang po dang ni 'brel pas kyang //
translated: how can it be similar?

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said:üîΩEven though it is connected with the intellect,üîΩit is similar to perception.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad yongs su gcod pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad yongs su gcod pa las so //
translated: From that means from the determination of all aspects.

original: de yod do zhe na ni de tsam nyid kyis don mngon du byed pas mngon sum nyid du grub pa'i phyir /üîΩdbang po dang 'brel pa'i sgra ni gzhan la rab tu grags pas yin no //
analyzed: de yod do zhe na ni de tsam nyid kyis don mngon du byed pas mngon sum nyid du grub pa'i phyir / dbang po dang 'brel pa'i sgra ni gzhan la rab tu grags pas yin no //
translated: If you say that it does exist, then it is established as perception itself, since it is the direct experience of the object just as it is.

original: dbang po'i byed pa la ltos pas ci bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa la ltos pas ci bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is well known to others in the sense of ‚Äúin dependence on the activity of the sense faculty.‚ÄùüîΩWhat is the use of that?

original: gal te rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa /
translated: If all aspects are inferred,

original: ci shes pa nyid gcig yin nam 'on te du ma yin ;
analyzed: ci shes pa nyid gcig yin nam 'on te du ma yin ;
translated: is the cognition one or many?

original: re zhig gcig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gcig ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not one,

original: rnam pa so so la rtags gzhan dang gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba ni rjes su dpog pa gcig tu 'os par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa so so la rtags gzhan dang gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba ni rjes su dpog pa gcig tu 'os par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: because each aspect is produced by a different mark. How could it be proper to infer one thing?

original: 'di 'dra pa'i rgyu las skyes par nges pa nyid ni 'di 'dra ba'i 'bras bu byed par nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di 'dra pa'i rgyu las skyes par nges pa nyid ni 'di 'dra ba'i 'bras bu byed par nges pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not certain that what is produced by a cause like that will produce a result like that.

original: 'on te de ma yin na de yang cig car rim gyis 'byung ba zhig yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de ma yin na de yang cig car rim gyis 'byung ba zhig yin te /
translated: Or, if it is not like that, then it arises either simultaneously or successively.

original: re zhig rnam par rtog pa rnams la ni cig car 'byung ba mi srid do //
analyzed: re zhig rnam par rtog pa rnams la ni cig car 'byung ba mi srid do //
translated: First, it is not possible for conceptual cognitions to arise simultaneously.

original: rim gyis yin na ni rnam par rtogs pa rnams so sor dmigs pa re re la dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rim gyis yin na ni rnam par rtogs pa rnams so sor dmigs pa re re la dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is gradual, then because of the observation of each individual conceptualization,

original: rnam pa thams cad spyod yul du byed pa'i mngon sum las tha mi dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad spyod yul du byed pa'i mngon sum las tha mi dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be different from direct perception that takes all aspects as its object.

original: ma 'khrul pa tsam gyis ni mngon sum ma yin gyis 'on kyang rtogs pa med par gyur na'o //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa tsam gyis ni mngon sum ma yin gyis 'on kyang rtogs pa med par gyur na'o //
translated: It is not direct perception merely because of non-error, but rather because of the absence of conceptualization.

original: des na ji ltar rjes dpag rnam par rtog pa mngon sum nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar rjes dpag rnam par rtog pa mngon sum nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how is inference not direct perception that is conceptual?

original: 'di la smras pa rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa'i sgras rjes su dpog pa nyid ni brjod par 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa'i sgras rjes su dpog pa nyid ni brjod par 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, it is said that the word ‚Äúinfer‚Äù is not intended to mean ‚Äúinfer all aspects,‚Äù

original: 'on kyang 'bras bu la rgyu nye bar btags nas rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa goms pa brgyud pa las skyes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid rnam pa thams cad mngon sum byed /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'bras bu la rgyu nye bar btags nas rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa goms pa brgyud pa las skyes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid rnam pa thams cad mngon sum byed /
translated: but rather, having applied the cause to the effect, the mind that is non-conceptual and directly perceives all aspects is produced from the continuum of familiarization with inferring all aspects.

original: skad cig so so zhing re rer gyur pa //
analyzed: skad cig so so zhing re rer gyur pa //
translated: It arises in each moment, each time.

original: @158b rnam pa thams cad la rnam par rtog pa skyed pa dang / de dang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad 'jug bar rung ba nyid 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: @158b rnam pa thams cad la rnam par rtog pa skyed pa dang / de dang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad 'jug bar rung ba nyid 'dod pa yin te /
translated: It is asserted that it generates a conception of all aspects and is suitable to be engaged by the conventions that accord with it.üîΩ

original: zor yang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zor yang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is maintained that the conceptualization of all aspects and the suitability of engaging in conventional expressions that accord with that are light because they are light.üîΩIt is also taught that they are not to be established by any other means.

original: thabs gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par bstan pa yang 'di skad bstan pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: thabs gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par bstan pa yang 'di skad bstan pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the result of the teaching.

original: de skad du yang ji ltar rjes su dpag pas de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa nyid du rtogs pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa des skyes pa'i mngon sum yang yin no //
analyzed: de skad du yang ji ltar rjes su dpag pas de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa nyid du rtogs pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa des skyes pa'i mngon sum yang yin no //
translated: Just as it is realized by inference that they are past and future, etc., in the same way, it is also direct perception generated by that inference.

original: de skad du yang ji ltar rjes su dpag pa des bskyed pa'i mngon sum nyid gzhan du rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du yang ji ltar rjes su dpag pa des bskyed pa'i mngon sum nyid gzhan du rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also explained that just as it is realized by inference, it is not realized otherwise by direct perception generated by that inference.

original: de'i phyir brjod pa'i sun 'byin pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod pa'i sun 'byin pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the stated refutation does not exist.

original: gal te de ltar de rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum nyid yin na de ni mngon sum las gzhan min zhes ci ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar de rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum nyid yin na de ni mngon sum las gzhan min zhes ci ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If that is a direct perception of a yogi, how can it be said that it is not different from direct perception?

original: de'i ngo bo yongs su ma rdzogs par dgos pa na brjod lugs 'di 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo yongs su ma rdzogs par dgos pa na brjod lugs 'di 'dra ba yin no //
translated: When its nature is not fully accomplished, it is expressed in this way.

original: dper na 'di bram ze las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: dper na 'di bram ze las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like saying, This is not different from a Brahmin.

original: bden te 'on te dbang po rnams yod pa dang phrad na skyes bus blo skyes pa de ni mngon sum yin no zhes bya bar gzhan gyi lugs la ltos na ma rdzogs par dogs par yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bden te 'on te dbang po rnams yod pa dang phrad na skyes bus blo skyes pa de ni mngon sum yin no zhes bya bar gzhan gyi lugs la ltos na ma rdzogs par dogs par yod pa nyid do //
translated: It is true, but if the sense faculties exist and are contacted, the cognition produced by a person is direct perception. Thus, in relation to the other system, there is indeed a doubt that it is not fully accomplished.

original: de nyid ston pa ni gal te dbang po la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni gal te dbang po la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To show just that, it says, If the sense faculties...

original: pra te'i sgra ni mtshan nyid kyi don yin la /
analyzed: pra te'i sgra ni mtshan nyid kyi don yin la /
translated: The word prƒÅpti has the meaning of characteristic.

original: 'dir mtshan nyid kyi don kyang rten gyi don du rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mtshan nyid kyi don kyang rten gyi don du rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of characteristic should be understood in the sense of basis.

original: dbang po la rten par byed pa'i blo ni dbang po mtshon par byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: dbang po la rten par byed pa'i blo ni dbang po mtshon par byed pa kho na'o //
translated: The cognition that takes the sense faculties as its basis is only what characterizes the sense faculties.

original: pra te ksha'i sgra la yod pa'i pra te ni /üîΩrten pa'i don te /
analyzed: pra te ksha'i sgra la yod pa'i pra te ni / rten pa'i don te /
translated: The term pratyak·π£a has the meaning of pratyaya.

original: rten pa'i don to zhes bya pa'o ;
analyzed: rten pa'i don to zhes bya pa'o ;
translated: The meaning of pratyaya is ‚Äúhaving a basis.‚Äù

original: / don yin pa'i phyir na dbang po la brten pa zhes bya ba'i ngag brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: / don yin pa'i phyir na dbang po la brten pa zhes bya ba'i ngag brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because it has that meaning, the expression ‚Äúhaving a basis in the sense faculties‚Äù is used.

original: lan du 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthis‚Äù refers to the sense faculty.

original: dbang po la brten pa nyid mngon sum gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po la brten pa nyid mngon sum gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: Having a basis in the sense faculty is not the nature of perception.

original: 'o na rang bzhin gang yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin gang yin snyam na /
translated: What then is its nature?

original: 'on kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúhowever‚Äù is stated in response to this question.

original: 'di nyid ni rtog pa dang / bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid dag go //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni rtog pa dang / bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid dag go //
translated: This is the definition of being free from conceptuality and non-deluded.

original: mngon sum zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: mngon sum zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa'am /
translated: It is designated as ‚Äúperception‚Äù or

original: 'dogs su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dogs su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: is made to be designated as such.

original: des na mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the definition is the nature.

original: nye bar mtshan pa tsam ni skabs kyis mngon du byed pa nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: nye bar mtshan pa tsam ni skabs kyis mngon du byed pa nyid kyi'o //
translated: The mere indication is due to the context being made evident.

original: des na dbang po @159a * //
analyzed: des na dbang po @159a * //
translated: Therefore, the sense faculty

original: dang 'brel pa med kyang mngon du byed pa tsam gyis mngon sum gyi sgra 'jug par grub pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dang 'brel pa med kyang mngon du byed pa tsam gyis mngon sum gyi sgra 'jug par grub pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that even though there is no connection, it is established that the word ‚Äúperception‚Äù is used merely because it makes the object manifest.

original: dbang po'i rang bzhin nges pa ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang po'i rang bzhin nges pa ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: There is no certainty that the nature of the sense faculty is the cause,

original: 'on kyang don mngon du byed pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i don te //
analyzed: 'on kyang don mngon du byed pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i don te //
translated: but the meaning of the statement is that it is the cause of the arising of the consciousness that makes the object manifest.

original: gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is stated.

original: rab rib las byung ba la ni dbang po'i byed pa yod pa yin na /
analyzed: rab rib las byung ba la ni dbang po'i byed pa yod pa yin na /
translated: In the case of the arising of the sense consciousness from cataracts, the sense faculty is the cause,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it does not make the nature of the object manifest.

original: des na ji ltar dbang po la brten pa tsam gyis mngon sum yin /
analyzed: des na ji ltar dbang po la brten pa tsam gyis mngon sum yin /
translated: So how can it be a perception merely because it is based on the sense faculty?

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba'o //üîΩde nyid du thal pa ni dbang po nyid du thal ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba'o // de nyid du thal pa ni dbang po nyid du thal ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that case‚Äù anticipates an objection from the opponent.üîΩThe absurd consequence is that the sense faculty itself would be the consciousness.

original: yid kyang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba mngon du byed pa'i mngon sum skye ba ste /
analyzed: yid kyang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba mngon du byed pa'i mngon sum skye ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind also‚Äù means that the arising of the perception that makes the object manifest.

original: rnam pa thams cad goms pa'i mthar thug pa'i gnas pa de'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad goms pa'i mthar thug pa'i gnas pa de'o //
translated: It is the state of the final limit of the cultivation of all aspects.

original: yid de ni don gsal bar shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dbang po yang yin la /
analyzed: yid de ni don gsal bar shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dbang po yang yin la /
translated: And that mind is a sense faculty because it is the cause of the clear knowledge of the object.

original: ldog pa gzhan las de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang yin pa la 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: ldog pa gzhan las de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang yin pa la 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: What contradiction is there in its being the immediately preceding condition from the cessation of another?

original: 'on te dbang pos bskyed pa tsam gyis ni mngon sum du mi smra'o //
analyzed: 'on te dbang pos bskyed pa tsam gyis ni mngon sum du mi smra'o //
translated: But if one does not call it direct perception merely because it is produced by a sense faculty,

original: 'on kyang yod pa dang phrad na skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang yod pa dang phrad na skyes pa'o //
translated: then it is produced when it comes into contact with an existent object.

original: des na ji ltar nyams pa la thal bar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar nyams pa la thal bar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How then does this lead to the fault of overextension?

original: 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
translated: The idea is as follows:

original: de'i tshe yang zla ba gcig dang lhan cig phrad pa yod pa nyid pas ji ltar spongs /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang zla ba gcig dang lhan cig phrad pa yod pa nyid pas ji ltar spongs /
translated: Even at that time, since it exists in contact with the one moon, how can it be abandoned?

original: 'on te gang zhig snang ba de dang lhan cig phrad pa brjod par 'dod pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te gang zhig snang ba de dang lhan cig phrad pa brjod par 'dod pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that it is asserted that it comes into contact with that which appears,

original: de lta na ni 'o na yod pa zla ba gcig dang 'brel pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis su shes pa nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na yod pa zla ba gcig dang 'brel pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis su shes pa nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: then in that case, since it is related to the one moon that exists, it is not tenable that it is the cognition of two moons.

original: de bas gdon mi za bar 'di skad brjod dgos te /
analyzed: de bas gdon mi za bar 'di skad brjod dgos te /
translated: Therefore, it must be said without doubt:

original: de ni dbang po nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni dbang po nyid ma yin te /
translated: That is not the sense faculty,

original: yod ba'i zla ba gcig dang phrad kyang shes pa la de'i rnam par 'jog par mi nus pa'i phyir dang med pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes so //
analyzed: yod ba'i zla ba gcig dang phrad kyang shes pa la de'i rnam par 'jog par mi nus pa'i phyir dang med pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes so //
translated: because even when it is in contact with an existent single moon, it is not able to posit the aspect of that in consciousness, and because it sees what is nonexistent.

original: de lta na ni 'o na yod pa'i rnam par snang pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i kho na dbang po yin na zhes bya ba 'di na gyis byung pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na yod pa'i rnam par snang pa'i shes pa bskyed pa'i kho na dbang po yin na zhes bya ba 'di na gyis byung pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then this is what has been stated: ‚ÄúThe sense faculty is just that which generates a consciousness that appears as existent.‚ÄùüîΩIf that is so, then it is not contradictory that the mental faculty is a sense faculty.

original: de lta na ni yid kyang dbang po nyid du mi 'gal lo de lta na 'on long med pa la sogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni yid kyang dbang po nyid du mi 'gal lo de lta na 'on long med pa la sogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But if that is so, then even the blind and the deaf would not be blind and deaf,

original: de dag gi rgyud las /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyud las /
translated: because those faculties exist in their continuums.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'du byed yongs su smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i 'du byed yongs su smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not so, because the maturation of the formative forces of that kind does not exist in their continuums.

original: @159b 'dis ni mngon du byed pa rgyu nyid kyi dbang po yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: @159b 'dis ni mngon du byed pa rgyu nyid kyi dbang po yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This teaches that the sense faculty is the cause of the actualization of the object.

original: yang gang gi tshe mngon du byed pa la yid kyi byed pa 'dod pa de'i tshe yang gtso bo ni yid kho na yin no zhes ston par byed pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe mngon du byed pa la yid kyi byed pa 'dod pa de'i tshe yang gtso bo ni yid kho na yin no zhes ston par byed pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, when one wishes to manifest the mental faculty in the desire realm, it is the mental faculty alone that is primary.

original: rnam par 'khrugs la zhes bya ba ni bsam pa gzhan la zhugs pa'i dus sam /
analyzed: rnam par 'khrugs la zhes bya ba ni bsam pa gzhan la zhugs pa'i dus sam /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, when disturbed‚Äù means when one is engaged in another thought,

original: mya ngan la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: mya ngan la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: or when one is in a state of sorrow, etc.

original: gal te don gzhan sems pa'i dus na shes pa nyid ma skyes pa la yin nam /
analyzed: gal te don gzhan sems pa'i dus na shes pa nyid ma skyes pa la yin nam /
translated: If, at the time of thinking of another object, consciousness itself is not born,

original: de la mi gsal ba gang la yod /
analyzed: de la mi gsal ba gang la yod /
translated: how could there be any unclear state?

original: mya ngan la yang dbang po nyid nyams pa'i phyir mi gsal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan la yang dbang po nyid nyams pa'i phyir mi gsal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: In sorrow, too, there is no unclear state because the faculty itself is impaired.

original: smras pa shin tu nus pa med pa na ga las shes pa ma skyes pa de nyid las nus pa med pa cung zad zi ba na mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can 'ga' zhig skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: smras pa shin tu nus pa med pa na ga las shes pa ma skyes pa de nyid las nus pa med pa cung zad zi ba na mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can 'ga' zhig skye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: We say that when there is no capacity at all, consciousness is not born. From that very state of no capacity, when there is a slight increase in capacity, there is the arising of a certain unclear state. This is the only logical explanation.

original: mya ngan gyis 'khrugs pa ni dbang po nyams pa mi gsal pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bas ni mi gsal ba yid kyi nus pa chen po nyid du gsal par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan gyis 'khrugs pa ni dbang po nyams pa mi gsal pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bas ni mi gsal ba yid kyi nus pa chen po nyid du gsal par byas pa yin te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúagitation due to sorrow is the cause of the unclear faculties‚Äù clarifies that unclear cognition is the great power of the mind.

original: dbang po yang rnam par bsgyur nas shes pa yang mi gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po yang rnam par bsgyur nas shes pa yang mi gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even when the faculties are transformed, cognition is made unclear.

original: gal te dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba med par mi gsal ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba med par mi gsal ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If unclear cognition does not occur without a transformation of the faculties,

original: de nyid gtso bo ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid gtso bo ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: isn‚Äôt that transformation the primary cause of unclear cognition?

original: ma yin te /üîΩdbang po nyams par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ma yin te / dbang po nyams par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: No, it is not.üîΩBecause unclear cognition depends on the faculties being impaired

original: gsal bar gyur pa de nyid la rag las pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gsal bar gyur pa de nyid la rag las pa'i phyir na /
translated: or clear.

original: 'di ni yid dang 'brel pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yid dang 'brel pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore it is only related to the mind.

original: 'o na mya ngan la sogs pa nyams pa nyid 'khrul par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na mya ngan la sogs pa nyams pa nyid 'khrul par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if that is so, then agitation due to sorrow would be a fault.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: yid gtso bo yin yang dbang po la rtog pa'i phyir ni 'di dbang po'i 'khrul pa yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: yid gtso bo yin yang dbang po la rtog pa'i phyir ni 'di dbang po'i 'khrul pa yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: Even though the mind is primary, because it is conceptual, it is said to be a fault of the faculties.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the objection.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the reply.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpag par 'dod pa na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpag par 'dod pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù is the desire to infer all aspects.

original: lkog nyid ni lkog gyur shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: lkog nyid ni lkog gyur shes pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúConcealed‚Äù is the very knowledge of the concealed.

original: yul mngon du byed pa'i bya ba la 'jug pa gang yin pa de nyid mngon sum zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yul mngon du byed pa'i bya ba la 'jug pa gang yin pa de nyid mngon sum zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: That which engages in the action of manifesting the object is called perception.

original: gal te mngon du byed pa la 'thad pa yin na mngon sum la cis gegs byed /
analyzed: gal te mngon du byed pa la 'thad pa yin na mngon sum la cis gegs byed /
translated: If it is tenable to manifest, what obstructs perception?

original: yang na 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa na'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa na'o //
translated: Or, ‚Äúthis‚Äù refers to the past, etc.

original: ji ltar lkog gyur nyid de ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar lkog gyur nyid de ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: How is it concealed? It is not so.

original: @160a * // mngon du byas pa lkog gyur nyid yin na nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: @160a * // mngon du byas pa lkog gyur nyid yin na nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: If what is manifested is concealed, what is the fault?

original: mngon du byas pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon du byas pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúby the manifested.‚Äù

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa ni lhag pa brjod pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa ni lhag pa brjod pa'i don du'o //
translated: The objection ‚Äúif‚Äù is for the purpose of stating an additional point.

original: de la sngar ni mngon du byed pa tsam gyis mngon sum yin gyi /
analyzed: de la sngar ni mngon du byed pa tsam gyis mngon sum yin gyi /
translated: There, previously it was said that mere manifestation is perception.

original: dbang po la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang po la ltos pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin la /
translated: But it is not dependent on the sense faculty.

original: de ma thag par ni mngon du byed pa rgyu yin pa'i phyir yid nyid dbang po yin no shes gzhung btsugs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de ma thag par ni mngon du byed pa rgyu yin pa'i phyir yid nyid dbang po yin no shes gzhung btsugs pa yin zhing /
translated: In the context of the immediately preceding condition, the mind itself is the sense faculty, because the cause is that which makes something manifest.

original: de lta na ni gal te mngon du byed pa dbang po la rag las na de'i tshe dbang po byed pa yang rjes su dpag pas grub par nges par khas blang bar bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni gal te mngon du byed pa dbang po la rag las na de'i tshe dbang po byed pa yang rjes su dpag pas grub par nges par khas blang bar bya'o zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if the act of making something manifest depends on the sense faculty, then it must definitely be accepted that the activity of the sense faculty is established by inference.

original: de nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: dbang po byed pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po byed pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: That very activity of the sense faculty is called the sense faculty.

original: dbang po'i mngon sum 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: dbang po'i mngon sum 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the direct perception of the sense faculty,

original: rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpag pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpag pa la yang ngo //
translated: but also all aspects are inferred.

original: 'on te gang gis yod par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa 'di ji ltar rtogs snyam na rjes su dpag pa'i 'jug pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te gang gis yod par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa 'di ji ltar rtogs snyam na rjes su dpag pa'i 'jug pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if it is asked how this is understood, it is said that the operation of inference is as follows.

original: da lta ba dang gzhan pa'i mig la sogs pa'i byed pa yang rjes su dpag pa nyid las rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: da lta ba dang gzhan pa'i mig la sogs pa'i byed pa yang rjes su dpag pa nyid las rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The activity of the present and other eyes, etc. is also understood from inference alone.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i don 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i don 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
translated: It is not only the object of the past, etc.

original: thams cad la mngon du byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad la mngon du byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is directly perceived in all cases.

original: da ltar ba dang gzhan pa'i byed pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba dang gzhan pa'i byed pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the activity of the present and other is understood.

original: yang na yang gi sgra ni zhes gnas pa so so'i skye bo dang 'brel pa la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na yang gi sgra ni zhes gnas pa so so'i skye bo dang 'brel pa la blta bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù should be viewed as connected with the word ‚Äúordinary person‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe activity of the ordinary person‚Äôs eye, etc.‚Äù

original: so so'i skye bo'i dbang po'i byed pa yang rjes su dpag pa nyid las yin gyi mngon sum las rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i dbang po'i byed pa yang rjes su dpag pa nyid las yin gyi mngon sum las rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The activity of the ordinary person‚Äôs sense faculty is also from inference alone, it is not understood from direct perception.

original: 'on te mig la sogs pa'i byed pa med bzhin du mngon du byed pa yin no zhes bya bar brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te mig la sogs pa'i byed pa med bzhin du mngon du byed pa yin no zhes bya bar brjod na /
translated: But if you say that the activity of the eye, etc. is directly perceived even though it does not exist,

original: 'on ni mngon sum du byed pa dbang po'i byed pa la rag las pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: 'on ni mngon sum du byed pa dbang po'i byed pa la rag las pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: then it is established that direct perception does not depend on the activity of the sense faculty.

original: des na dbang po'i byed pa med kyang mngon du byed pa tsam gyis mngon sum gyi sgra 'jug par grub po zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na dbang po'i byed pa med kyang mngon du byed pa tsam gyis mngon sum gyi sgra 'jug par grub po zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the intention that the term ‚Äúdirect perception‚Äù is used merely because it is made evident, even though the activity of the sense faculty is absent.

original: de'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa dang / de la brten pa dbang po'i byed pa rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa na de mngon du byed pa rnal 'byor pa'i zhes pa la gnyi ga'i yang nus pa yod pa kho na 'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa la sogs pa dang / de la brten pa dbang po'i byed pa rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa na de mngon du byed pa rnal 'byor pa'i zhes pa la gnyi ga'i yang nus pa yod pa kho na 'o //
translated: Therefore, when the past, etc., and the activity of the sense faculty that is based on it are realized through inference, then the yogi‚Äôs direct perception of it has the power of both.

original: des na 'das pa la sogs pa rig pa ji ltar mngon sum @160b yin te /
analyzed: des na 'das pa la sogs pa rig pa ji ltar mngon sum @160b yin te /
translated: How then is the awareness of the past, etc., direct perception?

original: 'byung ba dang byung ba'i dbang po'i byed pas bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang byung ba'i dbang po'i byed pas bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is generated by the activity of the sense faculty of the present.

original: de lar 'das pa la sogs pa la rang dang gzhan gyi dbang po'i byed pa srid pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa mngon sum yin no zhes bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de lar 'das pa la sogs pa la rang dang gzhan gyi dbang po'i byed pa srid pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa mngon sum yin no zhes bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having established that the yogi‚Äôs awareness is direct perception because the activity of the sense faculty of self and others is possible with regard to the past, etc.,

original: da ni gang kho na la bsgom pa las de mngon du byed pa'i shes pa skyes pa de nyid kyi dbang po'i byed pa ni sngar yang 'das pa la sogs pa'i don la yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: da ni gang kho na la bsgom pa las de mngon du byed pa'i shes pa skyes pa de nyid kyi dbang po'i byed pa ni sngar yang 'das pa la sogs pa'i don la yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Now, in order to show that the operation of the sense faculty is also present in the cognition that arises from meditation, which makes that object manifest, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover, . . .‚Äù

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pas sngon mthong ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pas sngon mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously seen by the sense consciousness‚Äù means that the object was seen by the sense consciousness.

original: de'i tshe bdag gi mig la sogs pa'i yang byed pa rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag gi mig la sogs pa'i yang byed pa rtogs par byed do //
translated: At that time, the operation of one‚Äôs own eye, etc., is also understood.

original: gzhan gyi mig la sogs pa 'ba' zhig gis ni ma zad do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi mig la sogs pa 'ba' zhig gis ni ma zad do //
translated: It is not only the eye, etc., of another that is not exhausted.

original: gal te de ltar na'ang rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa la dbang po'i byed pa yod pa ni ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na'ang rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa la dbang po'i byed pa yod pa ni ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Even if that is so, the operation of the sense faculty is present in the inference of all aspects.

original: gar 'byung zhes smos so //
analyzed: gar 'byung zhes smos so //
translated: Where does it occur?

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù refers to the inference of all aspects.

original: de tshe nyid skyes pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa dbang po'i byed pa 'jug tu rung ba'o //
analyzed: de tshe nyid skyes pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum ma yin pa dbang po'i byed pa 'jug tu rung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that very time, the arising‚Äù means that the operation of the sense faculty is suitable to engage in the non-manifest.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni de tshe nyid skyes pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni de tshe nyid skyes pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the arising of that cognition.

original: gang gi tshe byung bar gyur pa'i don rjes su dpag pas dpog pa zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe byung bar gyur pa'i don rjes su dpag pas dpog pa zhes 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen it arises‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúthe object that is inferred is inferred by inference.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe byung bar gyur pa'i dbang po'i byed pa nyid ces bya bar yang 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i tshe byung bar gyur pa'i dbang po'i byed pa nyid ces bya bar yang 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe activity of the sense faculty that arises at that time‚Äù is also connected.

original: gal te gang gis de skad brjod par 'gyur ba 'das pa la sogs pa ji ltar yod pa nyid yin snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: gal te gang gis de skad brjod par 'gyur ba 'das pa la sogs pa ji ltar yod pa nyid yin snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: If one wonders how past and so on exist, since they are said to be like that,

original: de ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: the response is ‚ÄúThat.‚Äù

original: sngar mthong ba 'das pa la sogs pa'i don ni'o //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba 'das pa la sogs pa'i don ni'o //
translated: The object that was seen in the past and so on

original: gal te da ltar ba nyid ma yin na ji ltar yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te da ltar ba nyid ma yin na ji ltar yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: is not present. If it is not present, how can it exist?

original: med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro snyam pa ni /
analyzed: med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro snyam pa ni /
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: gal te zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩ'byung bar 'gyur ba yin yad ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ston pa ni /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba yin no // 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin yad ji ltar yod pa ma yin pa de ston pa ni /
translated: If one thinks this, the response is ‚ÄúIf it is not present.‚ÄùüîΩHow can that which will arise exist?

original: mngon du byed nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon du byed nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: To explain this, it is said ‚Äúit is not as if it is not present.‚Äù

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIn every way‚Äù means also in the present.

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni da lta bar mngon par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni da lta bar mngon par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The latter half of the verse is explained as follows: ‚ÄúIf it is held that it is present, then it is not non-existent.‚Äù

original: gal te mngon du byed pa med kyang rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba la yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mngon du byed pa med kyang rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba la yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not manifest, is it not to be understood through inference?

original: des na de las gzhan yod pa nyid yod pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /üîΩgal te me la sogs pa @161a * //
analyzed: des na de las gzhan yod pa nyid yod pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni / gal te me la sogs pa @161a * //
translated: Therefore, it is suspected that its existence is in something other than that.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is:üîΩ‚ÄúIf fire is not manifest, it is not inferred.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa la yang snang bzhin pa nyid rnam par brtag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la yang snang bzhin pa nyid rnam par brtag par bya ba yin te /
translated: In inference, the appearance itself is to be considered,üîΩbecause it is conceived in that way.

original: de ltar lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes lan btab pa ni ma yin te der yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes lan btab pa ni ma yin te der yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is: ‚ÄúNor is it in that.‚Äù

original: de lta bu nyid ni mngon du byed pa dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ni mngon du byed pa dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: Suchness is the possession of manifestation.

original: de ci'i phyir snyam na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir snyam na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon du byas pa'am zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon du byas pa'am zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúIf it is manifest, or if it is inferred.‚Äù

original: byed pa'am zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa'am zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is inferred‚Äù should be understood as ‚Äúif it is by another.‚Äù

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni mthong ba med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni mthong ba med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would be non-existent.

original: gal te mthong na ni blta bar rung ba nyid ma yin blta ba'i yul nyid du ni ma yin zhes bya bar ci ste mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te mthong na ni blta bar rung ba nyid ma yin blta ba'i yul nyid du ni ma yin zhes bya bar ci ste mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If it were seen, then why wouldn‚Äôt it be suitable to be seen? Why wouldn‚Äôt it be an object of sight?

original: mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes brjod pa ni mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩci'i phyir snyam na de lta ma yin na mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes brjod pa ni mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa na zhes bya ba'o // ci'i phyir snyam na de lta ma yin na mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is said that it would not be, because if it were seen, it would not be tenable.

original: ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would not be related.

original: mthong bar bya ba nyid khyab byed du nye bar bzung nas rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong bar bya ba nyid khyab byed du nye bar bzung nas rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: It is an inference based on the pervasion of the object of sight.üîΩIf it were not seen, then the eye and so on would be for the sake of another.

original: mi mthong na ni mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te zhes bya ba ni mi mthong ba'i ma 'dus pa gzhan gyi don yang bsgrub bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mthong na ni mig la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi don yin te zhes bya ba ni mi mthong ba'i ma 'dus pa gzhan gyi don yang bsgrub bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be established that the eye and so on are for the sake of another, because they are not included in the seen.

original: des na mi mthong pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa nye bar mtshon pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mi mthong pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa nye bar mtshon pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, not seeing does not indicate existence.

original: gal te gang du rtags nyid 'ga' zhig gi mngon sum gyi rtags can ni ma yin pa'i de 'dra ba'i dpral la mthong bar gyur pa dang / mthong ba dang / mthong bar 'gyur ba rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ngal ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar mngon du byas pa las yod pa nyid gzhan ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang du rtags nyid 'ga' zhig gi mngon sum gyi rtags can ni ma yin pa'i de 'dra ba'i dpral la mthong bar gyur pa dang / mthong ba dang / mthong bar 'gyur ba rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i ngal ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar mngon du byas pa las yod pa nyid gzhan ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the sign itself is not the direct perception of some, then how could existence be non-different from what is directly perceived, since it is not inferred in that way, on the forehead, or in seeing or in what will be seen?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: der yang 'brel ba dang ldan pa mthong ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas na mthong ba nyid rjes su dpag bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: der yang 'brel ba dang ldan pa mthong ba gzhan du mi 'thad pas na mthong ba nyid rjes su dpag bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Even there, since it is not tenable that what is seen as related is different, seeing itself is what is inferred,

original: mi slu ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slu ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is non-deceptive.

original: ma mthong ba la ni mi slu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba la ni mi slu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in what is not seen, there is no non-deceptiveness.

original: ldog pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ldog pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression of the counter-position is:

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is said.

original: gal te nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i med pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa'i med pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If non-existence is not empty of all abilities,

original: ji ltar dus gsum du mthong ba yin snyam na //
analyzed: ji ltar dus gsum du mthong ba yin snyam na //
translated: how is it seen in the three times?

original: nus par nye bar brjod ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nus par nye bar brjod ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is expressed as an ability.

original: nus bar nye bar brjod pa thams cad ces bya ba ni mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas bskyed pa de ni 'di'o zhes bya bar bsnyad @161b ba'o ;
analyzed: nus bar nye bar brjod pa thams cad ces bya ba ni mngon sum gyi rjes las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas bskyed pa de ni 'di'o zhes bya bar bsnyad @161b ba'o ;
translated: All expressions of potentiality are called ‚Äúexpressions‚Äù because they are produced by conceptual thought that arises subsequent to perception and are described as ‚Äúthis is that.‚Äù

original: / de dang bral ba ni med pa'o //
analyzed: / de dang bral ba ni med pa'o //
translated: The absence of that is ‚Äúnon-expression.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni gzhan ma yin te /
translated: That itself is ‚Äúnon-different,‚Äù

original: nye bar brjod pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nye bar brjod pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: because it is the absence of expression.

original: nye bar rdzod par byed pas na nye bar brjod pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar rdzod par byed pas na nye bar brjod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúExpression‚Äù means that which expresses.

original: de gang la med pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la med pa'o //
translated: That which does not have that is ‚Äúnon-expression.‚Äù

original: de'i ngo bo ni nye bar brjod pa med pa ste mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni nye bar brjod pa med pa ste mi snang ba'o //
translated: The nature of that is ‚Äúnon-expression,‚Äù i.e., non-appearance.

original: dus gsum du mthong ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus gsum du mthong ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not seen in the three times.

original: gal te mthong bar bya ba nyid yin na kho bo cag la sogs pa nyid kyis mthong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba las 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te mthong bar bya ba nyid yin na kho bo cag la sogs pa nyid kyis mthong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba las 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba yin gyi /
translated: If it were an object of seeing, it would be seen by us and so on, and the distinction of coming and so on would be based on the distinction of seeing and so on.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the domain of the yogi‚Äôs direct perception.

original: thams cad mthong bzhin pa nyid kyis na da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgos pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad mthong bzhin pa nyid kyis na da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgos pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The point is that if it were the case that the present is seen, then it would be the present because it is being seen.

original: da ltar byung ba tsam mthong ba mngon du byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba tsam mthong ba mngon du byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the present that is seen, it is being perceived.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa mthong pa med pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa mthong pa med pas na'o //
translated: Therefore, because the past and so on are not seen,

original: de la dus dang 'brel pa las ni da ltar ba la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la dus dang 'brel pa las ni da ltar ba la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, it is not the present and so on that are related to time.

original: de ni tshad mas rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ni tshad mas rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Because they are not established by valid cognition, it is explained:

original: dus ni tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus ni tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Time is not established by valid cognition.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is because it is not perceived.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pas dus rtogs par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pas dus rtogs par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think that time is understood through inference,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that inference is also not possible.

original: 'jug pa zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes 'brel to //
translated: It is connected to the word ‚Äúfunctioning.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe mi 'jug snyam na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi 'jug snyam na /
translated: When does it not function?

original: mngon sum 'jug pa las 'das nas so //
analyzed: mngon sum 'jug pa las 'das nas so //
translated: It is said that it does not function when it has passed beyond the functioning of perception.

original: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: It is explained that it is not perceived.

original: de'i rnam pa tsam dang ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa tsam dang ngo /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa tsam dang ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa tsam dang ngo /
translated: The mere aspect of that, and the mere aspect of form, etc.

original: gal te mngon du gyur ba'i dngos po nye bar gzhag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la brten pa'i mngon sum gyis don ston pa yin gyi rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam na /
analyzed: gal te mngon du gyur ba'i dngos po nye bar gzhag pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la brten pa'i mngon sum gyis don ston pa yin gyi rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúIt is just the nature of the thing that is present that is indicated by perception, not by another aspect,‚Äù

original: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa zhes smos so //
translated: [the root text] states, ‚Äúthe aspect that is present in front.‚Äù

original: gal te bum pa'am g-yo ba zhes rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang mthong ba kho na ma yin nam snyam du dgos na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa'am g-yo ba zhes rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang mthong ba kho na ma yin nam snyam du dgos na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt it just that one sees a pot or movement by another aspect?‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes gsungs so //
translated: [The root text] states, ‚ÄúIf that were not so . . .‚Äù

original: mdun na gnas pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa ni byad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa ni byad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that it is not the case that one apprehends an aspect that is not present in front, because that is not possible.

original: gal te dus kyang de bzhin du dmigs pa yod pa nyid do snyam na /üîΩdus ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te dus kyang de bzhin du dmigs pa yod pa nyid do snyam na / dus ni zhes smos so //
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúTime is also just so; it exists as an object of perception,‚Äù

original: rjes su @162a * //
analyzed: rjes su @162a * //
translated: [the root text] states, ‚ÄúTime is . . .‚ÄùüîΩ[The root text] states, ‚ÄúIt is not . . .‚Äù

original: dpag pa yang zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i cha 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: dpag pa yang zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i cha 'chad pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand also by inference‚Äù is a continuation of the verse that begins ‚Äúand also by inference.‚Äù

original: gal te dus ni mngon sum la sogs pa tshad mas yang dag par rtogs par bya ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dus ni mngon sum la sogs pa tshad mas yang dag par rtogs par bya ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If time is not to be understood by means of the valid forms of knowledge, such as perception,üîΩthen why does the verse say, ‚ÄúBy no valid cognition whatsoever is time apprehended‚Äù?

original: des na dus ni tshad ma gang gis kyang zhes ji ste brjod snyam du dgos par byed pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na dus ni tshad ma gang gis kyang zhes ji ste brjod snyam du dgos par byed pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúBut if time is not apprehended‚Äù raises this question.

original: yun ring du byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtogs pas ni rdzas kyi khyad par du dus nges pa yin no //
analyzed: yun ring du byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtogs pas ni rdzas kyi khyad par du dus nges pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúTime is ascertained as a particular substance‚Äù means that time is ascertained as a particular substance by the cognition that arises from the expression ‚Äúa long time has passed.‚Äù
