original: brjod pa nyid du ma rtogs na /
analyzed: brjod pa nyid du ma rtogs na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the Veda is not a means of valid knowledge at the present time,üîΩhow can it be a means of valid knowledge at another time?üîΩ‚Äù The author replies:üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not so, because the Veda is not a means of valid knowledge at the present time.üîΩ‚Äù The opponent asks:

original: ji srid yod par rig byed don dang 'brel bar mi 'grub po zhes brjod pa ni de ma yin zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'di zhes bya ba ni rtogs bzhin pa nges par sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ji srid yod par rig byed don dang 'brel bar mi 'grub po zhes brjod pa ni de ma yin zhes bya ba'o // 'di zhes bya ba ni rtogs bzhin pa nges par sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the Veda is not a means of valid knowledge at the present time,üîΩhow can it be a means of valid knowledge at another time?üîΩ‚Äù The author replies:üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not so, because the Veda is not a means of valid knowledge at the present time.

original: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag tu'o ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag tu'o ;
translated: ‚Äù The opponent asks:üîΩ‚ÄúIf the Veda is not a means of valid knowledge at the present time,üîΩhow can it be a means of valid knowledge at another time?

original: /'di'i zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi'o //
analyzed: /'di'i zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi'o //
translated: ‚Äù The author replies:üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not so, because the Veda is not a means of valid knowledge at the present time.üîΩ‚Äù The opponent asks:üîΩ‚ÄúIf the Veda is not a means of valid knowledge at the present time,

original: de ltar ga la yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ga la yin te /
translated: how can it be a means of valid knowledge at another time?üîΩ‚Äù The author replies:üîΩ‚ÄúIt is not so, because the Veda is not a means of valid knowledge at the present time.üîΩ‚Äù The opponent asks:

original: rtag pa nyid kyis gtan du de'i don can ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis gtan du de'i don can ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not so, because it is permanent and does not have that object forever.

original: 'on te sdar don 'di dang ldan pa nyid du don la da ltar ni nges pa yin pa des na nyes pa 'di med do snyam na /üîΩgal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te sdar don 'di dang ldan pa nyid du don la da ltar ni nges pa yin pa des na nyes pa 'di med do snyam na / gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you think that the fault does not arise because it is now ascertained to have that object,üîΩthen the response is ‚ÄúIf it did not have that object before, it does not have it now.

original: gal te sngar the tshom za ba'i don can yin na /
analyzed: gal te sngar the tshom za ba'i don can yin na /
translated: If it had that object before, but had doubt about it,

original: de'i tshe da ltar 'ang yin ta rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe da ltar 'ang yin ta rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would have it now, because it is permanent.

original: des na sngar tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du da ltar yang ma yin pas nyes pa las 'das pa med do //
analyzed: des na sngar tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du da ltar yang ma yin pas nyes pa las 'das pa med do //
translated: Therefore, just as it was not a valid cognition before, it is not a valid cognition now, so you have not escaped the fault.

original: 'o na te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'o na te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if it did have that object before‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de lta bu nyid ni don de dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ni don de dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù means having that object.

original: des na da ltar yang tshad ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na da ltar yang tshad ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a valid cognition now.

original: lan du de'i zhes bya ba ste snga ma'o //
analyzed: lan du de'i zhes bya ba ste snga ma'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIf it did not have that object before, it does not have it now.‚Äù

original: de ltar snga ma dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag don dang ldan par rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa med do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar snga ma dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag don dang ldan par rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa med do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that there is no complete understanding of the meaning of the Veda, either in the beginning or in the end.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni don dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni don dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means: because it brings about the complete understanding of the meaning.

original: gcig la zhes bya ba ni snga ma'am phyi ma la'o //
analyzed: gcig la zhes bya ba ni snga ma'am phyi ma la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn one‚Äù means: either in the beginning or in the end.

original: the tshom za na zhes bya ba ni ci 'di'i don 'di yin nam gzhan yin zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: the tshom za na zhes bya ba ni ci 'di'i don 'di yin nam gzhan yin zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is doubt‚Äù means: ‚ÄúIs this the meaning of this or is it something else?‚Äù

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe don rtogs pa de'i tshe yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe don rtogs pa de'i tshe yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the other‚Äù means: even when the meaning is understood.

original: yid brtan du med pa ni res 'ga' don rtogs bzhin pa 'di don ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rig byed tshad ma ma yin /
analyzed: yid brtan du med pa ni res 'ga' don rtogs bzhin pa 'di don ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rig byed tshad ma ma yin /
translated: The Veda is not a valid means of knowledge because it is not reliable, since sometimes, even though the meaning is understood, it turns out that this is not the meaning.

original: the tshom za ba'i don can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i don can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has a meaning that is open to doubt.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is said‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: snga ma zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i don rtogs pa las so //
analyzed: snga ma zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i don rtogs pa las so //
translated: The former means from the understanding of the meaning of the present.

original: spyir zhes bya ba ni dus gsum khyab pa'i don rtogs par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: spyir zhes bya ba ni dus gsum khyab pa'i don rtogs par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The word generally means that it causes the understanding of the meaning that pervades the three times.

original: gcig gi tshe nyid ces bya ba ni da ltar ba'i don rtogs pa'i dus nyid na'o //
analyzed: gcig gi tshe nyid ces bya ba ni da ltar ba'i don rtogs pa'i dus nyid na'o //
translated: At the time of one means at the time of the understanding of the meaning of the present.

original: des na don dang ldan pa rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: des na don dang ldan pa rtogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the complete understanding of the meaning is endowed with meaning.

original: lan du de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, If that is so.

original: 'dir 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'di ltar bsams pa yin te /
translated: Here this is thought:

original: rig byed ni thog ma dang tha ma @168b med pa nyid kyis don dang ldan pa yin par rjes su dpag pa las rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rig byed ni thog ma dang tha ma @168b med pa nyid kyis don dang ldan pa yin par rjes su dpag pa las rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The Vedas are endowed with meaning by the inference of their beginninglessness and endlessness.

original: de lta na yang thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyis rang bzhin nyams pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyis rang bzhin nyams pa med pa yin no //
translated: Even so, by their beginninglessness and endlessness, their nature is not impaired.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'am /
translated: In the same way, by inference

original: des bskyed pa'i mngon sum gyis sam /
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i mngon sum gyis sam /
translated: or by the direct perception produced by that,

original: khyab pa 'dzin par byed pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dngos po rtogs pa na thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid nyams pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: khyab pa 'dzin par byed pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dngos po rtogs pa na thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid nyams pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Since it apprehends the pervasion, when one understands the thing that is without beginning and end, then without a doubt, the absence of beginning and end is not impaired.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: And because that is so,

original: rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it is called the inference of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pas pa skyed pa'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pas pa skyed pa'i shes pa la'o //
translated: It is in regard to the cognition that generates the inference of all aspects.

original: gal te de ltar thams cad rig pa yin du chug mod de lta na yang thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dngos po rig pa ji ltar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar thams cad rig pa yin du chug mod de lta na yang thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i dngos po rig pa ji ltar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if one allows that it is the cognition of all things in that way, still, how can the thing that is without beginning and end be cognized?

original: kyang gi sgras ni rjes su dpag pas rig pa yang ma nyams pa med do //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni rjes su dpag pas rig pa yang ma nyams pa med do //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that the cognition by inference is not impaired.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa la mi gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa la mi gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not impair the absence of beginning and end.

original: skabs kyi don sdud par byed pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs kyi don sdud par byed pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary of the topic is ‚ÄúTherefore.‚Äù

original: de dang 'brel ba ni rang gi rgyud dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba ni rang gi rgyud dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: The connection is the connection with one‚Äôs continuum.

original: gzhan pa dag kyang zhes bya ba ni de dang 'brel ba dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa dag kyang zhes bya ba ni de dang 'brel ba dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd also others‚Äù means those related to it and those related to those.

original: de'i mthu las kyang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i rab tu byed pa snang ba'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: de'i mthu las kyang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i rab tu byed pa snang ba'i stobs kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the power of that‚Äù means from the power of the manifestation of the effect.

original: rgyu'i dbye ba yang snang ba yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rgyu'i dbye ba yang snang ba yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The division of the cause is also manifested.

original: thams cad goms pa ni yang nas yang rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa byang bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad goms pa ni yang nas yang rnam pa thams cad rjes su dpog pa byang bar byas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRepeated practice‚Äù means repeated practice of all aspects of inference.

original: rig byed ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyis re zhi ga rtogs par mi bus pa nyid do //
analyzed: rig byed ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyis re zhi ga rtogs par mi bus pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúVeda‚Äù means that it is not understood because it has no beginning or end.

original: skyes bu phul du byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu phul du byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are no supreme beings.

original: rtogs su zin kyang nye bar mkho ba yang ci'ang med do zhes bshad pa ni rig byed ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs su zin kyang nye bar mkho ba yang ci'ang med do zhes bshad pa ni rig byed ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if it were understood, it would serve no purpose at all. This is explained in ‚ÄúThe Veda . . .‚Äù

original: thog ma med pa nyid du yongs su shes kyang ngo //
analyzed: thog ma med pa nyid du yongs su shes kyang ngo //
translated: Even though it is known to be beginningless,

original: thabs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dang 'brel ba ngo bo can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dang 'brel ba ngo bo can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not a means. This means it is not related to the meaning.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni stong phrag phyed dang bzhi par ro //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni stong phrag phyed dang bzhi par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously‚Äù means in the first half of the fourth chapter.üîΩEven though there is no ignorance or attachment, etc. that is the cause of making the teaching otherwise, still, for those who are free from attachment, there is a non-defiled latent impression, just as there is a body that is free from disease, but not free from the latent impression.üîΩThe doubt is that even though there is a non-concordant latent impression, there is still hunger, etc. that obstructs meditative concentration.üîΩThe doubt is that even though there is a non-concordant latent impression, there is still hunger, etc. that obstructs meditative concentration.

original: gal te yang nye bar bstan pa gzhan du byed pa'i rgyu mi shes ba'am chags pa la sogs pa med mod de lta na yang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la nyon mongs ba can ma yin pa rims nad dang bral ba'i lus la bag chags mi mthunüîΩpa ni yod pa kho na yin la //
analyzed: gal te yang nye bar bstan pa gzhan du byed pa'i rgyu mi shes ba'am chags pa la sogs pa med mod de lta na yang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la nyon mongs ba can ma yin pa rims nad dang bral ba'i lus la bag chags mi mthun pa ni yod pa kho na yin la //
translated: The doubt is that even though there is a non-concordant latent impression, there is still hunger, etc. that obstructs meditative concentration.üîΩThe doubt is that even though there is a non-concordant latent impression, there is still hunger, etc. that obstructs meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gegs bkres pa la sogs pa yang yod pa yin no snyam du dogs pa ni @169a * //üîΩgal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gegs bkres pa la sogs pa yang yod pa yin no snyam du dogs pa ni @169a * // gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is that even though there is a non-concordant latent impression, there is still hunger, etc. that obstructs meditative concentration.üîΩThe doubt is that even though there is a non-concordant latent impression, there is still hunger, etc. that obstructs meditative concentration.üîΩThe doubt is that even though there is a non-concordant latent impression, there is still hunger, etc. that obstructs meditative concentration.üîΩThe doubt is that even though there is a non-concordant latent impression, there is still hunger, etc. that obstructs meditative concentration.

original: bag chags mi mthun pa yin yang rig byed las bcom ldan 'das khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir re zhig rig byed kyi khyad bar du bshad pa ni rig byed la ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩthog ma med pa nyid kyis na gzhan don 'ga' zhig dang 'brel bar 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags mi mthun pa yin yang rig byed las bcom ldan 'das khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir re zhig rig byed kyi khyad bar du bshad pa ni rig byed la ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩthog ma med pa nyid kyis na gzhan don 'ga' zhig dang 'brel bar 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The doubt is that even though there is a non-concordant latent impression, there is still hunger, etc. that obstructs meditative concentration.üîΩThe doubt is that even though there is a non-concordant latent impression, there is still hunger, etc. that obstructs meditative concentration.üîΩThe doubt is that even though there is a non-concordant latent impression, there is still hunger, etc. that obstructs meditative concentration.üîΩThe doubt is that even though there is a non-concordant latent impression, there is still hunger, etc. that obstructs meditative concentration.üîΩThe doubt is that even though there is a non-concordant latent impression, there is still hunger, etc. that obstructs meditative concentration.

original: de tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don snang ba tsam gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don snang ba tsam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that alone‚Äù means by the mere appearance of the object to be imagined.

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni rig byed las gzhan pa'i lus la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni rig byed las gzhan pa'i lus la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn another‚Äù means in the body other than the Vedas.

original: mthong ba'i phyir ro ni rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don snang ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i phyir ro ni rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don snang ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is seen‚Äù means the appearance of the object to be imagined.

original: gal te rig byed de lta yin mod de lta na yang 'di las bcom ldan 'das khyad par du 'phags pa ci zhig yod na gang gis tshad mar gyur snyam du dogs na 'di la ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te rig byed de lta yin mod de lta na yang 'di las bcom ldan 'das khyad par du 'phags pa ci zhig yod na gang gis tshad mar gyur snyam du dogs na 'di la ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: If the Vedas are like that, then what is the special quality of the BhagavƒÅn by which he is authoritative?

original: thams cad rig pa la ni ga zhi rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad rig pa la ni ga zhi rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúIn this regard, all knowledge is inference.‚Äù

original: des na dngos po pa'i don dan 'brel pa yod par shes pa yin no /
analyzed: des na dngos po pa'i don dan 'brel pa yod par shes pa yin no /
translated: Therefore, it is known that the meaning of the Vedas is related to reality.

original: de ltar 'dis ni rang nyid don dang 'brel ba'i phyir na bag chags gegs byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dis ni rang nyid don dang 'brel ba'i phyir na bag chags gegs byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this states that because it is itself related to the meaning, the latent tendencies do not obstruct it.

original: des ni bcom ldan 'das la srid pa yang ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des ni bcom ldan 'das la srid pa yang ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One is not in existence means that he is not in existence in the sense of being a self.

original: des na zhes bya bas ni thabs goms pa phul du byung ba las gyur pa'i gsal ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya bas ni thabs goms pa phul du byung ba las gyur pa'i gsal ba ston pa'o //
translated: The word therefore indicates the manifestation of the perfection of the practice of means.

original: de ni yod kyang rang gi don dang ldan pa'i phyir ci'i don du 'bad snyam na thub chen zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni yod kyang rang gi don dang ldan pa'i phyir ci'i don du 'bad snyam na thub chen zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one should wonder, Why should one strive for that? the verse says, the great sage.

original: gzhan gyi don du 'jug pa gang la mnga' ba de'i'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du 'jug pa gang la mnga' ba de'i'o //
translated: The great sage is one who is endowed with the power to engage in the benefit of others.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi gegs yin pa'i phyir na 'di ni gdon mi za bar yang bya ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi gegs yin pa'i phyir na 'di ni gdon mi za bar yang bya ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should strive for that, because it is the obstacle to the benefit of others. The meaning is that it must be abandoned without doubt.

original: khyad 'di yin zhes bya ba ni bse ru la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: khyad 'di yin zhes bya ba ni bse ru la sogs pa ste ;
translated: The verse says, This is the difference.

original: rang gi don du 'jug pa rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa las mi mthun pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rang gi don du 'jug pa rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa las mi mthun pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difference is that the rhinoceros-like and so on are not like the solitary realizers and so on, who engage in their own goal.

original: de la nyes pa mtha' dag yongs su shes pa yod mod de yongs bar go //
analyzed: de la nyes pa mtha' dag yongs su shes pa yod mod de yongs bar go //
translated: Although they have the complete knowledge of all faults, they do not have the complete knowledge of the benefit of others.

original: ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How is that?

original: sems can gyi don la dga' ba la ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la dga' ba la ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The delight in the welfare of sentient beings is the cause.

original: nyes pa ni bag chags kyi mtshan nyid do ;
analyzed: nyes pa ni bag chags kyi mtshan nyid do ;
translated: The fault is the characteristic of the latent state.

original: ; de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ; de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means: because of being the doer of harm.

original: de zhes bya ba ni nyes pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni nyes pa'o //
translated: The it is the fault.

original: bru ba tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yang bdag dang bdag gi bar 'dzin pa'i chags pa'i snying po can gyi bag chag sdang ldan pa rnams la yin gyi dmigs pa'i tshogs pa tsam la sam yin te /
analyzed: bru ba tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yang bdag dang bdag gi bar 'dzin pa'i chags pa'i snying po can gyi bag chag sdang ldan pa rnams la yin gyi dmigs pa'i tshogs pa tsam la sam yin te /
translated: The suffering of hunger, thirst, etc. is for those who have the core of attachment to I and mine, which is the latent tendency of aversion, but not for the mere collection of objects.

original: @169b thams cad kyi tshe bde ba la sogs pa rnam pa gcig tu thal ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: @169b thams cad kyi tshe bde ba la sogs pa rnam pa gcig tu thal ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Because it would follow that all the time, pleasure, etc. would be of one kind.

original: bru ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩsogs pa'i sgras ni skom pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bru ba la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩsogs pa'i sgras ni skom pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The etc. includes thirst, etc.

original: phyin ci log la goms par byed pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chags pa'i snying po can gyi bag chags dang ldan pa rnams la'am /
analyzed: phyin ci log la goms par byed pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chags pa'i snying po can gyi bag chags dang ldan pa rnams la'am /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of those who are habituated to error‚Äù means in the case of those who possess the latent impressions of the core of attachment, which is the grasping of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: bru ba tsha ba la sogs pa zlog par byed pa med pa rnams kho na la 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bru ba tsha ba la sogs pa zlog par byed pa med pa rnams kho na la 'byung ba yin no //

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de sgom pa dang bral ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de sgom pa dang bral ba rnams la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot in others‚Äù means not in those who are free from the cultivation of that view.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Ä¶‚Äù is stated.

original: gang gi tshe sngon gyi ston pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon gyi ston pa /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the former teachers‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: btung ba dang bza' ba gya nom pa la sogs pas byas pa de dang 'brel zhing ldan pa de'i tshe bkres pa dang sman pa la sogs pa mi sring ba yin no //
analyzed: btung ba dang bza' ba gya nom pa la sogs pas byas pa de dang 'brel zhing ldan pa de'i tshe bkres pa dang sman pa la sogs pa mi sring ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äú‚Ä¶were engaged in and possessed of the performance of excellent drinking, eating, and so on, then hunger, thirst, and so on were impossible.‚Äù

original: sngon gyi ston pa ji ltar zhe na /üîΩlha sogs ngo bo yis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon gyi ston pa ji ltar zhe na / lha sogs ngo bo yis zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúHow were the former teachers?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúBy the nature of gods and so on‚Ä¶‚Äù is stated.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i lha la sogs par skyes pas so //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i lha la sogs par skyes pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy being born as gods and so on who experience the form realm.‚Äù

original: de ltar de dang 'brel par ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar de dang 'brel par ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /

original: skye ba dran pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skye ba dran pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: The verse says, ‚Äúdue to the memory of former lives.‚Äù

original: bkres pa la sogs pa ni sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa bzhin du phyir rol gyi rgyu tsam las 'byung ba yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang goms pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa can de dang 'brel pa nyid yin no
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs pa ni sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa bzhin du phyir rol gyi rgyu tsam las 'byung ba yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang goms pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa can de dang 'brel pa nyid yin no
translated: Hunger, etc., do not arise from external causes alone, like seeds, sprouts, etc., but rather they are related to the body, since they follow and reverse with the body‚Äôs habituation.

original: zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa na /
translated: If you say this,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then what about the following?

original: lan gsum za ba'i skyes bu gang yin pa de ni goms pa las gnyis za ba las kyang bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: lan gsum za ba'i skyes bu gang yin pa de ni goms pa las gnyis za ba las kyang bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro /
translated: The person who eats three times a day can live happily by eating only twice a day due to habituation.üîΩThe person who eats twice a day can obtain a happy life by eating only once a day.

original: gnyis za ba ni lan cig cig car zos pas kyang bde bar gnas pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩgtan mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i skabs kyis bco na ldan 'das la'o //
analyzed: gnyis za ba ni lan cig cig car zos pas kyang bde bar gnas pa 'thob par 'gyur ro // gtan mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i skabs kyis bco na ldan 'das la'o //
translated: The person who eats once a day can obtain a happy life by eating only a little at a time.

original: sa bo na dang myu gu bzhin du phyi rol tsam las byung ba yin na skyon ci yong snyam na /
analyzed: sa bo na dang myu gu bzhin du phyi rol tsam las byung ba yin na skyon ci yong snyam na /
translated: If hunger, etc., arise from external causes alone, like seeds, sprouts, etc., what is the error?

original: gal te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIf . . .‚ÄùüîΩüîΩ

original: bru ba la sogs pa 'di dngos po la rag pa yin na de'i tshe goms pas bsgrubs pa goms pa la rag las par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bru ba la sogs pa 'di dngos po la rag pa yin na de'i tshe goms pas bsgrubs pa goms pa la rag las par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the case that this‚Äîdigging, etc.‚Äîdepended on the thing, then it would not depend on the practice that is accomplished through habituation.

original: gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa las kyang 'di'i ji lta ba yin gyi goms pa rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa las kyang 'di'i ji lta ba yin gyi goms pa rtogs par bya ba yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And since it is engaged in the welfare of others, it is understood to be a practice. Thus, he concludes by saying, ‚ÄúTherefore . . . ‚Äù

original: sngon gyi slob dpon gyi lugs dang 'gal bas man dag med pa nying du @170a * //üîΩdogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon gyi lugs dang 'gal bas man dag med pa nying du @170a * // dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Since this contradicts the system of the former masters, he fears that it is not correct.

original: gal te slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te slob dpon gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He anticipates this objection with, ‚ÄúIf the master . . . ‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni thams cad de ston pa nyid yin la thabs goms pa yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no zhen /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni thams cad de ston pa nyid yin la thabs goms pa yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no zhen /
translated: The argument is that since all of this is the teaching itself, and the practice of the method is also something else, there is a contradiction.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon gyi ni thabs goms pa 'di nyid la nye bar btags nas ston par brjod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni thabs goms pa 'di nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon gyi ni thabs goms pa 'di nyid la nye bar btags nas ston par brjod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni thabs goms pa 'di nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The former masters explained that the method of practice is taught by applying it to this very thing. He says, ‚ÄúThis very method of practice . . . ‚Äù

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba'i nges par gzung bas ni /üîΩlus dang dbang po la sogs pa bdag tu lta ba thabs yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba'i nges par gzung bas ni / lus dang dbang po la sogs pa bdag tu lta ba thabs yin pa'am /
translated: The specification ‚Äújust this‚Äù

original: bdag khams gsum pa la sdug bsngal ba la sgom pa 'dor ba'i rgyu yin pas na thabs yin no zhes bya ba gzhan gyi lugs sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag khams gsum pa la sdug bsngal ba la sgom pa 'dor ba'i rgyu yin pas na thabs yin no zhes bya ba gzhan gyi lugs sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: eliminates other systems, such as the view that the body, faculties, etc. are the self, or that the self is the cause of the abandonment of the meditation on suffering in the three realms.

original: 'di ji ltar mi rigs pa de ltar yang phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar mi rigs pa de ltar yang phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be shown later how this is illogical.

original: thabs goms pa 'di nyid ga las yin snyam na /
analyzed: thabs goms pa 'di nyid ga las yin snyam na /
translated: If one wonders from where this cultivation of the means comes,

original: gang gi phyir ston pa yin pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ston pa yin pas so //
translated: it is because it is taught.

original: gal te ston pa ni 'bras bu yin gyi thabs ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gal te ston pa ni 'bras bu yin gyi thabs ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that the teaching is the result and not the means,

original: de don phyir na zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: de don phyir na zhes gsungs te //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúfor that purpose.‚Äù

original: ston pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩston pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na 'di nyid thabs goms pa yin gyi gzhan gyi 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ston pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro // ston pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir na 'di nyid thabs goms pa yin gyi gzhan gyi 'dod pa ni ma yin te /

original: de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is the cause of the teaching, it is the cultivation of the means, and not the assertion of others, because it is not the cause of that.

original: rnam par dbye ba 'di ga las snyam na /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba 'di ga las snyam na /
translated: If one wonders from where this classification comes,üîΩit is from the root text.

original: grub las zhes gsung te bde bar gshegs pa nyid las sngar yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgrub pa'i rna bzhin ston pa'i sgras nye bar gdags su rung ba ni 'di kha yin gyi /
analyzed: grub las zhes gsung te bde bar gshegs pa nyid las sngar yod pa'i phyir ro // grub pa'i rna bzhin ston pa'i sgras nye bar gdags su rung ba ni 'di kha yin gyi /
translated: The word from is used because the Sugata exists prior to the accomplishment.

original: gzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: It is proper to designate the teacher's voice as accomplished because it is like an accomplished voice, but not because it is like a face.üîΩThe word face is used because it is like a face.

original: gal te 'di rgyu nyid yin pas kyang bsgrub par bya ba kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'di rgyu nyid yin pas kyang bsgrub par bya ba kho na ma yin nam zhe na /

original: gnyis po 'di ji ltar ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di ji ltar ni zhes gsungs so //

original: gnyis po 'di ji ltar rgyu yin pa de ltar ni de ma thag tu bshad zin to //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di ji ltar rgyu yin pa de ltar ni de ma thag tu bshad zin to //

original: bshad par ni gsal ba kho na'o //üîΩphyed snga ma bshad nas phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i don du 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: bshad par ni gsal ba kho na'o // phyed snga ma bshad nas phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i don du 'dri ba ni /

original: de'i don nyid ga las she na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩthabs goms pa ston pa'i don yin pa nyid ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs par bskangs nas rtsa bas lan 'debs pa ni de las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i don nyid ga las she na zhes bya ba'o // thabs goms pa ston pa'i don yin pa nyid ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs par bskangs nas rtsa bas lan 'debs pa ni de las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having explained the first half, in order to explain the second half, he asks, What is the meaning of that?üîΩThe root replies, From that.

original: thabs goms pa de las so //
analyzed: thabs goms pa de las so //
translated: From that cultivation of the means.

original: 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ston pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ston pa skye ba'i phyir ro //

original: de nyid las 'byung ba zhes ji ltar shes snyam na /
analyzed: de nyid las 'byung ba zhes ji ltar shes snyam na /

analyzed: thabs goms pa dang blo gsal ba dag las zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: ston @170b pa ni bde bar gshegs pa nyid do //

original: 'dis ni grub las zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni grub las zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //

original: de ci sngon zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyi ston pa yin gyi de nyid ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba 'di ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ci sngon zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyi ston pa yin gyi de nyid ni ma yin gyi zhes bya ba 'di ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //

original: gnyis po 'di ni rgyu ru bshad //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di ni rgyu ru bshad //
translated: These two are explained as the cause.

original: ces bya ba ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa nyid dang / ston pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rgyu phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas 'gro ba la phan par bzhed pa nyid dang / ston pa nyid bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the excellence of the cause, from the point of view of the will to benefit migrating beings and the state of being a teacher.

analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas pa ni ma yin no //

original: des na dngos ma yin no zhes bya bar shes pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos ma yin no zhes bya bar shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that it is not the actual body.

original: rgyu nyid du bshad pa la yang sgrub par byed pa'i dri ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu nyid du bshad pa la yang sgrub par byed pa'i dri ba ni /
translated: The question that is to be established in the explanation of the cause is

analyzed: 'di rgyu bshad do zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: this: ‚ÄúThe cause is explained as that which is called ‚Äòalso.‚Äô‚Äù

original: lan btab pa ni dang po brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan btab pa ni dang po brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚Äúbecause it is mentioned first.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason is stated in the verse: ‚ÄúBecause it is mentioned first.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir na yang dag ces bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa 'dir gnyis po 'di dang por brjod pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir na yang dag ces bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa 'dir gnyis po 'di dang por brjod pa des na /
translated: Since this pair is mentioned first in the verse,

original: de rgyur bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de rgyur bshad pa yin no //
translated: that is the cause.

original: dngos nyid bde bar gshegs pa'i rgyu ci ste ma yin snyam na dngos kyi ston pa ni zhes gsung so /
analyzed: dngos nyid bde bar gshegs pa'i rgyu ci ste ma yin snyam na dngos kyi ston pa ni zhes gsung so /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is the nature of a sugata not the cause?‚Äù the answer is ‚ÄúThe actual teacher . . .‚Äù

analyzed: bdag nyid ni bdag nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi rigs so snyam du dogs so //

original: skabs nye bar sdud par byed pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs nye bar sdud par byed pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary of the section is ‚ÄúTherefore . . .‚Äù

analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos kyi ston pa ni'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not another‚Äù means ‚Äúthe actual teacher.‚Äù

original: bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi rang bzhin brjod pa ni rgyu spangs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi rang bzhin brjod pa ni rgyu spangs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement of the nature of a sugata is ‚ÄúThe cause is abandoned . . .‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
translated: is the cause of suffering.

original: yod tan gsum ni legs pa nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gang la mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: yod tan gsum ni legs pa nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gang la mnga' ba'o //

original: de la re zhig legs pa nyid ston pa ni spangs pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig legs pa nyid ston pa ni spangs pa ni /
translated: Therein, first, the teaching of excellence is the abandonment,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin te /
translated: which is not the basis of suffering.

original: des na legs pa yin no ;
analyzed: des na legs pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, it is good.

original: ; gal te der gyur na legs par 'gyur ba zhig na de nyid ji ltar snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: ; gal te der gyur na legs par 'gyur ba zhig na de nyid ji ltar snyam du dogs na /

original: de ni bdag med pa'am zhes gtan tshigs gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni bdag med pa'am zhes gtan tshigs gnyis gsungs so //
translated: There are two reasons stated: ‚ÄúIt is the selflessness, or . . . ‚Äù

original: gal te sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin pa las spangs pa gzhan yan legs pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal gyi rten ma yin pa las spangs pa gzhan yan legs pa nyid ma yin nam /

original: des na 'di brjod pas ci zhig bya snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: des na 'di brjod pas ci zhig bya snyam du dogs na /
translated: then what is the point of stating this?

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin na ni //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin na ni //
translated: If one grasps at self and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: he is not liberated from suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gang yin pa de spangs pa de sdug bsngal dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gang yin pa de spangs pa de sdug bsngal dang bcas pa yin no //

original: des na legs pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na legs pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not good.

original: gal te bdag tu 'dzin pa yod kyang gcig pu bde bar gnas pa ma @171a * //
analyzed: gal te bdag tu 'dzin pa yod kyang gcig pu bde bar gnas pa ma @171a * //
translated: If there is self-grasping, how can one abide in happiness alone?

original: yin nam / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni 'du 'dzi yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du gzhan sems pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: yin nam / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni 'du 'dzi yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du gzhan sems pa'i dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Because the cause of suffering is social interaction.

original: bdag dang bdag gi bar 'dzin na ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi bar 'dzin na ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one grasps ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù

original: ma 'dres pa yul dang bral ba gcig bu ni mi dgos te de ni gnyis pa 'dod do zhes bya ba lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa yul dang bral ba gcig bu ni mi dgos te de ni gnyis pa 'dod do zhes bya ba lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ci spangs pa thams cad mthong ba las 'gyur ram snyam na /

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes gsungs so //

original: gal te sbyor ba zhes bya ba ci la brjod na /
analyzed: gal te sbyor ba zhes bya ba ci la brjod na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhat is called ‚Äòpractice‚Äô?‚ÄùüîΩFrom what does the mass of afflictions come?

original: gang las nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'ong ba yin snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: gang las nyon mongs pa'i tshogs 'ong ba yin snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Anticipating this doubt, it is said:

original: sbyor ba ni goms pa ste zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni goms pa ste zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúPractice is familiarization.‚Äù

original: yu dza ni ting 'dzin la bya'o zhes bya ba 'di bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yu dza ni ting 'dzin la bya'o zhes bya ba 'di bzung ba'i phyir ro //

original: sbyor ba ni goms pa ste sgom pa yin la /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni goms pa ste sgom pa yin la /

original: bsgom pas yang spang bar bya ba'i tshogs so zhes bya ba ni spong ba zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: bsgom pas yang spang bar bya ba'i tshogs so zhes bya ba ni spong ba zhes 'brel to //
translated: The collection that is to be abandoned by the path of meditation is the collection that is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Afflictions are of two types:

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: those to be abandoned by the path of seeing and those to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni mthong bas spong la /
analyzed: de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni mthong bas spong la /
translated: Those that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing are abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de dag ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: Those that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation are abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: des na mthong ba dang sbyor ba'i sgra gnyis ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam rjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zlos pa'i dogs pa med do //
analyzed: des na mthong ba dang sbyor ba'i sgra gnyis ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam rjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zlos pa'i dogs pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no repetition to be suspected, since the terms seeing and application express the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: yang na bdag med pa mthong ba'am zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: yang na bdag med pa mthong ba'am zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis so //
translated: Or, seeing selflessness is by another, i.e., the path of meditation.

original: 'dod pa'i bdag dngos po med brjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir na bdag med pa ma bsdus pas de bstan pa'i don du yang sbyor ba ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bdag dngos po med brjod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir na bdag med pa ma bsdus pas de bstan pa'i don du yang sbyor ba ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since the self of the desire realm is not included in the selflessness of the person, the phrase ‚Äúin order to demonstrate that‚Äù is applied.

original: phan tshun ldan zhes bya ba ni yu dzi ni ldan pa la'o zhes bya ba 'di bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ldan zhes bya ba ni yu dzi ni ldan pa la'o zhes bya ba 'di bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmutually endowed‚Äù is used because the root text has the word yuj, which means ‚Äúto be endowed.‚Äù

original: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin dang / de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin dang / de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nondual nature and the valid knowledge that establishes it will be explained later.

original: yang na bdag med pa mthong ba'am zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos sogs pa'i bdag med pa gnyis mngon du byas pa brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na bdag med pa mthong ba'am zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos sogs pa'i bdag med pa gnyis mngon du byas pa brjod pa yin la /
translated: Or, the phrase ‚Äúseeing selflessness‚Äù refers to the noble listeners and so on who have realized the two types of selflessness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag med pa de la sbyor ba ldan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag med pa de la sbyor ba ldan pa ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas are endowed with the practice of that selflessness.

original: shes pa byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa byed pa yin gyi /
translated: They are the agents of the knowledge of that selflessness.

original: mngon du byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon du byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not the agents of the realization of that selflessness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma thob bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'das par thal ba pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma thob bar du yongs su mya ngan las 'das par thal ba pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would follow that they would attain nirvana before they attain the qualities of a buddha.

original: 'dis ni khyab 'jug gi 'jig rten du song ba @171b las thar bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba de gsal ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni khyab 'jug gi 'jig rten du song ba @171b las thar bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba de gsal ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This clarifies the statement, ‚ÄúBy this, one is freed from going to the world of Vishnu.‚Äù

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i rang bzhin mi shes pas 'dri ba ni phyir mi ldog pa de gang yin zhe na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i rang bzhin mi shes pas 'dri ba ni phyir mi ldog pa de gang yin zhe na zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he does not know the nature of the non-returner, he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is a non-returner?‚Äù

original: 'dir de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo bzlog pa dang bcad pa bshad pa ni skye dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo bzlog pa dang bcad pa bshad pa ni skye dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the nature of that is explained in terms of reversal and cessation: ‚Äúbirth, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag gi ba la sos par lta ba'i snying po can gyi kun du rtog pa de dag spang ba ni sngar 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi ba la sos par lta ba'i snying po can gyi kun du rtog pa de dag spang ba ni sngar 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The conception that has the core of the view of ‚Äúmine‚Äù does not occur earlier,

original: sa bon med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩskyon med pa'i gnas skabs ni thar ba'i grong khyer du son pa yin no zhes 'brel te /
analyzed: sa bon med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to // skyon med pa'i gnas skabs ni thar ba'i grong khyer du son pa yin no zhes 'brel te /
translated: because it is without seed. This is the meaning.üîΩThe state of faultlessness is the arrival at the city of liberation.

original: skye ba med pa yang thar pa'i grong khyer du son pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba med pa yang thar pa'i grong khyer du son pa yin no //
translated: The non-arising of the conception that has the core of the view of ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the arrival at the city of liberation.

original: 'o na ji ltar slar ldog yin snyam na bshad zin pa'i don nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir nyes pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar slar ldog yin snyam na bshad zin pa'i don nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir nyes pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But how can there be a return? In order to clarify the meaning that has already been explained, he says, ‚Äúbecause of the absence of faults.‚Äù

original: nyes pa med pa'i gnas skabs de yang ga las 'gyur ba yin snyam na /
analyzed: nyes pa med pa'i gnas skabs de yang ga las 'gyur ba yin snyam na /
translated: And from what does that state of the absence of faults come about?

original: bdag du lta ba med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag du lta ba med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the absence of the view of a self.‚Äù

original: skye ba med pa la yang gtan tshigs brjod pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa la yang gtan tshigs brjod pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And the reason for the absence of birth is stated: ‚Äúbecause of the absence of afflictions.‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang nyon mongs ba med pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba dang nyon mongs ba med pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of the absence of the view of a self and the absence of afflictions.

original: gal te bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa med kyang las ma zad pa'i phyir na ci ltar slar mi ldog pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: gal te bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa med kyang las ma zad pa'i phyir na ci ltar slar mi ldog pa yin snyam na /
translated: But if the view of a self and so on do not exist, how can there be a return, since karma has not been exhausted?

original: skye ba ni gnyis la rag las pa'i phyir las yod pas 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba ni gnyis la rag las pa'i phyir las yod pas 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhow can there be birth?‚Äù is that since karma exists, how can there be birth, since birth depends on two things?

original: gal te bdag dang bdag gi rang gi ngo bos mthong ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te bdag dang bdag gi rang gi ngo bos mthong ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /
translated: If the view of a self and the view of mine do not exist, how can there be the afflictions of desire and so on?

original: 'on kyang bde bsgrub par byed pa la sogs par shes pas sam /
analyzed: 'on kyang bde bsgrub par byed pa la sogs par shes pas sam /
translated: But it is known to be the means of achieving pleasure, etc.

original: chags pa'i yul nyid kyis sam chags pa'i snying po can nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: chags pa'i yul nyid kyis sam chags pa'i snying po can nyid kyis yin no //
translated: or it is the very object of attachment, or it is the very essence of attachment.

original: des na de nyid spang bar bya ba yin gyi /üîΩrang gi ngo bo ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu bas /
analyzed: des na de nyid spang bar bya ba yin gyi / rang gi ngo bo ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu bas /
translated: Therefore, it is just that which is to be abandoned,üîΩnot its own nature.

original: bdag tu lta bar yang med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag tu lta bar yang med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to anticipate this doubt, he says, ‚Äúbecause there is no view of self.‚Äù

original: bdag tu lta ba med pa'i phyir te ldog pas gzhan gang zhig las nyon mongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba med pa'i phyir te ldog pas gzhan gang zhig las nyon mongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Because there is no view of self, by what other means would the afflictions arise?

original: bdag tu lta ba kho na las nyon mongs pa 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba kho na las nyon mongs pa 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the afflictions arise just from the view of self.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the latent impressions of the view of self are abandoned,üîΩthe author of the sutra says by implication, ‚Äúhe does not return again,‚Äù but not explicitly.

original: slar mi gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi shus kyi mdo mdzad pas brjod kyi dngos su ni ma yin no zhes brjod de zhes bya ba yin no /
analyzed: slar mi gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gi shus kyi mdo mdzad pas brjod kyi dngos su ni ma yin no zhes brjod de zhes bya ba yin no /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni bdag la phan 'dogs las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni bdag la phan 'dogs las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The same is expressed in the line, ‚Äúfrom the benefit for the self.‚Äù

original: bdag sogs @172a * //üîΩzhes sogs kyi sgras ni bdag gi bsdu'o //
analyzed: bdag sogs @172a * // zhes sogs kyi sgras ni bdag gi bsdu'o //
translated: The words I and so on include mine.

original: bdag la zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: The words to me will be explained.

original: bdag la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa de gnyis la go rims bzhin du chags pa dang ldan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa de gnyis la go rims bzhin du chags pa dang ldan pa dag yin no //
translated: These two, benefit and harm, are, respectively, the objects of attachment and aversion.

original: gang gis nyes pa rnams kyi skabs su mi 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis nyes pa rnams kyi skabs su mi 'gyur ba /
translated: By what means is there no opportunity for faults?

original: gti mug nyid ji ltar med snyam na /
analyzed: gti mug nyid ji ltar med snyam na /
translated: How is there no delusion?

original: de ni bdag med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni bdag med pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, when there is no self.

original: chos bdag med pa mthong na ni gti mug shin tu yang ldog go zhes bshad pa ni gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa mthong na ni gti mug shin tu yang ldog go zhes bshad pa ni gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When there is the insight into the selflessness of things, delusion is completely eliminated. This is called nonduality.

original: gal te bdag med pa cig shes mthong ba dag gnod byed du mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te bdag med pa cig shes mthong ba dag gnod byed du mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If one knows and sees selflessness, is there not the same harm?

original: des na ji ltar bdag med par mthong ba cig shos kyi gnod byed yin pa de bzhin du mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: des na ji ltar bdag med par mthong ba cig shos kyi gnod byed yin pa de bzhin du mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as the insight into selflessness is the harm to the other, so the other is the harm to the insight into selflessness.

original: des na nyes ba rnams slar ldog pa yin no snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: des na nyes ba rnams slar ldog pa yin no snyam du dogs na /
translated: Thus, faults are eliminated.

original: gal te zhes smras so //
analyzed: gal te zhes smras so //
translated: If one thinks this, it is said, If...

original: phyir mi ldog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyir ldog pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyir ldog pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not irreversible‚Äù means it is reversible.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni phyir ldog pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni phyir ldog pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of the reversibility.

original: 'on te lus pa gzhan ldog pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te lus pa gzhan ldog pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that something else remains,

original: slar ldog pa las lus pa gzhan ni med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: slar ldog pa las lus pa gzhan ni med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThere is nothing else remaining apart from the reversal.‚Äù

original: slar ldog pa nyid lus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: slar ldog pa nyid lus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the very reversal remains.

original: yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yul can nyid kyi stobs mtshungs ba nyid ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yul can nyid kyi stobs mtshungs ba nyid ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: He answers that the object of the correct view and the object of the incorrect view are not equal in strength.

original: 'dir 'di skad brjod de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad brjod de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúHere it is said.‚Äù

original: bdag med par mthong ba de ni bden pa'i phyir dang / tha dad pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir gnod byed yin no //üîΩbdag tu lta ba ni cig shos kyis ma yin te //
analyzed: bdag med par mthong ba de ni bden pa'i phyir dang / tha dad pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir gnod byed yin no // bdag tu lta ba ni cig shos kyis ma yin te //
translated: The view of selflessness is a harm to the view of the transitory collection because it is true, because it is different, and because it is itself.

original: de las ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is not the opposite of that.

original: 'o na lus pa gang yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na lus pa gang yin snyam na /
translated: If you think that something else remains,

original: lus ngag ces gsungs so ;
analyzed: lus ngag ces gsungs so ;
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe body and speech.‚Äù

original: ; phyin ci log tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba phyir de las ldog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ; phyin ci log tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba phyir de las ldog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is erroneous means because it is contradictory. Because it is the opposite of that means because it is the opposite of that.üîΩ

original: bden pa nyid dang 'gal ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa nyid dang 'gal ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is in error means because it is contradictory. Because it is the opposite of that means because it is not contradictory to reality.

original: de ltar bden pa dang tha dad pa'i sgra dag bshad nas /üîΩbdag nyid kyi sgra 'chad pa ni tha dad pa'i bdag nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar bden pa dang tha dad pa'i sgra dag bshad nas / bdag nyid kyi sgra 'chad pa ni tha dad pa'i bdag nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, having explained the words ‚Äúdifferent from reality,‚ÄùüîΩhe explains the word ‚Äúown‚Äù: ‚Äúdifferent in nature‚Äù means

original: bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa sgra dang bcad te rjes su brjod do //
analyzed: bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa sgra dang bcad te rjes su brjod do //
translated: because it is included, it is stated as different, with the word ‚Äúown‚Äù elided.

original: de la bden pa dang 'gal bdag ni tshad ma dang bcas pa'i phyir nye bar bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: de la bden pa dang 'gal bdag ni tshad ma dang bcas pa'i phyir nye bar bstan pa yin la /
translated: There, the contradiction with reality is taught because it is established by valid cognition.

original: bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ni 'bad pas bzlog par bya ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ni 'bad pas bzlog par bya ba yin par bstan to //
translated: The contradiction with the own nature is taught because it is to be refuted with effort.

original: 'on te bdag tu lta ba yang da bzhin du 'gyur ba des na gnod par @172b byed pa yin no snyam na bdag tu lta ba ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te bdag tu lta ba yang da bzhin du 'gyur ba des na gnod par @172b byed pa yin no snyam na bdag tu lta ba ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if you think that the view of self is also like that, then it is a fault, he says, ‚ÄúThe view of self is not a contradiction with reality.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir snyam na bdag med pa'i phyir te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam na bdag med pa'i phyir te zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why? Because of the absence of self.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: If, on the other hand, it is the other‚Äôs,

original: nyon mongs pas byas pa ni lus dang ngag dang sems kyi gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas byas pa ni lus dang ngag dang sems kyi gnas ngan len to //
translated: the affliction is the negative reflex action of body, speech, and mind.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúNo, because there is no turning back.‚Äù

original: slar ldog pa med pas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: slar ldog pa med pas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no affliction because there is no turning back.

original: phyir na med pa yongs su gdung ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: phyir na med pa yongs su gdung ba med pa yin te /
translated: The reason is: ‚Äúbecause there is no existence.‚Äù

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su gdung ba dang 'bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su gdung ba dang 'bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no torment because there is no existence, because one is free from the torment of the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de yang bag chags tsam dang 'brel ba las lus la sogs pa mi mthun par 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de yang bag chags tsam dang 'brel ba las lus la sogs pa mi mthun par 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: Moreover, it is only through the connection with the mere latent impressions that there is the incompatibility with the body, etc. This is the remainder.

original: lam bshad mi gsal bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i lam gyi rnam pa thams cad ston pa la mi gsal ba mtshon pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni lam gyi rnam pa du ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lam bshad mi gsal bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i lam gyi rnam pa thams cad ston pa la mi gsal ba mtshon pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni lam gyi rnam pa du ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since the path is not clearly explained, the nonclarity in the teaching of all the aspects of the path of cause and effect is indicated. This is what is meant by ‚Äúthe many aspects of the path.‚Äù

original: rnam pa dang ma brjod pa las mi gsal ba ni nges par brjod pa las te ma lus par ston pa la mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang ma brjod pa las mi gsal ba ni nges par brjod pa las te ma lus par ston pa la mi gsal ba'o //
translated: The unclear from the aspect and the unexpressed is from the definite expression, i.e., the unclear in the complete teaching.

original: 'on zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar lus pa srid na'o //
analyzed: 'on zhes bya ba ni gal te de ltar lus pa srid na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut‚Äù means if there is such a possibility of incompleteness.

original: de'i tshe gang las yod pa yin te ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe gang las yod pa yin te ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, from what is there existence? There is not, is the meaning.

original: ji ltar mi yong snyam na bdag med pas zhes smras so //
analyzed: ji ltar mi yong snyam na bdag med pas zhes smras so //
translated: How is there no existence? It is said, ‚Äúbecause of selflessness.‚Äù

original: spong ba la ni zhes gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yang yod pa yin te de'i phyir yang de srid pa ma yin no zhes bshad pas ni /
analyzed: spong ba la ni zhes gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yang yod pa yin te de'i phyir yang de srid pa ma yin no zhes bshad pas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the rejection‚Äù means that there is also a valid cognition that refutes, and therefore it is explained that existence is not possible.

original: ji srid smra ba de srid du ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji srid smra ba de srid du ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor as long as there is speech‚Äù means for as long as there is the speech.

original: kho bo cag la sogs pa la smra ba po nyid ni nyes pa dang ldan pas khyab pa yin te 'dod chags dang bral ba rdo'i dum bu las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag la sogs pa la smra ba po nyid ni nyes pa dang ldan pas khyab pa yin te 'dod chags dang bral ba rdo'i dum bu las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The speaker himself is pervaded by the fault in us, etc., because of being free from attachment, like a piece of stone.

original: yang 'bras bu smra bas rgyun rnam par rtog pa go bar byed do zhes smras pa ni //
analyzed: yang 'bras bu smra bas rgyun rnam par rtog pa go bar byed do zhes smras pa ni //
translated: Again, the proponent of the effect says that the continuum is understood by the conception.

original: smra ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smra ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The speaker is the one who speaks.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi rnam pa la don du ldan par zhe na 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi rnam pa la don du ldan par zhe na 'khrul pa yin te /

analyzed: gal te bdag dang bdag gir lta ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ma yin gyi /

analyzed: 'on kyang bde ba dang gzhan gyi sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'dzin pa dang dran pa yin no //

analyzed: ci ste bdag la sogs pa lta ba spang pa la nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ma dmigs so snyam du dogs pa bsu nas ;

analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ni ma yin te /

original: rig byed kyi tshad mas gnod pa'i don ston pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa ni tshad ma ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig byed kyi tshad mas gnod pa'i don ston pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa ni tshad ma ni zhes bya ba'o //

original: phyin ci log ces bya ba ni rig byed dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: phyin ci log ces bya ba ni rig byed dang 'gal lo //

original: rig byed ni tshad ma ma yin te skyob pa nyid med pas dor ba'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig byed ni tshad ma ma yin te skyob pa nyid med pas dor ba'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Veda is not a means of valid knowledge, because it is a limb to be discarded, since it does not have a protector.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni tshad ma yin te zlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni tshad ma yin te zlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Bhagavat is a means of valid knowledge, because he is the opposite of that.

original: nya phyis la dngul gyi shes pa thob pa tsam gyis mi 'dor ba ma yin bas de bzhin du rig byed @174b kyang yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /

original: bcom ldan 'das ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la ni skyob pa nyid mnga' ba'i phyir na bzlog pa'i gnod par byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /

original: skyob pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyob pa zhes bya ba'o //

original: di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: di'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /

analyzed: nyid gzigs sam gsung ba zhes bya ba'o // tshig ni mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong ste /

analyzed: gal te slu ba'i bsam pa can la ni gzhan du yang mthong ba yin no snyam na /

analyzed: snying rje can yang dgos pa med par ni gzhan gyi don tsam du smra ba ma yin no snyam du dogs na /

original: thug brtser ldan phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thug brtser ldan phyir zhes gsungs so //

original: gzhan gyi don du zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du zhes bya ba ni //

analyzed: tshig gi byed pa gang la yod pa zhes khyad par du byas pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
