translated: Those who have it are called ‚Äúsamsaric.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is the reason.

original: phung po zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: phung po zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: The subject is called ‚Äúaggregates.‚Äù

original: 'khor ba can nyid ni ji ltar 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: 'khor ba can nyid ni ji ltar 'grub snyam na /
translated: How is it established that they are samsaric?

original: goms las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: goms las zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúfrom habituation.‚Äù

original: 'du byed kyis bsdus pa'i yid kyi goms pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal ba khyad par du gyur pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyis bsdus pa'i yid kyi goms pa las 'dod chags la sogs pa gsal ba khyad par du gyur pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because attachment and so on are seen to be manifest from the mental habit that is included in the formative forces.

original: gzhan las 'byung ba ni nges pa des khyad par du 'phags pa de ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las 'byung ba ni nges pa des khyad par du 'phags pa de ma yin no //
translated: They do not arise from another because that which is to be distinguished by that certainty does not exist.

original: 'dod rgyal du glo bur bar skye ba ma yin te /üîΩ'bras bu skye ba 'gal phyir te med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod rgyal du glo bur bar skye ba ma yin te / 'bras bu skye ba 'gal phyir te med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not arise fortuitously,

original: rgyu med par ni 'bras bu 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: rgyu med par ni 'bras bu 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: because the arising of an effect is contradictory, i.e. impossible, in the absence of a cause.

original: rtag tu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to arise in the absence of a cause, it would be permanent, i.e. it would always exist.

original: yang na rgyu med par te rgyu'i dngos po med pa las skye ba 'byung ba 'gal ba'i phyir te med pa'i phyir te rtag tu yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na rgyu med par te rgyu'i dngos po med pa las skye ba 'byung ba 'gal ba'i phyir te med pa'i phyir te rtag tu yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, because the arising of an effect is contradictory, i.e. impossible, in the absence of a cause, i.e. in the absence of the causal entity, it would be permanent, i.e. it would always exist.

original: bshad pa mdzad pas ni 'khor ba can nyid sdug bsngal ba nyid dang 'gal ba yin te bzlog pas khyab pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa ni gal te 'dod chags zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa mdzad pas ni 'khor ba can nyid sdug bsngal ba nyid dang 'gal ba yin te bzlog pas khyab pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa ni gal te 'dod chags zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The author of the commentary explains that the arising of an effect is contradictory, i.e. impossible, in the absence of a cause, i.e. in the absence of the causal entity, because it is pervaded by the opposite, i.e. by the existence of a cause.

original: zhe sdang yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhe sdang yang bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Hatred is also a cause of pleasure.

original: bde ba nyid yin zhing zhes bya bar rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: bde ba nyid yin zhing zhes bya bar rjes su 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is pleasure itself.üîΩHow can the body, etc. be pleasure?

original: 'o na lus la sogs pa ji ltar bde ba yin snyam 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na lus la sogs pa ji ltar bde ba yin snyam 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that they are because of attachment, hatred, etc.

original: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Suchness is called pleasure because it is the cause of pleasure.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni thams cad bde ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni thams cad bde ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas na'o //
translated: Therefore, all of them are the cause of pleasure.

original: bstan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bshad pa'o //
translated: The teaching is the explanation of the truth of suffering.

original: de la re zhig bde ba'i rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang 'gal ba ma yin te lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la re zhig bde ba'i rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang 'gal ba ma yin te lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that regard, the aspect of pleasure is not contradictory to the aspect of suffering because they coexist.

original: 'on kyang ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang ma nges pa yin te /
translated: However, it is uncertain.

original: dug dang bcas pa'i zas bzhin du sdug bsngal du ro gcig pa'i phyir na blang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni 'khor ba'i lam du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dug dang bcas pa'i zas bzhin du sdug bsngal du ro gcig pa'i phyir na blang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni 'khor ba'i lam du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Like food mixed with poison, it is not to be accepted because it is of the same taste as suffering. This is explained in the verse: ‚ÄúIn the path of cyclic existence.‚Äù

original: 'o na ji ltar phung po rnams la bde ba nyid du mthong snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar phung po rnams la bde ba nyid du mthong snyam na /
translated: Well then, how is it that the aggregates are seen as happiness?

original: ma rigs pas ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma rigs pas ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBy the non-cognizant.‚Äù

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni bde ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni bde ba nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means as happiness.

original: 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ba med do zhes bya ba @176b bsal te /
analyzed: 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa zhes bya ba med do zhes bya ba @176b bsal te /
translated: This refutes the statement, ‚ÄúThere is no such thing as the truth of suffering.‚Äù

original: rtsod pa lhag ma bsal ba'i don du dran par byed pa ni /
analyzed: rtsod pa lhag ma bsal ba'i don du dran par byed pa ni /
translated: In order to resolve the remaining objections, it is said,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bde ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bde ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe happiness of attachment, etc.‚Äù

original: phung po rnams la bde ba'i rnam pa yang dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po rnams la bde ba'i rnam pa yang dngos po ma yin te /
translated: The aggregates are not the reality of happiness,

original: goms pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise from habituation.

original: ri dags shor ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don can 'dod chags la sogs pa bde ba'i zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni 'dod chags goms pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ri dags shor ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don can 'dod chags la sogs pa bde ba'i zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni 'dod chags goms pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúlike the happiness of hunting, etc.‚Äù is explained in ‚ÄúThe happiness of attachment, etc.‚Äù

original: de med mi 'byung ni 'dod chags med na mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de med mi 'byung ni 'dod chags med na mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat does not occur without that‚Äù means that does not occur without attachment.

original: ngo bo nyid du grub min zhes bya ba ni sa bon la sogs pa las myu gu la sogs pa ltar goms pa la ma ltos par mi skye ba'o ;
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du grub min zhes bya ba ni sa bon la sogs pa las myu gu la sogs pa ltar goms pa la ma ltos par mi skye ba'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúNot established in reality‚Äù means that, like a sprout from a seed, it does not arise without depending on cultivation.

original: / gal te rgyu la mi ltos pa'am rtag pa yin na ni de'i tshe rnam pa gzhan med pas na dor bar mi nus pa don dam par yang 'gyur ba zhig go zhes bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: / gal te rgyu la mi ltos pa'am rtag pa yin na ni de'i tshe rnam pa gzhan med pas na dor bar mi nus pa don dam par yang 'gyur ba zhig go zhes bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it did not depend on a cause or were permanent, then, since it would not have another aspect, it would be undropped, and it would be ultimate.üîΩThis is explained in the line ‚ÄúIf it were so. . . .‚Äù

original: de'i tshe ni 'dod chags la sogs pa don dam par yod do zhes bya ba 'thad pa zhig na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni 'dod chags la sogs pa don dam par yod do zhes bya ba 'thad pa zhig na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then it would be tenable to say that attachment and so on exist ultimately.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las 'byung ba yin na ni yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las 'byung ba yin na ni yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If attachment and so on arose from cultivation, they would be unreal.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni'o //
translated: This is stated in the line ‚ÄúWhen. . . .‚Äù

original: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni goms pa nyid las so //
analyzed: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni goms pa nyid las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that itself‚Äù means from cultivation itself.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is the reason why attachment and so on are unreal.

original: kun du rtog pa tsam yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa tsam yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is mere imagination, not ultimate.

original: de lta na'ang de ji ltar 'di snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na'ang de ji ltar 'di snyam na /
translated: Even so, how is that?

original: des na goms zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na goms zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthrough cultivation.‚Äù

original: rgyu dor bas 'bras bu dor bar sla ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dor bas 'bras bu dor bar sla ba yin no //
translated: It is easy to abandon a result when its cause is abandoned.

original: des na zhes bya ba goms pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba goms pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because it depends on cultivation.

original: don dam pa yin na ni goms pa la rag las pa nyid med pa'i phyir na mi spong ba yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa yin na ni goms pa la rag las pa nyid med pa'i phyir na mi spong ba yin no //
translated: If it were ultimate, it would not be abandoned because it would not depend on cultivation.

original: de la rag las pa yin na ni /
analyzed: de la rag las pa yin na ni /
translated: If it depended on that,

original: de med pas med pa'i phyir don dam par yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de med pas med pa'i phyir don dam par yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: it would not exist ultimately because it would not exist without that. This is the intended meaning.

original: sems mngon par dga' ba'i rang bzhin yid kyi bde ba yang goms pa las byung ba yin gyi dngos po pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni sems dga' ba'i zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: sems mngon par dga' ba'i rang bzhin yid kyi bde ba yang goms pa las byung ba yin gyi dngos po pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni sems dga' ba'i zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: Mental pleasure, which is the nature of mental satisfaction, also arises from cultivation, not from a real entity. This is stated in ‚Äúmental satisfaction.‚Äù

original: /'o na gang du goms pa bsgrub par bya ba yin snyam na /
analyzed: /'o na gang du goms pa bsgrub par bya ba yin snyam na /
translated: If so, where is cultivation to be accomplished?

original: 'khor ba'i chos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the phenomena of cyclic existence.

original: gal te kho na goms pa zhes bya ba btang snyoms su gnas pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: gal te kho na goms pa zhes bya ba btang snyoms su gnas pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: If you think that the cause of equanimity is the repeated practice of that,

original: 'dod pa yang bde ba nyid yin gyi btang snyoms pa ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /üîΩdes na ji ltar 'dod pa ma yin pa'i @177a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa yang bde ba nyid yin gyi btang snyoms pa ni ma yin pa ma yin nam / des na ji ltar 'dod pa ma yin pa'i @177a * //
translated: and that pleasure is not equanimity,

original: rgyu la goms pa bsgrub par bya snyam na /
analyzed: rgyu la goms pa bsgrub par bya snyam na /
translated: then how can you establish the repeated practice of that which is not a cause?

original: bde ba yang goms pa las 'dod pa yin te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bde ba yang goms pa las 'dod pa yin te zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that pleasure is also desire due to repeated practice.

original: de kho na goms pa las ni sems mngon par dga' ba'i mtshan nyid btang snyoms nyid 'dod pa mchog yin te /
analyzed: de kho na goms pa las ni sems mngon par dga' ba'i mtshan nyid btang snyoms nyid 'dod pa mchog yin te /
translated: But the highest desire is equanimity, which is characterized by the mind's delight in repeated practice of reality.

original: 'di ni ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is irreversible.

original: 'di thams cad ni gdung ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir bde bar mngon par rlom ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /üîΩde ltar yin dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni gdung ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir bde bar mngon par rlom ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni / de ltar yin dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: All of this is said to be the antidote to distress, and is therefore considered to be pleasure, but not by its intrinsic nature.

original: bde ba don dam pa par ma gyur na'o //
analyzed: bde ba don dam pa par ma gyur na'o //
translated: This is the case, but not if pleasure is not ultimate.

original: gal te goms pa las 'dod chags pa'i gdung ba skyed nas gdung ba de nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba bskyed pa'i don du bud med dang 'khyud pa la sogs pa bya ba yin te nyes pa ci zhig tu 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te goms pa las 'dod chags pa'i gdung ba skyed nas gdung ba de nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba bskyed pa'i don du bud med dang 'khyud pa la sogs pa bya ba yin te nyes pa ci zhig tu 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think that there is no fault in the act of embracing a woman, etc. in order to generate the pleasure of the pacification of the torment of passion that arises from habituation,

original: blo bzang 'ga' yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: blo bzang 'ga' yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: [we reply:] there is no one so foolish.

original: gal te de kho na dang gzhan la mngon par dga' ba dag goms pa las byung ba nyid kyi dngos po du ma yin par khyad med na ji ltar de kho na nyid la goms pa nyid mchog yin no zhes brjod snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: gal te de kho na dang gzhan la mngon par dga' ba dag goms pa las byung ba nyid kyi dngos po du ma yin par khyad med na ji ltar de kho na nyid la goms pa nyid mchog yin no zhes brjod snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: If there is no difference in the many things that arise from habituation to the delight in reality and in the delight in what is other, why is it that habituation to reality alone is supreme?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that,

original: de'i tshe de nyid la dga' ba'i blo de ni 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid la dga' ba'i blo de ni 'gyur ba med de /
translated: then the mind that delights in reality does not change.

original: gnod pa byed pa med par rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa med par rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is permanent, since it is not harmed.

original: gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: The other is not,

original: yul med pas ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul med pas ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it ceases due to the absence of an object.

original: de ltar ni ci zhig 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar ni ci zhig 'grub snyam na /
translated: What is accomplished by that?

original: de las zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de las zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said:

original: 'gyur ba med pa las so //üîΩde nyid ma yin pa la mngon par dga' ba'i bde ba ni ldog pa'i chos can yin no zhes gsungs pa ni gal te de nyid ma ni dga' na zhes gsungs so //üîΩde'i tshe de nyid ma yin pa log na bde ba de ga la yod de med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa las so // de nyid ma yin pa la mngon par dga' ba'i bde ba ni ldog pa'i chos can yin no zhes gsungs pa ni gal te de nyid ma ni dga' na zhes gsungs so // de'i tshe de nyid ma yin pa log na bde ba de ga la yod de med pa nyid do //
translated: from the unchanging.üîΩThe pleasure that is not of that nature is subject to reversal.üîΩIf it were of that nature, then when it is reversed, how could that pleasure exist? It would not!

original: gal te de ltar na de nyid log na'am bde ba ldog par ci ste mi 'gyur snyam na de nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na de nyid log na'am bde ba ldog par ci ste mi 'gyur snyam na de nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: If you think that if it is of that nature, then when it is reversed, why would the pleasure not be reversed? He says, ‚Äúit is of that nature.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ldog ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ldog ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because it is subject to reversal.

original: gal te sdug bsngal bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin na /
translated: If you say that pleasure is pleasure because it is the cause of pleasure,

original: bde ba gang sdug bsngal ba ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: bde ba gang sdug bsngal ba ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs na /
translated: how could pleasure be suffering?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you think that, he says, ‚Äúit is like this.‚Äù

original: bral ba na zhes bya ba ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: bral ba na zhes bya ba ni bde ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen separated‚Äù means ‚Äúwhen there is pleasure.‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni bral bas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni bral bas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of separation.‚Äù

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba nyid du yin dang ngo //üîΩgal te de ltar phung po rnams sdug bsngal bar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba'am sdug bsngal ba nyid du yin dang ngo // gal te de ltar phung po rnams sdug bsngal bar 'gyur mod /
translated: ‚ÄúIf that were so‚Äù means if pleasure and pain were to exist.

original: 'khor ba can nyid du @177b go ji ltar grub snyam na /
analyzed: 'khor ba can nyid du @177b go ji ltar grub snyam na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf that were so, the aggregates would be suffering, but how is it established that they are of cyclic existence?‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù is stated.

original: goms pa las zhes bya ba ni bsal ba zhes bya ba skabs yin no //
analyzed: goms pa las zhes bya ba ni bsal ba zhes bya ba skabs yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom habituation‚Äù means from cultivation.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de 'khor ba pa yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de 'khor ba pa yang grub pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù is a reason. It is not only suffering, but also cyclic existence is established.

original: 'dod rgyal nyid min te zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel gyi cha bshad pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod rgyal nyid min te zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel gyi cha bshad pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma 'god pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To explain the commentary‚Äôs ‚Äúnot due to chance,‚Äù the opponent‚Äôs position is stated: ‚ÄúIf that were so.‚Äù

original: rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa kho nar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa kho nar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn some way‚Äù means without a cause.

original: goms pa las rgyu gzhan las bsam ste /
analyzed: goms pa las rgyu gzhan las bsam ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom habituation‚Äù means from a cause other than that.

original: sa bon las myu gu ltar ro //
analyzed: sa bon las myu gu ltar ro //
translated: It is like a sprout from a seed.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa nyid dam rgyu gzhan yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa nyid dam rgyu gzhan yin pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of the absence of a cause or another cause.

original: don dam pa nyid ni ldog pa med pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa nyid ni ldog pa med pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: The ultimate is the reality that is not reversed.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don dam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don dam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of the ultimate.

original: rtsod pa gsum pa smras pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa gsum pa smras pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The third objection is stated: ‚ÄúOr, pleasure and so on are not ultimate realities because they are not ultimate realities in the way that suffering is.‚Äù

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni yid bde ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni yid bde ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes mental pleasure and so on.

original: bde ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal don dam pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal don dam pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThey are pleasure itself‚Äù means that they are not ultimate suffering.

analyzed: rtag pa ji ltar khyad par du 'gyur zhes bya ba yang gtam tsam yin te /

original: thams cad de'i gnas skabs @179a * //

original: ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par dbye ba med na rnam par dbye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams ni 'jig pa ma yin te /üîΩcha med pa'i phyir ro snyam na ma yin te /

analyzed: sgra dang blo la sogs pa ltar cha shas med par yang 'jig pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'du byed kyang sdug bsngal ni rgyu'i gzhan dbang nyid do //

analyzed: de mtshan nyid de rang bzhin de nyid gang la yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyor ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir de ni don dam pa las ma yin no zhes kyang grang la zhes gsungs so //

original: de las ni bde ba de ma yin no //
